albums.description: Zaki Ibrahim’s second album is a future-soul marvel that connects sounds across time and oceans, creating thrilling moments of pop music synthesized through her wise and worldly vision.

albums.title: Unsolved Mysteries
albums.label: Ultramajic
albums.description: Discovered gathering dust in an old storage unit, the Detroit artist’s lost album from the ’90s is an interesting curio that slots nicely alongside techno’s current renaissance.

albums.title: Effected
albums.label: Dreamville
albums.description: For his second album on J. Cole’s imprint, Cozz is beginning to build his own style while finding how to maneuver between the boisterous and introspective.

albums.title: Music for the Long Emergency
albums.label: Totally Gross National Product
albums.description: The Minneapolis synth-pop band teams up with a Berlin-based orchestra in an attempt to reckon with the trials of our time.

albums.title: Cranberry
albums.label: Double Double Whammy
albums.description: The Austin indie-pop duo’s music conjures a steady, gentle longing. Foggy, warm, and wistful, it sounds like faded time.

albums.title: Slow Sundown
albums.label: Wharf Cat
albums.description: This Estonian band’s debut album sounds like a long, lonely drive on a moonlit night, with plenty of guitar reverb.

albums.title: The Play Don’t Care Who Makes It EP
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: On his reflective four-song EP, the Atlanta rapper’s hallmark frivolity and infinite swag keep it short and sweet.

albums.title: Order of Torment
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: The D.C. death metal band attacks with pummeling force and socially pointed lyrics, in the tradition of Bolt Thrower and Incantation.

albums.title: Tongue
albums.label: Friends of Friends
albums.description: The Los Angeles-based producer retreats to the hills of Tuscany to further the vision of eclectic mix of woodwinds, synthesizers, and field recordings.

albums.title: Crush EP
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: The Chicago R&B upstart pairs with producer Steve Lacy for five tracks of inventive modernist soul.

albums.title: High Rise II
albums.label: Black Editions
albums.description: Originally released in 1986, the reissue of High Rise II shines a light on an important and fiery document of Japanese psych rock.

albums.title: Black Panther The Album
albums.label: Top Dawg
albums.description: Curated by and largely featuring Kendrick Lamar, the soundtrack is a diverse, daring, and holistic pairing with the blackest movie in the Marvel Comic Universe.

albums.title: Cloud 909
albums.label: Good Vibe Tribe
albums.description: The duo’s grab-bag approach continues on their third studio album, an 18-track marathon with more good than bad but little of substance.

albums.title: Dead Start Program
albums.label: Kompakt
albums.description: The Los Angeles producer’s house and techno is hyper-attuned to the nuances of timbre, giving his music a captivating textural focus even when emotion is in scant supply.

albums.title: Pure Beauty
albums.label: Third Man
albums.description: The first rapper on Jack White’s label, known mostly for the publicity stunts in his past, loves conceptual art, ’90s hip-hop, and grand statements

albums.title: Transangelic Exodus
albums.label: Bella Union
albums.description: The singer-songwriter’s latest album features a sweeping backstory about supernatural queer lovers on the run and a lurid, cinematic new sound.

albums.title: Stankonia
albums.label: La Face
albums.description: What could’ve been a victory lap for two Southern rappers on top of the game was instead a transcendental funk fantasia, an unequivocal commercial and artistic triumph.

albums.title: Posthuman
albums.label: Metal Blade
albums.description: The swole Chicago hardcore band’s latest album shows their raw strength while adding shades of industrial and groove metal for character.

albums.title: Crooked Shadows
albums.label: Fueled by Ramen
albums.description: The emo lifer’s seventh album tries to balance intimacy and accessibility, but he only ends up with the latter.

albums.title: Go Dig My Grave
albums.label: SusannaSonata
albums.description: The Norwegian vocalist offers spare, chilly covers of songs from post-punk Manchester, 1970s New York, and Elizabethan England.

albums.title: How to Measure the Distance Between Lovers EP
albums.label: never_b_alone.mp3
albums.description: The rising EDM star swerves left on an insular, personal record that's more suited for winding down than turning up.

albums.title: Rock Island
albums.label: Carpark
albums.description: On their second album, the wildly inventive art-rock band works harder than ever to unburden itself of the influences heard in its earlier work.

albums.title: The Two Worlds
albums.label: Tompkins Square
albums.description: The second album from the singer-songwriter is a dizzyingly isolated record, spare and serene music that gains momentum as it burrows deeper.

albums.title: Little Dark Age
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: MGMT’s fourth album marks a shift in tactics. Abandoning the belabored excess of their last two albums, they opt for streamlined synth-pop.

albums.title: Drip Season 3
albums.label: YSL
albums.description: This Young Thug protégé’s latest mixtape locks in on a vibe and rolls wherever it goes. Usually it doesn’t go too far.

albums.title: Dream Wife
albums.label: Lucky Number
albums.description: The UK rock band’s debut is a prime example of what happens when you grow up on Bikini Kill and the Slits.

albums.title: Always Ascending
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: At its best, the fifth album from the UK indie-rock stalwarts is sleek, catchy, and enjoyably overwrought, the sound of a snappy hype band no longer burdened by relevance.

albums.title: Metal Aether
albums.label: NNA Tapes
albums.description: The New York composer is an electro-acoustic minimalist who pays special attention to the spaces around her. Her latest album, by turns grounded and disquieting, feels untethered and limitless.

albums.title: Pissing Stars
albums.label: Constellation
albums.description: The Godspeed You! Black Emperor co-founder’s second album searches for love in the middle of a hellscape, with surprising shades of Springsteen.

albums.title: Criminal
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: On his fourth album as the Soft Moon, post-punk auteur Luis Vasquez finally breaks from a whisper into a scream.

albums.title: If You’re Into It, I’m Out of It
albums.label: Cross Fade Entertainment
albums.description: Originally released in 1997, the German producer’s world of mythic drones and breakbeats is newly remastered and remains a blistering and confrontational touchstone of electronic music.

albums.title: There Will Be Rain
albums.label: Grand Closing
albums.description: The Bronx rapper’s second solo album grapples with questions of faith over jazz and gospel production.

albums.title: Early Tape Works (1986-1993) Vol.1
albums.label: Music From Memory
albums.description: Produced using analog synths, drum machines, and four-track tape, these ambient sketches and beat experiments reveal the foundations of the Japanese producer’s later, more elaborate work.

albums.title: Amen
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: The debut from Rich Brian has the fun, wit, and snark of a choice tweet but lacks the essential qualities of a solid well-made rap album.

albums.title: The Book Room
albums.label: Marionette
albums.description: Drawing principally from minimalism, ambient, and krautrock, Swiss producer Benjamin Kilchhofer’s latest is a deeply immersive timbral and tactile experience.

albums.title: ION
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: The Australian band delivers a jarring, dissonant record of non-linear death metal filtered through a necro black-metal screen, with a crisp high end that brings out every jagged turn.

albums.title: Mitteltöner
albums.label: Origin Peoples
albums.description: For his first vinyl release of new music in 25 years, Kerry Leimer makes explicit his debt to kosmische music while recasting these sounds into his own mold.

albums.title: Full Circle Nightmare
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: This Portland songwriter’s second album is full of femme fatales and other clichés dredged from a half-century of classic rock.

albums.title: Microshift
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: The English psych-punks turn down the distortion and face their demons with a new, synth-y sound on their third album.

albums.title: Island Universe Story Four
albums.label: Rvng Intl.
albums.description: Roberto Lange’s fourth installment in his Island Universe series contains subconscious whisperings that provide a map for the music he’s been making as Helado Negro for the last eight years.

albums.title: Blood
albums.label: Loma Vista
albums.description: The second album from Michael Milosh and his soft-rock musicians deftly creates an atmosphere that builds out their sound without adding much underneath.

albums.title: The Well-Tuned Piano 81 X 25 6:17:50 - 11:18:59 PM NYC
albums.label: Gramavision
albums.description: The masterpiece from the preeminent minimalist composer is an as-yet-unfinished piano solo played on a piano tuned specifically to elicit unfamiliar emotions from unfamiliar harmonies.

albums.title: Quit the Curse
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: On her solo debut, the Detroit singer-songwriter cuts with her folk-rock past and turns to 1960s-indebted indie pop and 1990s-schooled alt-rock hooks.

albums.title: Cosmic Crypt
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: Austin musician Chris Ulsh’s longest-running band returns with a revitalized lineup and a new commitment to death metal intensity.

albums.title: 起き上がり
albums.label: Doom Trip
albums.description: Recorded live with no overdubs, Maxwell Allison’s latest electronic album is more groove-oriented than his previous work, his hardware noise sounding both vintage and pristine.

albums.title: Pulse/Quartet
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: Though detailed and accomplished, Steve Reich’s latest work dully reaffirms his place as a centrist in a field of extremists.

albums.title: Outside
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Following an all-too-brief turn on Drake’s More Life, one of Nigeria’s preeminent musical ambassadors shares his own hybrid vision, drawing on Afrobeats, dancehall, and road rap.

albums.title: Man of the Woods
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Justin Timberlake’s fifth album is a huge misstep for the pop star. It is warm, indulgent, inert, and vacuous.

albums.title: Lionheart
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Released on Merge Records, the singer-songwriter’s debut is a gorgeous devotional to the South that reshapes the traditions of country music into a powerfully queer and consequential set of songs.

albums.title: Open Here
albums.label: Memphis Industries
albums.description: The UK art-rock duo’s new album has the earnest directness of artists whose sense of the world has been nudged into focus.

albums.title: Follow Them True
albums.label: From Here
albums.description: Respecting folk music’s past while uprooting it from the pastoral, the UK group’s politically minded album mixes acoustic and electronic instruments across original songs and traditionals.

albums.title: Con Todo El Mundo
albums.label: Night Time Stories Ltd.
albums.description: On their second album, the Houston-based instrumental trio crafts a unique, psychedelic vibe that hangs between continents and eras.

albums.title: D’Agala
albums.label: Intakt
albums.description: The Swiss-born jazz pianist’s second album with this group is animated by a spirit of playful experimentation.

albums.title: Slow Fade EP
albums.label: Phantasy
albums.description: The UK producer expands into ambient territory, finding drama in negative spaces and downtempo explorations.

albums.title: Impossible Star
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Influential sample maestro Jack Dangers’ first album since 2010 is a moody, playful exhibition of his strengths.

albums.title: Veteran
albums.label: Deathbomb Arc
albums.description: The 28-year-old rapper’s latest album is a glitchy, frantic, confrontational album on both a musical and political level. It feels born of an internet wasteland.

albums.title: Aren’t U Glad You’re U?
albums.label: Odd Future
albums.description: The sleepiest rapper in Odd Future teams up with an old-school mentor for a short, low-stakes mixtape.

albums.title: Young & Reckless
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: On an unexpected collaborative mixtape, the two previously unconnected rappers hone their complementary styles in gloomy songs shot through with paranoia.

albums.title: Oh My
albums.label: Father/Daughter
albums.description: On their debut as a trio, Phantom Posse singer-songwriter Nadia Hulett and members of Ava Luna play with open-ended questions and experimental pop zest.

albums.title: Culture II
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: Where Culture was an event, its follow-up feels more like an occurrence, the quality of its songs handicapped by an album that plays like a long and formless grab bag.

albums.title: Love Jail
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: The trio’s second album buffs away some of its debut’s grime and distortion for a set of knotty, pummeling rock that sounds vintage but feels current.

albums.title: Big Bossin Vol. 2
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: The Detroit rapper and the Dallas producer team up for another satin-smooth album of street hustler stories.

albums.title: Make Me Know You Sweet
albums.label: West Mineral Ltd.
albums.description: The Kansas City artist better known as Huerco S. continues a recent string of ambient investigations with foggy, ambivalent tracks shot through with a sense of anxiety.

albums.title: Pèze-Piton
albums.label: 12th Isle
albums.description: Mixing up elements of kuduro, dancehall, baile funk, and other global sounds, the Berlin-based producer channels the sound of traveling with no fixed destination in mind.

albums.title: Could It Be Different?
albums.label: Slumberland
albums.description: The idealistic, politically-minded Scottish indie-pop band gloss up their sound on album three.

albums.title: The Brown Tape
albums.label: Mello Music Group
albums.description: An alternate version of Ghostface’s 2013 album 12 Reasons to Die, produced by Detroit’s Apollo Brown, features beats that suit the rapper’s strengths more closely.

albums.title: Snares Like a Haircut
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: The noise-rock duo’s fifth album is a fresh and clear-eyed statement, drawing most from punk’s impulse towards attentiveness and honesty.

albums.title: All Eyez on Me
albums.label: Death Row
albums.description: Tupac’s 1996 double album was made in a frenzy. It is paranoid and brazen, fun and fearless, but it is Pac’s singular style that keeps one of his greatest records from coming undone at the seams.

albums.title: Vessel of Love
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: On her pristine third album, Hollie Cook, a UK singer and one-time Slits member, draws upon 1970s reggae in songs about love and resilience.

albums.title: Fleetwood Mac
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Though far from their debut, the band’s 1975 self-titled album felt like a debut: a pop-rock statement and the unexpected intersection of two parallel spheres that offered something genuinely new.

albums.title: More Disco Songs About Love
albums.label: Innovative Leisure
albums.description: The sort-of disco duo has got the hooks and the groove but on their third album, they struggle to find their footing.

albums.title: Weather or Not
albums.label: Rhymesayers
albums.description: The Dilated Peoples MC’s third solo album shows his continued faith in the eternal truths of boom-bap rap music.

albums.title: Beautiful Despair
albums.label: Fire
albums.description: A lost album from the UK post-punk greats, recorded circa 1989, sheds light on the creative process of brilliant, troubled frontman Dan Treacy.

albums.title: Fabriclive 96
albums.label: Fabric
albums.description: On his Fabriclive mix, UK producer Skream struggles to settle on a vibe.

albums.title: Freedom’s Goblin
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: On his excellent and ambitious double album, the tuneful sensibility that Segall has been nurturing for years has fully blossomed, all while keeping his primordial spirit intact.

albums.title: The Thread That Keeps Us
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: The reliable Southwestern indie-rockers’ ninth album is full of impassioned stories about border politics and environmental disasters.

albums.title: The Time Is Now
albums.label: Insanity
albums.description: A veteran of UK garage and R&B, Craig David follows up his 2016 comeback by fishing for current trends to keep him relevant.

albums.title: Down Below
albums.label: Century Media
albums.description: Traditionalists no more, the Swedish band spend their fourth album exploring the divide between metal’s underground and mainstream.

albums.title: Digital Rain
albums.label: ITALIANS DO IT BETTER
albums.description: The latest solo album from the leader of Chromatics is a full-scale concept album about inclement weather.

albums.title: Marble Skies
albums.label: Ribbon Music
albums.description: The mad scientists of UK psych-rock take an unexpected turn toward pop on their third album.

albums.title: Highly Caffeinated
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Paying tribute to an idealized era of hip-hop that predated his birth, the 18-year-old Detroit musician proves himself a gifted rapper who’s overinvested in ideas past their sell-by date.

albums.title: Un Peu De L’Âme Des Bandits
albums.label: Crammed Discs
albums.description: Originally released in 1980, the newly reissued second album from the Belgian art-rockers is a knotty experiment that freely slams together the sounds of contemporary classical music and free jazz.

albums.title: All Melody
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: Recorded in the storied Funkhaus studio in Germany, All Melody is pianist Nils Frahm’s grandest statement yet, yet it maintains the inquisitive, exploratory spirit of his most playful recordings.

albums.title: what people call low self​-​esteem is really just seeing yourself the way that other people see you
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The San Jose emo band’s debut sounds like various states of alarm, a big statement that leans on the raw impulses of singer and songwriter Shannon Taylor.

albums.title: I Can Feel You Creep Into My Private Life
albums.label: 4AD
albums.description: On her confrontational fourth album, Merrill Garbus wades into the politics of being white in America. It is musically and lyrically ambitious, but its grander themes land with an uncomfortable thud.

albums.title: The Worm’s Heart
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: James Mercer takes his most recent album through the looking glass, flipping songs’ tempos and production styles on an eccentric mission of discovery.

albums.title: LiE
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The grunge survivors leap back into the moshpit of time on a live album culled from their 2016 tour of Europe.

albums.title: Chris Dave and the Drumhedz
albums.label: Blue Note
albums.description: Though its many guest vocalists can be distracting, the Houston-born musician’s debut album presents a strong argument for the drummer as a modern bandleader.

albums.title: The House
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: The New York-based songwriter Aaron Maine stays in the lane of writing delicate, evocative songs with homespun beats, but he never quite locks into the kind of groove that made his last record Pool so satisfying.

albums.title: Paranoia 2
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: On his third release in less than six months, the New York rapper is at his sharpest, offering a nostalgic but refreshed taste of the city’s so-called Rotten Apple rap era.

albums.title: Cadence Weapon
albums.label: eOne
albums.description: The rapper and former Edmonton poet laureate’s first album in six years unpacks his history as a hip-hop advocate and explores the inner workings of Canadian beat communities.

albums.title: Blue Madonna
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: The second album from the rapidly ascending synth-pop artist Garrett Borns offers more of the same: great ideas constrained in songs that rarely allow them to come to fruition.

albums.title: Love/Hate
albums.label: Island Def Jam
albums.description: The-Dream crafted an absolutely exquisite album for his 2007 solo debut. It is a defining moment for the collision of rap and R&B and a pillar of technical songwriting and soulful expression.

albums.title: Between Two Shores
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: On his latest solo album, the Irish folk singer sets sail on a journey of the heart, full of sad break-up songs and meandering musings.

albums.title: Time Flying Beats
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: On his latest album, a luminary of the Los Angeles beat scene remembers how to come back down from the astral plane and hits the dance floor running.

albums.title: Rich Hood
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: Gucci Mane’s latest protégé, a smooth-talking rapper with a nonchalant charm, steps into the spotlight after a streak of well-liked mixtapes.

albums.title: Something/Anything? / A Wizard, a True Star
albums.label: Analog Spark
albums.description: The wildly ambitious albums that cemented Rundgren’s legend as a studio genius in the early 1970s return in illuminating new editions.

albums.title: The Official Body
albums.label: Fat Cat
albums.description: The third record from the UK trio wrangles their elastic, post-punk spirit into an urgency that feels bonded to the present. It makes for songs that are as mesmerizing as they are exhilarating.

albums.title: Voice Hardcore
albums.label: Mesh-Key
albums.description: Using mainly her resilient voice and some electronic effects, the latest record from the Japanese underground legend draws parallels to the punk impulse with her extended, avant-garde vocal excursions.

albums.title: Semicircle
albums.label: Memphis Industries
albums.description: On their fifth album, the Go! Team look to the Motor City for their 1960s fix; they’re as boisterous as ever, but their nostalgia doesn’t dip far beneath the surface of their inspirations.

albums.title: Ruins
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The Swedish folk duo’s fourth album is a showcase for their sweet harmonies, with some bold stylistic departures.

albums.title: Somewhere Else
albums.label: Wharf Cat
albums.description: On their quietly commanding darkwave record, songwriter Noah Anthony and poet Elaine Kahn use harsh noise and power electronics to show it’s possible to care for chaos.

albums.title: Into One Name
albums.label: Genome 6.66 Mbp
albums.description: On his new album for Shanghai’s Genome Tapes, London’s Tim Zha applies Auto-Tuned vocals to hybrid pop informed by dancehall and Afrobeats, where bright details dance against a blurry backdrop.

albums.title: How to Solve Our Human Problems, Pt. 2
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: Having grown from wise-beyond-their-years aesthetes into middle-aged adults, Belle and Sebastian balance parental sentimentalism with a youthful abandon rarely entertained on their early recordings.

albums.title: November
albums.label: Top Dawg
albums.description: The Inglewood artist’s first album as Kendrick and SZA’s labelmate is a neo-soul-tinged space odyssey about love.

albums.title: Songs of Praise
albums.label: Dead Oceans
albums.description: On their debut album, the UK rock group separates themselves from their peers, imbuing their post-adolescent rage with wit and, crucially, a self-effacing awareness that they may never succeed.

albums.title: Camila
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: The former Fifth Harmony member’s debut solo album is largely successful at capturing her charismatic flair. Anchored by the wonderful “Havana,” it shines especially when it's light and breezy.

albums.title: The Dude
albums.label: Super Audio CD
albums.description: Jones’ all-star pop-soul adventure prefigured Thriller and highlighted his ear for new grooves.

albums.title: Sekundenschlaf
albums.label: Blackest Ever Black
albums.description: A mysterious project from an unknown source sends listeners on an exhilarating goose chase through ambient techno and ethereal jungle.

albums.title: Sun Ra Plays Gershwin
albums.label: Enterplanetary Koncepts
albums.description: A collection of George Gershwin interpretations by the avant-jazz legend traces his roots in the swing era, fleshing out a seldom-heard side of the astral voyager.

albums.title: Vision Songs, Vol. 1
albums.label: Numero Group
albums.description: Numero Group turns up an outlier in the new-age icon’s catalog: an album of vocal music that, while a lesser work, offers a glimpse of a seldom-seen side of Laraaji.

albums.title: Punken
albums.label: TSO
albums.description: The Houston rapper’s first mixtape since 2016 is full of unsparing storytelling, pusher anthems, and a dynamic array of trap production over which Maxo delivers some of his most effective writing.

albums.title: Phantom Thread Original Motion Picture Soundtrack
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: Recorded with a 60-piece orchestra, the Radiohead member’s score for Paul Thomas Anderson’s latest film is as lavish as its high-fashion, old-money backdrop.

albums.title: Gumboot Soup
albums.label: Flightless
albums.description: The Aussie psych-rock group’s fifth album of 2017 is anything but a tossed-off afterthought, showing a new dedication to pop craftsmanship.

albums.title: Life of a Dark Rose
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The buzzing rapper’s debut mixtape is an easygoing 40 minutes of sugary trap and mellow, blissfully hazy vibe-music that runs with the sounds of the moment without advancing them much.

albums.title: Winter in America
albums.label: Strata-East
albums.description: The 1974 album from the revolutionary singer and poet braided together his passion for music and literature. Its emotional pitch and fervent political tenor still resonates loudly in America today.

albums.title: Weekend Rocker
albums.label: Drunken Sailor
albums.description: Halifax punks kick out the jams with plenty of distortion on their exhilaratingly rowdy second full-length.

albums.title: Wrong Creatures
albums.label: Vagrant
albums.description: BRMC’s eighth album continues to prop up the rock-historical establishment. It offers more of the same, but at least it’s more of the same in a fairly compelling way.

albums.title: Song of Silver Geese
albums.label: Pi
albums.description: The experimental jazz and classical composer’s newest work uses wildly divergent sounds to conjure a subtle, mournful mood.

albums.title: G.O.A.T.
albums.label: Griselda Records
albums.description: Tough-talking Buffalo rapper, signed to Eminem’s Shady Records, offers ruthless rhymes and a stubbornly old-school sound on his latest album, featuring Raekwon, Prodigy, and more.

albums.title: A Day With the Homies
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Noah Lennox’s vinyl-only EP is a curious world apart, smeared with color and couched in his characteristic wordplay and deadpan humor.

albums.title: Mr. Wollogallu
albums.label: Urpa i musell
albums.description: A cult-favorite Portuguese electronic album from the early ’90s with a pleasantly disorienting blend of instruments and textures.

albums.title: El Gato: The Human Glacier
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On his sixth album since re-starting his career post-jail, Gucci remains focused, funny, and at the top of his game.

albums.title: No Dogs Allowed
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: This Boston singer-songwriter’s second proper album is a treasure trove of self-deprecating wit, melodic complexity, and endearingly anxious energy.

albums.title: Just for Us
albums.label: KTTF
albums.description: On Francis Starlite’s third album, his music turns spare and stark as he comes closer to his finding his essence as a songwriter.

albums.title: The Wasted Years
albums.label: Fire
albums.description: A new box set, collecting four albums released between 1983 and 1986, is a fascinating look at the early stages of an underrated UK post-punk act.

albums.title: Nasty Gal
albums.label: Light in the Attic
albums.description: 1975’s Nasty Gal is another classic from one of the founders of funk. Davis and her band are a little sleazy, a little sultry, and show some surprising range on an album newly reissued on vinyl.

albums.title: The Ghetto
albums.label: 400 Summers
albums.description: The South Central rapper RJMrLA follows up his official debut album with a full-length ride-along with DJ Mustard; the fruitful collaboration features some of the producer’s best work in years.

albums.title: To Infinity
albums.label: Topshelf
albums.description: The Seattle indie rockers’ debut album places them in the lineage of bands like Modest Mouse and Built to Spill, wrapping majestically dejected songwriting in ambitiously atmospheric production.

albums.title: sovereign nose of (y)​our arrogant face
albums.label: Ruby Yacht
albums.description: The witty, word-drunk Maine rapper (a.k.a. milo) follows up his 2017 breakthrough with a middle finger flipped in the direction of any remaining doubters.

albums.title: Ephorize
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The fearless Chicago rapper offers her best album yet, with terrific production and a barrage of raps that reveal Elizabeth Harris to be far more than her hilarious and absurdly raunchy one-liners.

albums.title: Shells 2
albums.label: Gingko
albums.description: The latest solo project from Michigan guitarist Shelley Salant feels like a travelogue that uses simple lines of electric guitar to craft engaging tunes that say a lot without needing any words.

albums.title: DH00278 (Live From The O2, London, 12/16/2016)
albums.label: A Dirty Hit
albums.description: The live album from one of the UK’s largest rock bands serves as a broad, if flawed, introduction to the still-growing band, their enormous potential, and the swaggeringly neurotic frontman Matt Healy.

albums.title: Good Job No Conversation
albums.label: Ultra
albums.description: Channeling Sade, covering James Blake, and indulging in some silk-sheets saxophone, the Danish pop producer William Asingh makes a plush, playful, and quietly audacious debut.

albums.title: Hats
albums.label: Linn
albums.description: The Scottish group’s 1989 cult classic is an album of euphoric love and loss that unfolds slowly and with starry eyes. Its noir mood and icy melodrama are still felt all over modern pop.

albums.title: Urge to Merge
albums.label: NNA Tapes
albums.description: The Boston band’s second and final album is a bright explosion in every atonal direction from math-rock breakdowns to sludgy noise, like virtuosos pushing the self-destruct button.

albums.title: Exposure
albums.label: Concord
albums.description: Written and recorded in just 77 hours, the bassist and singer’s limited-release album is a heady, jazzy range of intricacy and improvisation, a monument to her skills as a composer and performer.

albums.title: Water Memory
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Across its 40 minutes, the Los Angeles artist builds a modular synth album that is enveloping and cohesive. What initially sounds static may, upon closer examination, reveal a wealth of movement.

albums.title: POST-
albums.label: Quote Unquote
albums.description: The magnetic Jeff Rosenstock stays fully armed with his power-pop anthems, as full of indomitable hooks as they are of paralyzing doubt and cynicism.

albums.title: Cold Devil
albums.label: Stinc Team
albums.description: Cold Devil is the most compelling album of the Los Angeles emcee’s career. His avant deadpan and impressionistic relationship to the beat is hard to classify, but it’s icy and unforgettable.

albums.title: Bright: The Album
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: None of the wild imagination fueling David Ayers’ bloated orc cop epic carries over to its soundtrack, which feels test-marketed to a fault.

albums.title: Dedication 6
albums.label: Young Money Entertainment
albums.description: On the first Dedication mixtape installment in four years, Lil Wayne and DJ Drama show some of their former spark, but the tape does little to course-correct Wayne’s spiraling career trajectory.

albums.title: Lady Bird (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)
albums.label: Lakeshore
albums.description: Using piano, strings, a wind ensemble, and light percussion, Brion’s score subtly and deftly mirrors the existential ambling of Greta Gerwig’s outstanding coming-of-age film.

albums.title: Trans-Millenia Music
albums.label: Rvng Intl.
albums.description: This anthology of self-released new age music from the 1980s captures a moment of spiritual questing, and it rightly rescues its creator from historical obscurity.

albums.title: Virtual Self EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Adopting a new alias, the EDM producer Porter Robinson sets aside Worlds’ electro-pop crossover and embraces early-2000s trance and video-game music.

albums.title: Huncho Jack, Jack Huncho
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: The big personalities of both Quavo and Travis Scott are muted on their collaboration, one that feels lethargic even for a victory lap.

albums.title: Ghosts
albums.label: Lewis Hollow
albums.description: The Sunny Day Real Estate singer returns from a long hiatus with a crowd-funded solo album that reconciles his singer/songwriter instincts with his lavish orchestral ambitions.

albums.title: Lower East Suite Part One/Lower East Suite Part Two
albums.label: Big Dada
albums.description: Having collaborated with the likes of Dev Hynes and Princess Nokia—and teaming with streetwear brand Supreme—the New York jazz ensemble Onyx Collective honor their city on these latest releases.

albums.title: Drum Dance to the Motherland
albums.artist: The Khan Jamal Creative Arts Ensemble
albums.label: Eremite
albums.description: A long-forgotten gem of experimental jazz gets a welcome reissue 45 years after it was recorded in a Philadelphia basement; deep, adventurous, and soulful, it is a joy to discover.

albums.title: Mercury’s Rainbow
albums.label: Modern Love
albums.description: Both naggingly familiar and singularly odd, Zomby’s previously unreleased 2008 album finds him putting his own quixotic stamp on grime’s classic eskibeat sound.

albums.title: Merry Christmas Lil’ Mama: Re-Wrapped
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Like the best holiday-themed art, Chance and Jeremih’s expanded reissue of their 2016 Christmas mixtape is part timeless, part time capsule.

albums.title: Pressure
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: Jeezy is less effective these days, as his new album attests. But he covers gaps in his writing with a few tricks and guest appearances from Kendrick, Rick Ross, YG, 2 Chainz, and others.

albums.title: Quiet Storm
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: Capping off his breakout year, the D.C. rapper offers a deft album of soft synths and languid trap that further carves out his identity.

albums.title: The Beautiful & Damned
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: The new album from Oakland rapper G-Eazy is a boozy, minor-key, 74-minute slog, where he wonders if it’s possible to survive the corrupting influence of celebrity.

albums.title: A Home on Earth EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The new EP from Portland duo the Body captures a rawer, more immediate side of the band. It documents their increasingly blurred boundaries between electronic noise and metal.

albums.title: Pop 2
albums.label: Asylum
albums.description: Charli XCX’s latest mixtape is a vision of what pop music could be, the sound of an eclectic, hyperreal future where romantic love is fun but fucked and partying is an emotional refuge.

albums.title: The Golden Ravedays
albums.label: Hippie Dance
albums.description: German producer Aksel Schaufler, aka Superpitcher, has long been a leading light of Cologne’s Kompakt label. His eclectic new solo album renews his commitment to duration—it’s nearly six hours long.

albums.title: Revival
albums.label: Aftermath
albums.description: On his overtly political ninth studio LP, Eminem is fueled by self-doubt. But with many bland hooks and cringe-worthy punchlines, Revival is another late-career album that does little for his legacy.

albums.title: No_One Ever Really Dies
albums.label: N.E.R.D. Music
albums.description: The new N.E.R.D. album is full of guests: Rihanna, Kendrick, Gucci, 3000, M.I.A., Wale, Ed Sheeran. They all help elevate an album that is occasionally ineffectual in its attempts at protest music.

albums.title: Finding Shore
albums.label: Dead Oceans
albums.description: A collaboration between an improvising pianist and the ambient icon yields an unusual fusion of acoustic and electronic ideas—a meeting of minds that is full of rewarding surprises.

albums.title: Rage Against the Machine
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: Rage Against the Machine’s debut is a radical fistful of funk, rap, and rock. Through its power, it remains an essential call to activism and a necessary lesson on how to withstand the opposition.

albums.title: Wyclef Jean Inspired By...
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: A new mixtape from Wyclef Jean finds him reinterpreting the sound of 2017, track by track. There are endearing bits of serendipity here, but the project’s purpose is unclear.

albums.title: Diggin’ in the Carts: A Collection of Pioneering Japanese Video Game Music
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Assembled by Hyperdub’s Steve Goodman and filmmaker Nick Dwyer, this 34-track compilation offers a retro-futurist deep dive into a lost world of incidental music of surprising power and poignancy.

albums.title: Fela Kuti Box Set #4
albums.label: Knitting Factory
albums.description: Erykah Badu’s curated tour of the Afrobeat giant’s sprawling discography showcases the headier aspects of the legendary bandleader’s work, even as it grapples head-on with his life’s contradictions.

albums.title: Bloodas
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: Detroit rapper Tee Grizzley and Chicago drill alum Lil Durk team up for a promising mixtape that showcases their considerable chemistry.

albums.title: Special Forces
albums.label: NNA Tapes
albums.description: The producer known as Ahnnu is affiliated with L.A.’s beat-music scene, but his sounds are swirling and gelatinous. Rhythms never unfold quite the way you might expect them to on his hypnotic new LP.

albums.title: Saturation III
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: It's on their third album this year that rap crew BROCKHAMPTON’s whole gestalt comes into focus. There are more memorable performances, and more fascinatingly unorthodox compositions servicing them.

albums.title: Say Less
albums.label: OVO Sound
albums.description: OVO Sound signee Roy Wood$ offers a chilled-out version of trappy R&B on his debut studio album. But he’s yet to find a sound that is distinctly his own.

albums.title: Laughing at the System EP
albums.label: Alter
albums.description: Absurdity is the guiding principle of the new EP from the Australian post-punk band. This delightfully bizarre release distills Total Control’s gnashing, dazzling appeal.

albums.title: My House From All Angles
albums.label: MoreAboutMusic
albums.description: On his first solo LP in 27 years, house producer Mike Dunn celebrates the old school: Acid lines squirm, vintage drum machines knock and thrash, and Dunn holds court with his commanding baritone.

albums.title: Tribute To 2
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: On a sequel to 2009’s covers collection Tribute To, the My Morning Jacket singer imbues a set of classics and standards with a distinctly contemporary melancholy.

albums.label: Showoff
albums.description: Statik Selektah, a hip-hop mainstay, brings Action Bronson, Joey Bada$$, Raekwon, Prodigy and more for a boppy, East Coast delight that doesn't make the best use of the producer’s intuition.

albums.title: Double or Nothing
albums.label: G.O.O.D. Music
albums.description: Though fun and at times politically salient, even Metro Boomin cannot rescue Big Sean from his habit of writing the absolute corniest lyrics imaginable.

albums.title: 2 Tha Left
albums.label: So Way Out
albums.description: West Coast rap nostalgist G Perico has spent 2017 on a forward-looking tear. His third full-length release of the year contains his immediate charm.

albums.title: Highly Rare
albums.label: International Anthem
albums.description: Recorded live in Chicago and then rearranged in the drummer/producer’s studio, Highly Rare channels an electric night of raw improv into a shapeshifting form halfway between hip-hop and free jazz.

albums.title: Universel
albums.label: Melody As Truth
albums.description: The latest from prolific Danish producer Natal Zaks is a short album of blissed-out, ambient textures, but is no less immersive thanks to his deft sense of world-building.

albums.title: Quality Control: Control the Streets, Vol. 1
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: The Atlanta label home to Migos, Lil Yachty, and a squad of up-and-coming rappers showcases their year on top with a 30-song victory lap of minor-key flexers and foamy delights.

albums.title: Too Hard
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: The Atlanta rapper is slowly coming into his own as a Young Thug disciple with an intrinsic tunefulness and strong storytelling that is marred by the undistinguished Quality Control production.

albums.title: Improvisations
albums.label: Care in the Community
albums.description: There is chemistry between the Sonic Youth guitarist and the This Heat drummer, but their collaborative album feels more like mood pieces for skronk heads and completists only.

albums.title: Habibi Funk: An Eclectic Selection of Music From the Arab World
albums.label: Habibi Funk Records
albums.description: A new compilation from Habibi Funk records highlights the old and interweaving sounds of Algerian coladera, Lebanese AOR, Egyptian disco, Moroccan funk and more.

albums.title: Dedication
albums.label: Glo Gang
albums.description: Balancing his characteristic humor with newfound vulnerability, Keef’s latest is a worthy capstone to a prolific year in which the Chicago rapper has resurrected his reputation and career.

albums.title: From a Room: Volume 1 / Volume 2
albums.label: Mercury Nashville
albums.description: Nashville institution Chris Stapleton followed his 2015 breakthrough with two new albums this year. They showcase his omnivorous approach to country music in all its dignified melancholy.

albums.title: Perfect Lung
albums.label: Halocline Trance
albums.description: On his latest LP, the producer Ceramic TL (aka Egyptrixx) collaborates with Turkish composer Ipek Gorgun on another heady investigation of the global environmental crisis.

albums.title: Daydream
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: On 1995’s Daydream, the spectacular pop vocalist fine-tuned her songcraft. The album redrew the boundaries of what a Mariah Carey song—and a pop song—was supposed to sound like.

albums.title: Lex
albums.label: Rvng Intl.
albums.description: Augmenting electro-acoustic fusions with speech synthesis and language translation software, Visible Cloaks invoke mystifying new form of dialects and communication on their mini-LP.

albums.title: Book of Sound
albums.label: Honest Jon's
albums.description: On their latest album, the ensemble that made their name in scrappy performances on the sidewalks and street corners of New York City and Chicago turns muted, spare, warm and still.

albums.title: KIMBERLY: The People I Used to Know
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: The singer, reality star, and social-media icon is joyous and defiant, projecting realness and flaunting considerable vocal chops.

albums.title: Buy Corals Online
albums.label: Editions Mego
albums.description: The latest from Copenhagen’s Loke Rahbek—a collaboration with multimedia artist Frederik Valentin—is a set of wistful sketches for synthesizer and piano that gracefully sway.

albums.title: Pender Street Steppers
albums.label: Mood Hut
albums.description: The new EP from Pender Street Steppers collects five tracks of the Vancouver duo’s breezy, hazy house music. It finds the Steppers not venturing very far outside of their comfort zone.

albums.title: How to Solve Our Human Problems, Pt. 1
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: The first in a trio of new mini-albums from Belle and Sebastian finds the Glaswegian indie-pop greats speaking to our times. At its best, it grows into a divine six-minute prog-disco suite.

albums.title: Kingdoms Disdained
albums.label: Silver Lining
albums.description: Morbid Angel’s ninth album sets the death metal band back on course. Featuring Trey Azagthoth’s molten solos, the band rediscover what they did well across their career and double down on it.

albums.title: Squeeze Box: The Complete Works of “Weird Al” Yankovic
albums.label: Legacy
albums.description: The 15-disc box set of puns and polka is a monument to pop music’s once symbiotic relationship with parody—a linkage that has dissolved in the wake of the monoculture’s demise.

albums.title: Catch These Vibes
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On the young singer’s second major label album, PnB struggles to push past the boundaries of his previous work, but with a few solid tunes, it shows him finding his way in the major-label apparatus.

albums.title: Or More; the Anxious
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Chicago rapper Mick Jenkins’ new mixtape strikes the balance between hard-nosed spitting and the breezy consciousness of daisy-age-influenced acid rap.

albums.title: No Shame
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: On his corrosive fifth album, the rapper takes aim at several targets and whiffs spectacularly. His verbose, tryhard technique is a tired formula he employs without flow, direction, or meaning.

albums.title: Weighing of the Heart
albums.label: Ninja Tune
albums.description: On her debut LP, British producer Nabihah Iqbal—fka Throwing Shade—has a rare touch with inky new wave synths and drum machines, emerging as a songwriter of impressive emotional heft.

albums.title: Material Control
albums.label: Globochem
albums.description: On their first album in 15 years, the Long Island post-hardcore band Glassjaw picks up right where they left off. But their heaviest material yet is, at times, lacking in dynamics and atmosphere.

albums.title: A.M./Being There
albums.label: Rhino
albums.description: Newly reissued and remastered, the group’s first two albums find Jeff Tweedy and his Chicago band transforming themselves from alt-country also-rans into a formidable rock‘n’roll outfit.

albums.title: The Visitor
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: While still pointedly political, Neil Young’s latest with Promise of the Real takes a more freewheeling, macro look at the world and becomes more centered than his recent albums.

albums.title: Perfect Angel
albums.label: Capitol
albums.description: A deluxe reissue of Minnie Riperton’s best album—fusing funk, reggae, folk, soul—includes bonus tracks and new liner notes, which elaborate on the process of recording this classic with Stevie Wonder.

albums.title: Everyday Is Christmas
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Sia’s shiny Christmas album feels inconsistent and underwritten, like opening a gift where someone’s forgotten to remove the tags.

albums.title: Zaytown Sorority Class of 2017
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The prolific Atlanta producer enlists 17 women for an all-female mixtape that is well-intentioned and occasionally delightful, but doesn't have enough highlights to sustain its momentum.

albums.title: Post Self
albums.label: Avalanche
albums.description: The new LP from pioneering industrial band Godflesh is the duo’s best effort in over 20 years—a sinister amalgam of Justin Broadrick and G.C. Green’s collective work to date.

albums.title: Songs of Experience
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Years in the making, U2’s 14th studio album finds the band straining to reassert its relevance in a world where rock music has long since ceded its vanguard status.

albums.title: Endless Computer
albums.label: Nuclear War Now!
albums.description: With their vicious debut LP, Austin quartet Expander ascend to the Texas thrash pantheon, evoking familiar metal-punk sounds as well as dystopian sci-fi themes.

albums.title: cybersex
albums.label: Beartrap
albums.description: With a long bench of guests from 2 Chainz to Ne-Yo, the singer’s fourth album is sometimes catchy but astonishingly hollow and derivative.

albums.title: Metal Machine Music
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Lou Reed’s 1975 album has been called one of the worst albums ever made. The truth is it is the product of genuine love and passion, still exhilarating and bursting with possibility four decades on.

albums.title: Master of Puppets
albums.label: Blackened Recordings
albums.description: In 1986, Metallica released inarguably one of the best metal records of all time. Newly remastered with live takes and demos, the album’s riffs, power, and mania remain as potent as ever.

albums.title: Oblivion
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: T-Pain’s first studio album in six years cashes in on the good graces he’s received in the interim, but also retreads vastly familiar territory that is more fun than illuminating.

albums.title: Loüm / Go Be Forgotten
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: New York City’s most consistent metallurgists offer a deliberate break from their past on their seventh and eighth albums. A decade into a prolific career, Krallice prove newly elusive.

albums.title: Friday on Elm Street
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: On the New York rappers’ collaboration, just about every bar is sharply written, rapped, and also could’ve been plucked from any project these two have done in the 21st century.

albums.title: Call Me By Your Name (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)
albums.label: Madison Gate
albums.description: The soundtrack to Italian director Luca Guadagnino’s new film uses 1980s pop singles and classical pieces to help tell the deliriously romantic story of lovers Elio and Oliver.

albums.title: Kick
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: The 30th-anniversary edition of Kick affirms its status as a jewel of ’80s pop-rock. It’s a showcase of the band’s opulent production, slithery grooves, and the allure of Michael Hutchence’s simplicity.

albums.title: War & Leisure
albums.label: Bystorm
albums.description: Miguel’s fourth album has a kinetic sexual and political energy. With less digital funk and more reverbed-out guitar, his R&B psychedelia for uncertain times shows his maturation as a songwriter.

albums.title: Polygondwanaland
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Psych-rock band King Gizzard is giving its fourth album of the year away as a free download. The immersive Polygondwanaland is the farthest the seven-piece has strayed from its psych sci-fi roots.

albums.title: Wopavelli 3
albums.label: 1017 Eskimos
albums.description: Lil Wop—the newest and most adamant Gucci Mane disciple—carves his own grotty, horrorcore path on his fourth mixtape of 2017, a wildly fun but sometimes rough listen.

albums.title: Yes Lawd! Remixes
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: On this collection of remixes from Anderson .Paak and Knxwledge’s 2016 LP, the latter artist flexes his mastery at deconstructing beats and samples—occasionally transforming the mood of a track.

albums.title: Colón Man
albums.label: DDS
albums.description: The first proper LP from Equiknoxx is a clear step forward for the Kingston-based digital dancehall duo. Its textures leap from the speakers; the sound design is more vivid than ever.

albums.title: Rainbow Mirror
albums.label: Hospital Productions
albums.description: Commemorating 20 years of his Prurient alias, Dominick Fernow’s sprawling, three-hour foray into “doom electronics” feels like a swing of the pendulum back to the noise project’s Rust Belt roots.

albums.title: Plant Age
albums.label: L.I.E.S.
albums.description: On his debut album, the L.I.E.S. mainstay makes house music that’s dubby and lo-fi, like club tracks heard through a pillow.

albums.title: The Greatest Gift
albums.label: Asthmatic Kitty
albums.description: Though too scattered to stand alone, the various demos and remixes culled from Carrie & Lowell add new context and dimension to Sufjan Stevens’ masterful album.

albums.title: Blue Lips
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Of a piece with last year’s Lady Wood, the Swedish pop singer’s new album chronicles the death of a doomed, passionate love affair. It makes a powerful statement about female sexuality in the process.

albums.label: Terrible
albums.description: Sam Gendel’s smoothly psychedelic debut is dominated by the guitarist and saxophonist’s tip-toed melodies and hushed voice.

albums.title: Who Built the Moon?
albums.label: Sour Mash
albums.description: Noel Gallagher’s latest is the most ambitious of his solo releases, internalizing the heyday of late ’90s Britpop while sounding both urgent and absurd to mostly great effect.

albums.title: Fete Des Morts AKA Dia De Los Muertos EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: New Jersey’s Mach-Hommy is one of the East coast’s finest working rappers. Building on his cryptic mystique, his latest effort finds him diving into a collection of beats by Earl Sweatshirt.

albums.title: بس ربحت, خسرت “When You Have Won, You Have Lost”
albums.label: Toxic State
albums.description: Atop imposing hardcore, the New York group’s Lebanese-American vocalist tackles politics, identity, and the complexity of his Shia Muslim upbringing.

albums.title: Mount Qaf (Divine Love)
albums.label: Fortune Tellers
albums.description: Peter Matthew Bauer, bassist and organist in the Walkmen, fuses Eastern spirituality with the sound of heartland rock on his latest solo album.

albums.title: No Dope on Sundays
albums.label: Sony
albums.description: After serving as one of the key writers in G.O.O.D. Music, CyHi’s thoroughly slick debut album finally arrives, with features from Kanye, Pusha T, Schoolboy Q, Travis Scott, and many more.

albums.title: All Belief Is Paradise
albums.label: Father/Daughter
albums.description: The debut from pop-punk band Fits is full of sharp turns, heavy lyrics, and bursts of righteous anger. A fierce will to survive animates these lean, scrappy songs.

albums.title: Utopia
albums.label: One Little Indian
albums.description: Filled with flute and birdsong, Björk’s 10th album is deeply personal, a discovery of googly-eyed romance, a rebuke of violent men, and a generous offering of love song after love song.

albums.title: Memory of a Cut Off Head
albums.label: Castle Face
albums.description: The 20th LP from OCS—better known as Thee Oh Sees—is a softer and slower strand of psychedelia than the San Francisco garage-rock institution has come to be known for.

albums.title: The Age of Consent
albums.label: London
albums.description: Featuring the groundbreaking pop hits ”Smalltown Boy” and “Why,” the 1984 debut album from the British synth-pop group was a transgressive moment—defiant, queer, and full of hooks.

albums.title: Radio Silence
albums.label: 3D
albums.description: On his eighth solo album, Talib Kweli remains the vanguard for deep-thinking conscious rap; storytelling and uplift are in ample supply, though the risks are few and far between.

albums.title: Soul of a Woman
albums.label: Daptone
albums.description: On her final, posthumously released album, Jones alternates powerful ballads with the upbeat dance numbers that were staples of her live shows, confirming her stature a contemporary soul-music icon.

albums.title: The Fall - Singles 1978-2016
albums.label: Cherry Red
albums.description: This new seven-disc Fall box set surveys every single and B-side the Mancunian institution has released since 1978. It provides a tidy, linear history of a notoriously unstable band.

albums.title: The Program
albums.label: Killa Entertainment
albums.description: On Cam’ron’s first full-length album in four years, he sounds disengaged. The beats don’t pop and the fun has drained from his lyrics.

albums.title: Too Dumb for Suicide: Tim Heidecker’s Trump Songs
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: A comedian known for his absurdity and irony, Tim Heidecker returns with an album of protest art as musical comedy. Its shining moments come when he is honest about his fear and anger over Trump’s regime.

albums.title: FILM
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Originally composed for a pair of soundtracks, Qasim Naqvi’s expressive new LP toggles between pure electronic sound design and minimalist composition.

albums.title: Bill Brewster Presents Tribal Rites
albums.label: Eskimo
albums.description: A sort of biography in mixtape form, Tribal Rites offers the chance to hear dance-music history through the ears of one of the culture’s most discerning listeners.

albums.title: Low in High School
albums.label: BMG
albums.description: Though the music is often engaging and exciting, Low in High School is Morrissey’s second consecutive release that feels regrettably tethered to his increasingly alienating public persona.

albums.title: SYRE
albums.label: Roc Nation
albums.description: Full of chaotic beats and cringe-worthy lyrics, the debut studio album from Jaden Smith is a paranoid fantasy that mixes new age thinking with apocalyptic rhetoric.

albums.title: Romaplasm
albums.label: Anticon
albums.description: On the latest Baths album, Will Wiesenfeld launches his beats and synths into the realm of vibrant fantasy. Of all his releases, it’s the one most rife with pure pleasure.

albums.title: Bajas Fresh
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: Over seven tracks that span 80 minutes, the expansive, looping, shifting synths and rhythms of Bajas Fresh mark the trio’s most diverse and ambitious record.

albums.title: S/T
albums.label: Saddle Creek
albums.description: Literary, emotional, and filling up all the space between indie and post-rock, the Los Angeles band’s third album is not a conversation piece, but a dialogue meant to be shared.

albums.title: Gifts From the Ebb Tide
albums.label: YK
albums.description: The third studio album from Coupler lays out ambient music that is hyper-specific, detailed, and undemanding.

albums.title: Red Headed Stranger
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: In 1975, Willie Nelson changed the rules of country music. His lonesome, noir concept album about a wayward preacher was a big and beautiful dream made real by simple and spare music.

albums.title: Contributors
albums.label: Monofonus
albums.description: The new collaboration between the prolific Dan Melchior and Austin’s Spray Paint make mountains out of mantras across a jammy, post-punk album that barrels like an 18-wheeler down the highway.

albums.title: This Trip
albums.label: Vibe Over Method
albums.description: On her debut album, Montreal visual artist-turned-electronic pop provocateur Alexandra Mackenzie makes vital protest music that summons collective strength to overcome existential fear.

albums.title: Wasps’ Nests
albums.label: Captured Tracks
albums.description: In 1995, Stephin Merritt released a major-label synth-pop LP as the 6ths. He wrote all the songs but enlisted others to sing them, including Lou Barlow, Dean Wareham, Georgia Hubley, and Mary Timony.

albums.title: Horse Blanket
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The Seattle indie rock band’s final record is a great parting gift, one with generous portions of wit, melancholy, and even one long guitar solo.

albums.title: Summer Megalith
albums.label: Flower Girl
albums.description: The debut album from Caracara—co-produced by former Modern Baseball frontman Jacob Ewald—is dynamic and diffuse, drawing on slowcore, gothic folk, post-hardcore, and more.

albums.title: Air Lows
albums.label: Blackest Ever Black
albums.description: The fifth full-length from the experimental Berlin-based musician offers a meditation on negativity that’s dreary and enervating in equal turns.

albums.title: Rest
albums.label: Because
albums.description: Sung mostly in French, Gainsbourg’s gripping new album finds her in the tangles of grief. It is at once scorchingly intimate and fantastically oversized.

albums.title: Introduce Yerself
albums.label: Arts & Crafts
albums.description: Recorded in his final months and released 10 days after his death, the Tragically Hip frontman’s final album is a farewell and a testament, at once wistful and playful, urgent and defiantly hopeful.

albums.title: Ascending a Mountain of Heavy Light
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: The second collaboration between the two experimental metal bands feels necessary. They bands flood the gap between doom and grindcore with all kinds of stunts, risks, and tricks.

albums.title: New Shapes of Life
albums.label: Tapete
albums.description: The Boo Radleys mastermind returns with a suave, sophisticated, rhythmically robust pop record whose swagger belies deep-seated feelings of disillusionment, self-doubt, and paranoia.

albums.title: The Mustard Seed
albums.label: Six5
albums.description: The St. Paul rapper’s latest album is a study in faith and focus. His acrobatic rapping, rich hooks, and warm textures create a soulful record full of high stakes and interior depth.

albums.title: If All I Was Was Black
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: Mavis Staples presents her signature hope on the taut and lively If All I Was Was Black, another collaboration with Jeff Tweedy. But it doesn’t come as naturally as it once did, as she makes clear.

albums.title: Laugh Now, Fly Later
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Across a relatively lean, stakes-free mixtape, Wiz Khalifa riffs on his only meaningful muse, weed, with a level of buy-in that he rarely grants his commercial projects.

albums.title: Interiors
albums.label: Epitaph
albums.description: The first album in 22 years from seminal New York post-hardcore band Quicksand is a structurally-obsessed work where beauty and brutality coexist.

albums.title: Out of Range
albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: Now relocated to Los Angeles, the five-piece moves comfortably into breezy, slow-going, cosmic country as both an escape and a protest.

albums.title: Music for Nine Postcards
albums.label: Empire of Signs
albums.description: Inspired by a series of window views, Japanese ambient pioneer Hiroshi Yoshimura’s 1982 album Music for Nine Postcards has a disarming presence, cutting sweetly into the listener’s reality.

albums.title: No Luscious Life
albums.label: Golden Teacher
albums.description: The Glasgow sextet brings a healthy dose of dub to its spiky punk-acid-disco fusion, to party-starting (and occasionally political) effect.

albums.title: Snapshot
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The debut long-player from UK funky pioneer Reiss Hanson, aka Champion, is high-energy bass music as bare-knuckled pointillism. His recordings have rarely sounded more dynamic or more colorful.

albums.title: Birdie
albums.label: Lame-O
albums.description: With the second album from his Slaughter Beach, Dog project, Jake Ewald of Modern Baseball has found his voice as a musician, though he’s still searching as a writer.

albums.title: Automatic for the People
albums.label: Craft
albums.description: In 1992, R.E.M. were the biggest, most important rock band in America. This reissue of their multi-platinum smash, 25 years later, highlights a brooding, transitional album that still resonates.

albums.title: Mnestic Pressure
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Navigating the divide between club culture and conceptual art, the UK producer repurposes the momentum-based language of dance music into a hauntingly frozen inversion.

albums.title: ROME
albums.label: Backwoodz Studioz
albums.description: Brooklyn emcees Elucid and Billy Woods’ third album as Armand Hammer is a stellar underground hip-hop record. They are radical and full of heart, delivering cocksure homilies from the margins of rap.

albums.title: Before I Wake
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On the first of two mixtapes to be released before her major label debut, Before I Wake finds the Oakland emcee less relaxed and laidback. It plays out like a reassertion of control.

albums.title: Reputation
albums.label: Big Machine
albums.description: Taylor Swift’s sixth album is an aggressive, lascivious display of craftsmanship, but her full embrace of modern pop feels sadly conventional.

albums.title: Chelsea Girl
albums.label: Verve
albums.description: On her 1967 debut album, Nico’s unmistakable voice sings the songs of Bob Dylan, Lou Reed, and Jackson Browne. Chelsea Girl helps define her as a mercurial aura and a manifold, complicated artist.

albums.title: U-Men
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The Seattle band U-Men released only one full-length during their eight-year run in the 1980s, but their legend loomed large over a generation. A new Sub Pop reissue collects their crucial catalog.

albums.title: Hesaitix
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: With Hesaitix, the Berlin-based DJ and producer has built a strange world that lives and breathes. It’s a catchy, fascinating electronic album that lives in a lucid unreality.

albums.title: Stranger
albums.label: YEAR0001
albums.description: The Swedish rapper’s third album offers glimpses of his full potential, songs that pierce through the detachment that once obscured real emotion.

albums.title: Rot
albums.label: What's Your Rupture?
albums.description: On the follow-up to their 2013 debut LP, the beer-swilling, self-described former “party band” grows up without slowing down.

albums.title: Tauhid/Jewels of Thought/Deaf Dumb Blind (Summun Bukmun Umyun)
albums.label: Anthology Recordings
albums.description: Three invaluable reissues showcase a young bandleader and his top-tier players as they create a powerfully cohesive group sound: elegant, adventurous, warm, and ferocious all at once.

albums.title: Arpo
albums.label: Houndstooth
albums.description: The second album from producer Joe Seaton offers a rush of effervescence. With a childlike and immersive touch, he pulls apart and rearranges small, twinkling sounds.

albums.title: Phases
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: This collection of B-sides, demos, and covers is terrific and revelatory in its own right. It's a trail of dropped clues to the creative process of the defiantly mercurial Olsen.

albums.title: Les Fleurs Du Mal
albums.label: Halcyon Veil
albums.description: Eric Burton’s latest album is a logical extension of his to 2015 album Communion,  an experimental world of dissolving certainty where all light is gradually leached out of the landscape.

albums.title: The 1st
albums.label: MSFTS MUSIC
albums.description: With her second album, Willow Smith opts for a more organic and raw sound. It’s a huge leap in the right direction, as she uses her guitar to channel alternative singer-songwriters of the 1990s.

albums.title: Backwater
albums.label: Ghostly International
albums.description: The Australian duo’s debut full length features warm, pleasing vocal lines and electro-pop beats, but it never coheres to tell the kind of story they want to tell.

albums.title: Kid Kruschev
albums.label: Torn Clean
albums.description: Like everyone else, Sleigh Bells are feeling the weight of the world in 2017. Their lean new mini-album has more thematic cohesion than their previous releases and also a surprising tenderness.

albums.title: Vante EP
albums.label: Urban Scandal
albums.description: Christopher Owens, formerly of Girls, calls Curls—a trio with drummer Cody Rhodes and bassist Luke Baće—his first “real band.” Their new EP contains some of the most lavish-sounding music he has released.

albums.title: Red Pill Blues
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Adam Levine’s band return for their sixth album of smooth, professional, antiseptic soft-rock, which somehow also features Kendrick Lamar, Future, and A$AP Rocky.

albums.title: Noir et Blanc
albums.label: Crammed Discs
albums.description: Released in 1983, Noir et Blanc still sounds like a broadcast from the future—the influential work of Congolese and French musicians using analog synths, strange effects, and stranger time signatures.

albums.title: The Animal Spirits
albums.label: Border Community
albums.description: Electronic producer James Holden has remade himself into a bandleader on his new album—a collection of self-described “folk-trance” recorded with improv ensemble the Animal Spirits.

albums.title: Anthropocene
albums.label: Western Vinyl
albums.description: The restless singer-songwriter’s wanderlust leads him to find poetic beauty in the country’s ugly truths, even as he confronts the idea that there’s more at stake than ever.

albums.title: EP2
albums.label: Godmode
albums.description: The music of New York producer Yaeji—part house, part hip-hop—hints at strong feelings with subtle tones. On her second EP, she pushes her sound further to its poles.

albums.title: Time Spent Away From U
albums.label: Lobster Fury
albums.description: Behind DJ Seinfeld’s resolutely non-serious façade lies a strikingly wistful take on deep house. His debut LP pushes even further in this direction.

albums.title: The Thrill of It All
albums.label: Capitol
albums.description: The second album from the pop crooner uses the same method that made his debut such a commercial success. His spectacular voice doles out feelings in terms everyone can understand.

albums.title: Do You Mind EP
albums.label: Luft
albums.description: On their ethereal debut EP, the Norwegian electro-pop trio treat romance with a stylish, if sometimes frustrating, remove.

albums.title: Tokorats
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: The new album from Jonti—a part-time touring guitarist for the Avalanches—is aesthetically omnivorous, encompassing dream pop, electronica, hip-hop, and R&B. It sounds unrestrained and overproduced.

albums.title: Have You Been There, Have You Seen It EP
albums.label: Ninja Tune
albums.description: The Hamburg DJ applies the energy of her spine-tingling DJ sets to a suggestively lo-fi set of acid-soaked electro-techno jams.

albums.title: MILANO
albums.label: 30th Century
albums.description: The Italian composer recruits Parquet Courts and Karen O to pay tribute to the Italian city’s hedonistic 1980s heyday.

albums.title: Savage Young Dü
albums.label: Numero Group
albums.description: After decades of legal red tape and intraband strife, Minneapolis’ revolutionary punk trio break the silence with an exhaustive summary of their lo-fi, frenetic first three years.

albums.title: Fumbling Towards Ecstasy
albums.label: Nettwerk
albums.description: The Canadian singer-songwriter’s third record is a fascinating outlier in her catalog, an unsparing and expansive album written in the mountains of Quebec following traumatic experiences in her life.

albums.title: Bay Head
albums.label: Three Lobed
albums.description: Steve Gunn and John Truscinski’s third album of low-key, abstract jams is their most varied and narratively absorbing to date.

albums.title: Fragments of a Season
albums.label: Emotional Rescue
albums.description: Two ambient-leaning auteurs unite for a charming exercise in bright guitar tones and wistful moods, rooted in their mutual admiration for Manchester legend Vini Reilly.

albums.title: Phantom Brickworks
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: The restless UK electronic musician sets aside prior experiments in spliced soul and finger-picking folk-glitch in favor of foggy ambient atmospheres that are both soothing and haunting.

albums.title: Trouble No More: The Bootleg Series Vol. 13 / 1979-1981
albums.label: Columbia Legacy
albums.description: The latest installment of the Bootleg Series excavates live recordings and demos from Dylan’s infamous, fruitful, and polarizing era as an evangelical Christian.

albums.title: Without Warning
albums.label: Slaughter Gang
albums.description: The two rappers and producer strike a devious, almost perfect balance on their mixtape released on Halloween, where supernatural frights are replaced by guns and goons.

albums.title: Revelations
albums.label: Father/Daughter
albums.description: Shamir Bailey’s latest is a lo-fi set of interesting ideas that never quite gel. As ever, his soulful voice is the star, offering hints of sophistication and wonder.

albums.title: Jolly New Songs
albums.label: Blue Tapes
albums.description: On their nimble new LP, the Polish quartet Trupa Trupa bring some poetry and subtlety to psychedelic rock.

albums.title: Superlative Fatigue
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: Erik Wiegand produced his wildly fun new record with the digital synth he invented. Fueled by dancehall, its manic pleasure offers a way out of techno’s self-serious cul-de-sac.

albums.title: Under the Western Freeway
albums.label: Friendship Fever
albums.description: It’s been a sad year for these early-2000s indie-rock heroes, but this reissue of their cult-classic 1997 debut is a reminder that Grandaddy was a special band from the start.

albums.title: I Still Am
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: The new album from Yo Gotti—current ambassador of Memphis rap—digs deeper into his roles as struggler, hustler, and city spokesman, with a more pointed focus on betrayal.

albums.title: Value
albums.label: Big Dada
albums.description: The London producer’s latest full-length, a high-concept electronic consideration of the artistic soul, balances between fragility and bombast.

albums.title: The Dusk in Us
albums.label: Epitaph
albums.description: The ninth album from the metalcore architects is sharp and urgent. Jacob Bannon’s songwriting shines as he turns his back on interpersonal torment and faces something bigger and more existential.

albums.title: No Pop
albums.label: Felte
albums.description: On their fourth album, the restless Toronto trio change lanes again, this time to minimal, claustrophobic electronic music that sounds like the end of the world.

albums.title: Beach House 3
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Ty Dolla $ign’s new album is superbly refined. It leverages his gravelly voice, attention to detail, and willingness to kill his ego.

albums.title: The Space Between
albums.label: OVO Sound
albums.description: The refined sophomore album from Majid Jordan—best known for featuring on Drake’s “Hold On, We’re Going Home”—finds the Toronto duo coasting on an atmospheric pop-R&B sound that is uniquely their own.

albums.title: Stranger Things 2 (A Netflix Original Series Soundtrack)
albums.label: Lakeshore
albums.description: The heady electronic duo that gave Netflix’s sci-fi success story its signature sound are back for another round, with plenty of nostalgia and some new tricks.

albums.title: Static Age
albums.label: Caroline
albums.description: Recorded in 1978 and shelved for two decades, what should have been the band’s London Calling befuddled record execs who didn’t know what to do with a B-movie-obsessed punk with an Elvis croon.

albums.title: Walk Among Us
albums.label: Ruby Records
albums.description: They were outliers when they started, but by the time their classic debut arrived in 1982, Misfits’ gleeful, ghoulish punk rock was exactly in tune with the national mood.

albums.title: Danzig III: How the Gods Kill
albums.label: Def American
albums.description: On the third album he made with his biggest band, Glenn Danzig lived up to his larger-than-life metal-god myth in ways he’s rarely done since.

albums.title: Danzig
albums.label: Def American
albums.description: Glenn Danzig’s first eponymous album was a thunderous, Rick Rubin-produced progression of his moody, Evil Elvis sound. It’s the pinnacle of goth populism.

albums.title: 4eva Is a Mighty Long Time
albums.label: Multi Alumni
albums.description: Big K.R.I.T. is at the top of his game on his new double album. It’s an even split between booming subwoofers and tough-guy talk on one side and a considerable vulnerability on the other.

albums.title: Mirror Reaper
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: Seattle doom metal duo Bell Witch’s third album sounds broken down by life and death alike, but it scrapes together something like hope.

albums.title: All American Made
albums.label: Third Man
albums.description: On her second album, one of Nashville’s biggest new stars ups the ante with a stark survey of a country in crisis.

albums.title: Plunge
albums.label: Rabid
albums.description: On her second album as Fever Ray, Karin Dreijer is more conflicted, more manic—and more in love, too.

albums.title: Punk Drunk and Trembling EP
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: A month after calling it quits, the inventive British art-rockers bid farewell with a revealing EP drawn from the sessions for their final album.

albums.title: I Can Hear the Heart Beating as One
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: Twenty years on from its original release, Yo La Tengo’s finest album still sparkles with wit and charm, an album so cozy you forget about its musical eclecticism.

albums.title: Joli Mai
albums.label: Jialong
albums.description: Dan Snaith’s new LP as Daphni contains unmixed, extended versions of many of the tracks from his recent Fabriclive 93 mix. Some tracks falter in the context of an album, but others flower in new ways.

albums.title: Sonder Son
albums.label: Lost Kids
albums.description: On his heartfelt new album, R&B upstart Brent Faiyaz finds joy in the midst of struggle. He works through his pain without kowtowing to radio trends, offering a promising debut.

albums.title: Screen Memories
albums.label: Ribbon Music
albums.description: The latest collection from synth-pop retrofuturist and punk intellectual John Maus contains grander, darker songs than his previous albums. It’s a thrill to encounter his singular voice.

albums.title: Thinking Out Loud
albums.label: Paper Route Empire
albums.description: After two attempts on his life in seven months, the rapper Young Dolph has simply gotten back to work. His latest is a brisk, blunt album with tremendous features from Gucci Mane and 2 Chainz.

albums.title: A flame my love, a frequency
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: French artist Cécile Schott wrote her new LP as Colleen—an electronic reflection on mortality—in the wake of the 2015 Paris terrorist attacks. Despite the heavy themes, her sound is lighter than ever.

albums.title: Play the Songs You Like
albums.label: Salinas
albums.description: One of the hardest-working singers in indie-pop returns to his main band for their first full-length since 2014’s breakthrough Torch Song.

albums.title: Needle Paw
albums.label: Sony
albums.description: On her solo debut, Nai Palm abandons her band Hiatus Kaiyote’s expansive future-soul aesthetic in favor of acoustic intimacy; it is, above all, a testament to the power of the voice.

albums.title: Turn Out the Lights
