albums.label: Sinderlyn
albums.description: Peter Sagar is a former guitarist for Mac DeMarco, and his charms are not dissimilar from DeMarco’s own. Here, he incorporates yacht rock and R&B tropes for a thrift store synth-pop sound.

albums.title: 1982 4-Piece Demo
albums.label: Night School
albums.description: In the early 1980s, the Glasgow pop duo Strawberry Switchblade were a band with many possible futures. This raw three-song demo catches a glimpse of the group they could have become.

albums.title: LIVE
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: The six-piece BANANA features members of the Red Hot Chili Peppers and Warpaint, as well as the singer Cate Le Bon. LIVE is a playful, energetic session, influenced by Arthur Russell and Jon Hassell.

albums.title: Stellular
albums.label: Vermilion
albums.description: Since leaving the Pipettes, Rose Elinor Dougal has quietly released an impressive trove of lovelorn pop music. Stellular is wry, frosty and swooning by turns, romantic but hesitant.

albums.title: Sleater-Kinney: Live in Paris
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: This live album, consisting mostly of late-career highlights, emphasizes what Sleater-Kinney does best: playing not just with urgent feeling, but in service of immense meaning.

albums.title: Night Bully EP
albums.label: Wharf Cat
albums.description: In an underground scene where guitar bands tend to be one trick ponies, pummeling punk duo Urochromes’ unpredictability lends them a rare star quality.

albums.title: Ashes/Axis
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: On their fourth album proper, Cuddle Magic dive into the pop side of chamber pop with more fluency and confidence than they've ever shown in the past.

albums.title: Nothing Feels Natural
albums.label: Sister Polygon
albums.description: Priests’ debut expands into a rich diorama of stinging guitar, funk, yearning indie pop, and jazz; there hasn’t been a punk debut this certain and poised since Savages’ Silence Yourself.

albums.title: Performance
albums.label: Posh Isolation
albums.description: The Copenhagen duo Age Coin features two former members of the post-punk band Lower producing bleak industrial techno. Their second LP is inconsistent, but shows promise.

albums.title: The World Is a Loud Place
albums.label: Hometapes
albums.description: On their third album, Brooklyn’s Landlady perfect their quizzical prog-pop. The album is best when it's most vexing, while frontman Adam Schatz explores basic human sensation with a Cheshire Cat wit.

albums.title: Sensate Silk
albums.label: 100% Silk
albums.description: In the wake of the tragic Ghost Ship fire, 100% Silk has released Sensate Silk, a well-curated compilation that doubles as a rallying cry for dance music's underground.

albums.title: Godfather
albums.label: CTA
albums.description: The godfather of grime’s back-to-basics swan song isn’t just a celebration of his 20 year career—it’s a victory lap for grime at large.

albums.title: Culture
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: The Atlanta trio Migos come back after a commercial and creative dry spell with a #1 single and a definitive work.

albums.title: Dog
albums.label: Feeding Tube
albums.description: This Mexico City-based experimental collective has been operating underground for over 20 years. Here, Feeding Tube Records reissues a vital compilation of their art-rock psychedelia.

albums.title: Three Worlds: Music From Woolf Works
albums.label: Deutsche Grammophon
albums.description: Max Richter's score for the narrative dance piece Woolf Works shows how the minimalist composer has become obsessed with storytelling in the later years of his career.

albums.title: Drawing the Target Around the Arrow
albums.label: Panonica
albums.description: Caroline Polachek, of the recently disbanded synth-pop outfit Chairlift, offers eighteen sparse instrumental tracks, with reedy sine wave tones moving meditatively in negative space.

albums.title: Pure, Beyond Reproach
albums.label: Halocline Trance
albums.description: On his latest as Egyptrixx, it sounds more than ever like the Toronto electronic musician is trying to burrow inside a migraine, stick contact mics to its contours, and figure out what makes it tick.

albums.title: Dreamy Harbor
albums.label: Tresor
albums.description: This twelve-track compilation celebrates the German label Tresor, a vital point in the Detroit-Berlin techno axis. Drexciya, Donato Dozzy, Jon Hassell, and others contribute.

albums.title: SweetSexySavage
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: The new album from R&B singer Kehlani Parrish is refreshingly self-assured. She’s got a lot to say on these songs, which are blunt, unflinching, and exuberant.

albums.title: Behaviour
albums.label: Parlophone
albums.description: Like the Cure’s *Disintegration or Depeche Mode’s Violator, *the Pet Shop Boys’ fourth album transitioned their creators into the ’90s by both refining and breaking from the past.

albums.title: p h a r a o h
albums.label: Blackwhitegoldville
albums.description: California producer Jansport J makes instrumental hip-hop that summons J Dilla’s Donuts without falling in its shadow. p h a r a o h is his eighth and best album.

albums.title: Open Soul
albums.label: Melodies International
albums.description: The latest from Melodies International, the reissues label by Floating Points’ Sam Shepherd, is the 1976 LP from Chicago soul-disco band Tomorrow’s People—featuring an audacious 20-minute title track.

albums.title: This Is Steve
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: On his latest, guitarist Delicate Steve seems interested in animating rock’n’roll’s most outrageous qualities, using his studio savvy to make it do all the things it can’t in real life.

albums.title: Sports
albums.label: One Little Indian
albums.description: The young Icelandic post-punk band Fufanu traffic in icy disaffection and glacier-cool synths, but their latest album hints at hearts beating beneath the veneer.

albums.title: Myths 002 EP
albums.label: Mexican Summer
albums.description: On this brief EP, the duo of Ariel Pink and Weyes Blood’s Natalie Mering collaborate on strange folk-synth hybrids, evoking the ’80s Paisley Underground and X.

albums.title: The World Is Yours
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: The D.C. rapper Shy Glizzy—here rebranded as Jefe—offers  another tough-minded collection of street rap anthems, addressed to people struggling through poverty and the criminal-justice system.

albums.title: Elsewhere
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Following 2016’s breakout debut Cardinal, the New Jersey band Pinegrove have collected some of their best songs on a lovable new live album, with proceeds going to the Southern Poverty Law Center.

albums.title: Chill, dummy
albums.label: Doomtree
albums.description: Minneapolis rapper P.O.S is still all about his consciousness, and usefully motivated by anger. But on Chill, d**ummy, he embraces a freed-up feel, with some grooves you might hear in a club.

albums.title: EP II
albums.label: Baby Making
albums.description: The sound of Puerto Rican-born, NYC-based duo Buscabulla is post-chillwave but decidedly Caribbean, with nods to salsa, reggaeton, and bachata. Their sophomore EP features a duet with Helado Negro.

albums.title: Life Without Sound
albums.label: Wichita
albums.description: *Life Without Sound *is the most contemplative Cloud Nothings album yet.

albums.title: Hey Mr Ferryman
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Hey Mr Ferryman is Mark Eitzel’s heaviest album, but it’s also, in a peculiar way, his sweetest—like Phil Spector orchestrating a George Saunders story.

albums.title: Voyager
albums.label: Citizen
albums.description: There are glimpses of Vitalic's old energy on Voyager, but he's dialed back on the maximalist energy that made his dancefloor anthems radiate.

albums.title: Apocalipstick
albums.label: Secretly Canadian
albums.description: On their sophomore album, the Los Angeles rock trio fronted by Clementine Creevy have offered their fiercest recordings yet, full of shredding jams, furious howls, and self-aware swagger.

albums.title: Ty Segall
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: Segall’s new album feels like a sampler of what he’s been up to in the last half-decade. It's an easy entry point into his imposing catalog, and a complete portrait of his many capabilities.

albums.title: Big Trouble Little Jupiter
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Though not her best work, Big Trouble Little Jupiter showcases why Kodie Shane is one of rap’s most promising prospects: she’s resourceful and she’s fearless.

albums.title: Brokenlegged
albums.label: Tiny Engines
albums.description: *Brokenlegged *is a rich and multifaceted emo record, exploring not only the expected moments of catharsis, but the hangovers that arise in their aftermath.

albums.title: DJ-Kicks
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: Matthew Dear’s contribution to the DJ-Kicks series is his most engaging commercial mix yet. Intricately and intuitively mixed, it incorporates a handful of his own unreleased tracks.

albums.title: Rune Husk EP
albums.label: Sybaritic Peer
albums.description: The new EP is a retreat, another Of Montreal release where the standout track is the one that most sounds like Ziggy Stardust.

albums.title: Near to the Wild Heart of Life
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: For the most part, Near to the Wild Heart of Life sticks to the Japandroids M.O., but the end results are less enticing.

albums.title: Reverse
albums.label: Tapete
albums.description: This collaboration between experimental guitarist Richard Pinhas and Oren Ambarchi, Merzbow, and others sounds like rock music echoed out into the stratosphere.

albums.title: Year in 2016
albums.label: DTE
albums.description: The dynamic Atlanta rapper Trouble’s year-in-review mixtape is a smart flex, featuring collaborations with Young Thug, Fetty Wap, Quavo, and others.

albums.title: GTTM: Goin Thru the Motions
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: Philly artist PnB broke out last year with an appealing rapper-turned-singer swagger. His major label debut carefully balances his malleable take on R&B and street rap.

albums.title: Gods of Violence
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: On their fourteenth studio album, thrash legends Kreator give us more of the same jackhammer style they built the band's name on—only without quite as much personality or edge.

albums.title: Three Stripes
albums.label: Entertainment One
albums.description: The legendary New Jack Swing trio reunites for a new album, right as fellow alumni New Edition hit the charts for the first time in over a decade.

albums.title: Anticipation 3
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The R&B singer offers the third installment of his sexually charged mixtape series, featuring his latest protegé Mike x Angel on eight of its 11 tracks.

albums.title: I Ain’t Marching Anymore
albums.label: Elektra
albums.description: Phil Ochs’ second album is a work of long-steeped fury at his country’s sins, naked in its scorn for a system showing its many fissures; still, it guards a flickering, tenacious hope.

albums.title: Real Ting
albums.label: 54 London
albums.description: Real Ting is the first project of the impressive rising young London MC Stefanie Allen (aka Stefflon Don). The mixtape is a slightly rocky intro, but her raw talent shines through.

albums.title: Sferic Ghost Transmits
albums.label: Honest Jon's
albums.description: The new album from producers Sam Shackleton and Vengeance Tenfold foregoes traditional structures for byzantine, suite-like movements full of headtrip spoken word and drifting pads.

albums.title: Themes
albums.label: Blackest Ever Black
albums.description: The debut EP from cryptic London artist Naaahhh offers five tracks of murky electronic ambience, though it contains unmistakable traces of UK rave culture.

albums.title: Future Politics
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: With a newly pared down sound, Austra’s latest synth-pop record concerns itself primarily with the dark side of “the personal is political.” But it is essentially optimistic, and presents solutions.

albums.title: Lonely Planet
albums.label: Running Back
albums.description: The Australian producer’s new mini-album is his most fully realized work yet, and also his most original. It mostly ignores the dancefloor in favor of resting pulses and humid atmospheres.

albums.title: I Said No Doctors!
albums.label: Dymaxion Groove
albums.description: This compilation gathers experimental musicians like Dan Deacon, David Grubbs, Senyawa and others, all of whom explore the strange sounds they can make from eccentric instruments.

albums.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me OST
albums.label: Death Waltz
albums.description: Angelo Badalamenti’s soundtrack for David Lynch’s 1992 “Twin Peaks” film Fire Walk With Me remains as enchanting and evocative as ever, and gets a long overdue vinyl reissue courtesy of Death Waltz.

albums.title: Jardín
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: Gabriel Garzón-Montano became famous when Drake sampled his voice for “Jungle,” but his debut album stands on its own, heavy on pearly funk and pop, live instrumentation and harmony.

albums.title: The Grateful Dead: 50th Anniversary Deluxe Edition
albums.label: Rhino
albums.description: At the time of their endearing-but-muddy self-titled debut, “San Francisco’s Grateful Dead” were already local legends, but no one quite knew what to do with them on record.

albums.title: Raw Light II
albums.label: Western Vinyl
albums.description: The Austin-based producer Spencer Stephenson (aka Botany) builds his music, made from loosely interlocking samples and loops, like a collage artist.

albums.title: Trust Me EP
albums.label: Smalltown Supersound
albums.description: Scandinavian house and disco producer Mr. Tophat recruits his superstar compatriot Robyn for a three-song EP.

albums.title: Anything Could Happen
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: Anything Could Happen is the first album in 24 years from Bash & Pop, Tommy Stinson’s short-lived post-Replacements outfit. It’s less an exercise in reliving the past than coming to terms with it.

albums.title: Oczy Mlody
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Miley Cyrus only appears once on the Flaming Lips’ claustrophobic new full-length, but the record wouldn’t sound the way it does without her presence in their lives.

albums.title: Foxhole
albums.label: Slumberland
albums.description: This ’60s-loving London band, featuring former Veronica Falls member James Hoare, craft beguilingly simple, guitar-driven psych-pop. The new LP is a warm blanket of analog guitar and woolly harmony.

albums.title: Love If Possible
albums.label: Zelone
albums.description: Former Yura Yura Teikoku guitarist continues lap steel-dappled explorations of melancholy, funky kitsch.

albums.title: Music to Draw to: Satellite
albums.label: Arts & Crafts
albums.description: Veteran Montreal DJ Kid Koala steps away from the turntables for an album of cosmic-themed ambient pop, assisted by Icelandic singer-songwriter Emilíana Torrini.

albums.title: Compilation LP
albums.label: Wilsuns RC
albums.description: Compilation LP is a remastered suite of the fiery Philly punk five-piece’s three EPs to date. The 40-minute record hurtles ahead, a swarm of righteous energy with hooks in every corner.

albums.title: Changer
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: In the last year, indie rock lifer Fred Thomas got married, quit his day job, and moved to Canada, but *Changer *isn’t about that. It’s about getting older and how the weight of expectations is a bitch.

albums.title: Scenes of the Tourist
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Brooklyn-based songwriter Kyle Wall (aka Wharfer) makes his influences immediately clear—Bill Callahan, Lambchop’s Kurt Wagner, later Bob Dylan—but he doesn't really sound like anyone else.

albums.title: He's Got the Whole This Land Is Your Land in His Hands
albums.label: Joyful Noise
albums.description: Joan of Arc’s latest troll manifesto offers a nasty reminder of Tim Kinsella’s ability to ruffle feathers, playing up one of his most off-putting qualities: his humor.

albums.title: Luck Man
albums.label: Sinderlyn
albums.description: Tim Cohen, frontman of the Fresh & Onlys, is at his most modest and self-effacing here, building quiet, quirky songs out of acoustic guitars, soft percussion, and accents of piano and synth.

albums.title: Mountain Rock
albums.label: Orindal
albums.description: In 2004, Katy Davidson infused her indie-pop project Dear Nora—an influence on the likes of Girlpool and Joyce Manor—with a windswept folk sensibility. Her most complex album is newly reissued.

albums.title: Hang
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: On their last album, Foxygen sounded like a band trying to survive. On their latest, they reach for the sky, making an audacious timpani crash of an album that satirizes its own grandiosity.

albums.title: Hear the Lions Roar
albums.label: Fire
albums.description: Four decades in, Jad Fair retains his innocent abandon on Half Japanese’s sixteenth studio album Hear the Lions Roar.

albums.title: Wake in Fright
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Uniform is the industrial metal duo of vocalist Michael Berdan and guitarist/programmer Ben Greenberg. Their fevered, relentless sophomore record is the sound of clawing for survival and sanity.

albums.title: Germfree Adolescents
albums.label: EMI
albums.description: X-Ray Spex’s debut album is a brash, vivid masterpiece of the germinal punk era. Its songs tackle identity, feminism, and consumer society with fire and joy.

albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: The underrated British folk icon Michael Chapman collaborates with Steve Gunn on what he is calling his “American” album.

albums.title: Live - Meadowbrook, Rochester, Michigan - 12th September 1971
albums.label: Tidal Waves
albums.description: This just-reissued live album is not simply P-Funk in its early phase—it’s P-Funk in transition. Having hardly rehearsed with two new members, Meadowbrook captures moments of barely controlled chaos.

albums.title: Migration
albums.label: Ninja Tune
albums.description: Bonobo’s early records were slightly hazy and indistinct, but Migration is the most sophisticated effort of his career.

albums.title: Machine Messiah
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: Machine Messiah skirts the line between metal and conventional “hard rock” more than anything in the Sepultura catalog.

albums.title: Chixtape 4 / The New Toronto 2
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Rapper/singer Tory Lanez’s primary skill is mimicking others, and on a new pair of mixtapes, the rule seems to be: If it ain't broke, add new drums and put it out again.

albums.title: A Shadow in Time
albums.description: Basinski's new album *A Shadow in Time *contains some of his strongest work since The Disintegration Loops introduced him to the world at large.

albums.title: Two Zero One Seven
albums.label: Glory Boyz
albums.description: Chief Keef fittingly teams with trap architect Lex Luger for his daring new 17-song tape, which is weird and expansive. It reintroduces many of Keef’s most compelling quirks.

albums.title: Brothers
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: *Brothers *is a snapshot of two young producers—Suicideyear and Outthepound—evolving quickly. They both favor languid tempos and nostalgic synth tones, and their work has a druggy, melancholic feel.

albums.title: Iris OST
albums.artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: The duo of Adam Wiltzie (also of Stars of the Lid) and Dustin O’Halloran take their cosmic drones to the score for a French erotic thriller called Iris.

albums.title: Gentlewoman, Ruby Man
albums.label: Glassnote
albums.description: Part of the fun of this covers album from the Spacebomb Records crew is hearing how Matthew E. White and Flo Morrissey rethink how male and female voices can relate and react to each other.

albums.title: I See You
albums.label: Young Turks
albums.description: I See You, the third album by the xx, attempts to incorporate everyone’s talents into a new version of their sound, one true to their roots but richer and more varied.

albums.title: AFI (The Blood Album)
albums.label: Concord Music Group
albums.description: The timing couldn’t be better for AFI’s triumphant comeback; instead, they just sorta came back. This new LP works a “back to basics” operating principle, but it’s a “basics” that doesn’t serve them.

albums.title: The Fragile (2017 Definitive Edition) / The Fragile: Deviations 1
albums.label: The Null Corporation
albums.description: In its newly remastered and rereleased incarnation, Trent Reznor's 1999 magnum opus *The Fragile *scrapes the sky like never before. Its companion, a reworking called Deviations 1, is mostly a curio.

albums.title: As Was
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: Like Celtic Frost before them, Black Anvil find ways to summon profound darkness without tapping into black-metal clichés. Their latest ebbs and flows with effortless grace.

albums.title: White Friday (CM9)
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: After the late-career smash “Down in the DM,” Yo Gotti reinvigorates his long-running Cocaine Muzik series, serving his usual street fare with a bit more polish. It is a snapshot of Gotti in stride.

albums.title: Of Murk and Shallow Water EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The duo of 9T Antiope smashes together sounds from antiquity—singing reminiscent of medieval European folk, lyrics full of chariot and faeries—with hurtling production from the digital future.

albums.title: Hélices EP
albums.label: Salviatek
albums.description: The debut EP by Brazilian producer Superfície uses morphing club sounds to soundtrack a politically-charged sci-fi narrative of his country’s past, present, and future.

albums.title: The Natural
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The Natural is the best of Kool A.D.’s 10 (!) projects released in 2016, setting aside his deconstructive tendencies in favor of structured songs with intriguing, clever, and funny rhymes.

albums.title: Duo (DCWM) 2013
albums.label: RogueArt
albums.description: Saxophonist Anthony Braxton's collaboration with koto player Miya Masaoka is simultaneously dramatic and dreamy, swinging between free improv and ambient passages.

albums.title: Doing It in Lagos: Boogie, Pop & Disco in 1980s Nigeria
albums.label: Soundway
albums.description: This prescient reissue delivers a crucial set of Nigerian songs that show the country absorbing and beaming back singular versions of disco, boogie, electro, and early rap.

albums.title: Strictly 4 My Fans
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: G Herbo remains rap’s youngest old man, a wizened 21-year-old who sounds, for the third year running, like he’s on the cusp of something truly great.

albums.title: Forever
albums.label: Roadrunner
albums.description: With their third LP and major-label debut, the hardcore band Code Orange offer up compelling, caustic, and occasionally even catchy evidence that they have earned their alpha-dog scene posturing.

albums.title: Us or Else: Letter to the System
albums.label: Grand Hustle
albums.description: T.I.'s political tenth studio album presents itself as a warning to black Americans who find themselves labeled social disruptors for simply trying to live their lives harmoniously.

albums.title: Cockfighters EP
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: After a 20-year hiatus, this concise new Chavez EP arrives with little fanfare, drawing in a trancelike sound and Eastern-inspired melodies.

albums.title: Mezzanine
albums.label: Virgin
albums.description: On Mezzanine, Massive Attack tried to escape trip-hop. They nearly tore themselves apart and made its defining document instead.

albums.title: All of Them Naturals
albums.label: Static Shock
albums.description: The second EP from these Minneapolis punks is a well-honed collection of crude, soured rock and sardonic humor.

albums.title: Prelapsarian
albums.label: Hathenter
albums.description: Prelapsarian is the most compact of the New York-based metal band's albums. On these dense thirty-five minutes, they have both feet planted on terra firma and are racing against the doomsday clock.

albums.title: First Songs
albums.label: Kill Rock Stars
albums.description: First Songs collects Kleenex’s output from 1978 to 1982. Their gleefully anarchic music still feels like liberation, reveling in the limitless freedom that comes with tossing logic aside.

albums.title: New Start
albums.label: Teklife
albums.description: Taso’s new EP features collaborations with DJ Spinn and the late DJ Rashad, at times evoking the latter’s legendary album Double Cup.

albums.title: Insecure (Music From the HBO Original Series)
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Solange Knowles curates the soundtrack to the critically lauded HBO comedy “Insecure.” The 16 songs, mostly by or about women and almost exclusively by black artists, effortlessly mix R&B and rap.

albums.title: Tehillim
albums.label: Stroboscopic Artefacts
albums.description: The Tel Aviv-based electronic music producer Yotam Avni mines the trenches between tech, tribal and deep house, adding in choral elements that mingle the ancient with the futuristic.

albums.title: Stillness in Wonderland
albums.label: Age 101
albums.description: The prolific rapper Little Simz returns with a concept album that references Alice in Wonderland.

albums.title: Filthy America… It’s Beautiful
albums.label: Roc Nation
albums.description: On their first project in 17 years, the voices and the wordplay of Styles P, Jadakiss, and Sheek Louch have aged not one bit since 2000, for better and for worse.

albums.title: Reflection
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Eno's new ambient piece readily slots along works like the dreamlike Thursday Afternoon and 2012’s stately Lux. It feels the most pensive of his ambient works, flowing across 54 unbroken minutes.

albums.title: Clear Sounds/Perfetta
albums.label: Important
albums.description: The late sculptor Harry Bertoia became a drone musician almost by chance, making tactile sound-art out of metal rods before his death in 1978. These previously unreleased recordings befit his legacy.

albums.title: Nadir
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: On his austere fourth full-length, the Berlin-based electronic artist Steven Warwick uses ambient synth sketches to convey feelings of precarity and millennial abjection.

albums.title: Run the Jewels 3
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: RTJ3 is essentially the Run the Jewels manifesto, an outpouring of rage and defiance that never loses sight of the objectives: rallying the troops, holding all accountable, and toppling oppression.

albums.title: Don’t Smoke Rock
albums.label: Babygrande
albums.description: New York hip-hop godfather Pete Rock joins forces with Smoke DZA on an album of uptown cool and crisp soul.

albums.title: December 99th
albums.label: A Country Called Earth
albums.description: On December 99th, Yasiin Bey (fka Mos Def) sounds like he no longer believes his own words, or he’s tired of hearing himself say them. It is by far the worst thing he’s ever released.

albums.title: Brønshøj (Puncak)
albums.label: Cejero
albums.description: Fusing folk, doom metal, and improv noise, the Indonesian duo Senyawa are unlike any other band. The five songs of their new LP are drawn out and meditative, admitting little daylight.

albums.title: Punk45: Les Punks: The French Connection (The First Wave of French Punk 1977-80)
albums.label: Soul Jazz
albums.description: Soul Jazz’s Punk 45 series has made it its mission to chart the forgotten corners of punk rock, and the latest version explores what happened when punk landed in mainland Europe.

albums.title: Merry Christmas Lil’ Mama
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Chance the Rapper and Jeremih’s surprise release is a Christmas album for the final yuletide of the Obama administration: one last bastion of hope in an uncertain and fraught time.

albums.title: ///// Effectual
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: On his solo percussion LP, Jamire Williams shows himself to be an inspired crafter of sound, capable of building entire worlds from just his drum hits.

albums.title: Love You to Death
albums.label: Radio Killa
albums.description: The undervalued singer/songwriter/producer offers a bedroom-friendly five-track EP filled with slow-motion songs about lust, desire, and regret.

albums.title: What Graceless Dawn
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: On their earthy new album, the Bay Area metal trio Worm Ouroboros exhibit a literary flair and mysterious, eternal power.

albums.title: Holy Science
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: A fixture of New York’s experimental scene, the vocalist Amirtha Kidambi makes her bandleading debut on Holy Science, fusing classical Indian music, drone, and free jazz with an original perspective.

albums.title: Not the Actual Events EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Nine Inch Nails’ surprise-release new EP Not the Actual Events is slight, but at moments it delivers the kind of visceral fury that NIN hasn’t recreated since its mid-’90s Downward Spiral heyday.

albums.title: The Wasp Factory
albums.label: Bedroom Community
albums.description: In 2013, the composer Ben Frost and librettist David Pountney devised an unconventional opera piece inspired by the 1984 psychological horror novel The Wasp Factory. Its music is shockingly beautiful.

albums.title: EARLY TAPES, 1996-1998
albums.label: P.W. Elverum & Sun
albums.description: Even though this collection of unreleased songs and rarities is slight, it testifies to the enduring power of the Microphones, and how they represented a thriving part of Pacific Northwest indie.

albums.title: Traditional Music of Notional Species Vol. II
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: The second volume in Rashad Becker’s series is redolent of Smithsonian Folkways’ field recordings, with nods to early musique concrète and intercepted extraterrestrial transmissions.

albums.title: A Very Kacey Christmas
albums.label: Mercury
albums.description: Kacey Musgraves' first holiday album summons ‘60s nostalgia, embraces kitschy exotica, and passes the pipe with Willie Nelson.

albums.title: Turn Into
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: Melina Duterte is a San Francisco musician who performs as Jay Som. She plays every instrument on her album Turn Into, a kaleidoscopic collection of dream pop touching on multiple moods.

albums.title: The Great Southern Trendkill
albums.label: Rhino
albums.description: Intended as a rallying cry against shifting trends, Pantera's most abrasive album comes off more like a cry for help that reveals the turmoil eating the band from within. It's also thrilling.

albums.title: Swiss Radio Days Vol. 41 - Zurich 1961
albums.label: Challenge
albums.description: A new Ray Charles reissue finds the maestro in thrilling form in Switzerland—and those Quincy Jones charts are just gravy.

albums.title: Do What Thou Wilt.
albums.label: Top Dawg
albums.description: On his latest, syllable-twisting conspiracy theorist Ab-Soul becomes so information-obsessed that he loses sight of actual meaning. The songs are empty riddles, leading nowhere and saying nothing.

albums.title: The Return of East Atlanta Santa
albums.label: 1017 Brick Squad
albums.description: The Return of East Atlanta Santa leans on the lighter, more playful side of Gucci’s personality. You can hear him settling into his clean post-prison lifestyle and his new, clearer voice.

albums.title: Jackie OST
albums.label: Milan
albums.description: With the power of an orchestra behind her, Mica Levi provides a melancholy pulse for Jackie's portrait of a seemingly unknowable historical figure.

albums.title: Passion, Pain & Demon Slayin’
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: Scott Mescudi’s latest tome, the 87-minute Passion, Pain & Demon Slayin’, is the most focused he’s sounded since 2010’s Man on the Moon II, with the same drawbacks that have always plagued him.

albums.title: Pieces in Space
albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: The Ithaca, N.Y. rapper/producer Sammus writes at the intersection of race, womanhood, sexuality, and nerdiness. Pieces in Space is her strongest work to date.

albums.title: Slight Freedom
albums.label: Eremite
albums.description: Restraint prevails on the debut solo record from Tortoise’s Jeff Parker—a collection of quiet, atmospheric mood studies that seems to hang in mid-air.

albums.title: Fireplace: TheNotTheOtherSide
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: After years of mixtapes, erstwhile Odd Future rapper and MellowHype MC releases his debut album. He sounds completely unmoored, stuck somewhere between punchline rapper, storyteller, and moralist.

albums.title: In the Loop: A Decade of Remixes
albums.label: Fool's Gold
albums.description: The lavish In the Loop 6x7” box set collects A-Trak’s remix work. Listening to all of them at once reveals that he often tried to please everyone, and also that he intermittently succeeded.

albums.title: Throat
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: Aaron David Ross’s latest as ADR is composed of vocal samples, most scrubbed clean of any signifiers of human origin. The effect is amusing, even creepy, and recalls Holly Herndon or Katie Gately.

albums.title: Heart Song
albums.label: Brutal Honest
albums.description: Texan singer/songwriter Jess Williamson ditches the bucolic sound of her stark debut for a haunted urban malaise that feels far more natural for her.

albums.title: American Boyfriend: A Suburban Love Story
albums.label: BROCKHAMPTON
albums.description: Kevin Abstract seems like an endearing alt-rock frontman in a rapper's body. On American Boyfriend, his sophomore album, he explores the insecurities and ravages of his high school years.

albums.title: Chronology
albums.label: New Amsterdam
albums.description: Dawn of Midi drummer Qasim Naqvi's latest EP unearths new, ambient-influenced grooves with a vintage Moog.

albums.title: Oh No No No Remixes EP
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Jessy Lanza’s new EP features remixes from former collaborators and tourmates DJ Taye and DJ Spinn of Chicago footwork crew Teklife, Morgan Geist aka Storm Queen, and Leon Smart as DVA [Hi:Emotions].

albums.title: W:/2016ALBUM/
albums.label: mau5trap
albums.description: On his latest, EDM titan deadmau5 continues to hint that he might have a better, richer album in him. Once more, he has not made it.

albums.title: Grunewald
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: Composer Peter Broderick manages to make simple, beautiful post-classical music with a distinctive personality. His new EP collects five tracks taken from a single day’s live recording in Berlin.

albums.title: Melo de Melo EP
albums.label: Drumma
albums.description: On this two-track EP, Ricardo Villalobos teams with fellow Chilean producer Umho to celebrate their shared love of Latin American music.

albums.title: Equality Now EP
albums.label: Numbers
albums.description: Peder Mannerfelt has produced groups like Fever Ray and Blonde Redhead. On his new EP, he channels his interest in emancipatory politics and exotic rhythms into crisp, clever tracks.

albums.title: Bob Dylan: The 1966 Live Recordings
albums.label: Columbia Legacy
albums.description: This 36-disc box set presents every surviving tape of Bob Dylan's 1966 world tour, capturing combative audiences and transcendent performances nearly every night.

albums.title: Stoney
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: Following the success of his viral hit “White Iverson,” Post Malone releases a 68-minute album that shows exactly why he should have never been given the chance to release a 68-minute album.

albums.title: Hologram İmparatorluğu
albums.label: Glitterbeat
albums.description: The Turkish singer Gaye Su Akyol has emerged at the fore of her country’s revitalized music scene in recent years. Her new album mixes Turkish modes and scales with grunge, surf rock, and psychedelia.

albums.title: Skin Companion EP I
albums.label: Mom & Pop
albums.description: After rocketing into the stratosphere with his first album and struggling with second album syndrome, Australian producer Flume scales back with a lithe, quirky, understated EP.

albums.title: 4 Your Eyez Only
albums.label: Roc Nation
albums.description: On J. Cole’s fourth album, he wrestles with the fragility of life and the importance of family ties.  He also sands down some of his worst impulses.

albums.title: The Early Years 1965-1972
albums.label: Legacy
albums.description: This massive box set captures the British art-rock legends’ progression from Syd Barrett’s cracked-out psychedelia through the experimental song suites of the early 1970s.

albums.title: Sketches for My Sweetheart the Drunk
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Jeff Buckley died before completing his second album. Sketches for My Sweetheart the Drunk, compiling those sessions, gives a glimpse into an erratic mind that could be too mercurial for its own good.

albums.title: Bucket List Project
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Chicago rapper Saba is a frequent collaborator with Chance the Rapper. His latest mixtape, Bucket List Project, is about the experiences we long to pack into one lifetime.

albums.title: The Hamilton Mixtape
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On The Hamilton Mixtape, songs from the iconic musical have been reinterpreted by Nas, Jill Scott, Alicia Keys, Chance the Rapper, and others, for some reason.

albums.title: Welcome To Sideways
albums.label: Delicacies
albums.description: Simian Mobile Disco have survived past the death of their microgenre ”bloghouse.” Their latest album is a study in dance music rather than a practice, a suite that demands to be heard in one sitting.

albums.title: Bobo Yéyé: Belle Époque in Upper Volta
albums.label: Numero Group
albums.description: Across three discs of rough-hewed yet honeyed music, this three-disc set captures the cosmopolitan scene of Africa’s post-colonial Upper Volta in the 1960s and ’70s.

albums.title: Africa Express Presents... The Orchestra of Syrian Musicians & Guests
albums.label: Transgressive
albums.description: Damon Albarn and Africa Express organized this concert with 50 musicians from the Syrian National Orchestra. Featuring Julia Holter, Albarn, and others, it reaffirms that art at its best is a gesture of empathy.

albums.title: Blessed Initiative
albums.label: Subtext
albums.description: As Blessed Initiative, experimental producer and sound artist Yair Elazar Glotman explores some deeply uncomfortable and unsettling spaces. But there is a strange and beautiful majesty to his work.

albums.title: Zero Gravity EP
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: The Atlanta rapper and singer Kodie Shane is the most talented member of Lil Yachty’s motley crew, and on this EP—a bite-sized compilation of old tracks and new ones—everything clicks.

albums.title: BOX
albums.label: Kompakt
albums.description: Nearly twenty years later, Wolfgang Voigt’s records under the GAS alias still assault our presumptions about electronic music. How can music that seems to be monotonous convey such beauty and clarity?

albums.title: Relationships
albums.label: Fool's Gold
albums.description: On his debut full-length, the Brooklyn producer invites a wide range of guests over for a genre-spanning studio party. 21 Savage, Hudson Mohawke, DJ Rashad and the Deftones’ Chino Moreno feature.

albums.title: Peace Trail
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: The ten sparse protest songs on Neil Young's strange and scrappy new album address the dissemination of fake news, the mistreatment of America’s indigenous people, and the water crisis in Flint.

albums.title: Der Klang der Offenbarung des Göttlichen
albums.label: Bel-Air Glamour Records
albums.description: After spending fifteen years as a member of Sigur Rós, composer Kjartan Sveinsson makes the leap into classical with a sweeping, elegiac orchestral and choral score.

albums.title: Badmotorfinger
albums.label: A&M
albums.description: Soundgarden's Badmotorfinger captures the band clicking on all cylinders. The album sustains a level of focus, cohesion, and intensity that the band’s later, more varied albums lack.

albums.title: How to Disappear in America
albums.label: White Material
albums.description: Techno artist and White Material label cofounder Young Male branches off from floor fillers on his latest. This is dank, ominous, beat-free music that suggests a certain weary fatalism.

albums.title: Blue & Lonesome
albums.label: Polydor
albums.description: On their bashed-out new album of blues covers, the Stones sound, for the first time in eons, like a band playing together in the same room rather than one that travels on separate jets.

albums.title: Harlequin
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: A modernist spin on the ’70s singer-songwriter album, Harlequin often seems torn between its ambition and its nonchalance, a mix of perplexing quirks and disarming heart.

albums.title: 1017 vs. the World
albums.label: 1017 Brick Squad
albums.description: On their new collaborative 7-song mixtape, Lil Uzi Vert and Gucci Mane have a Who Framed Roger Rabbit dynamic, where Uzi is the elastic Roger and Gucci the human detective Eddie Valiant.

albums.title: The Weight of These Wings
albums.label: Sony
albums.description: Miranda Lambert’s double album arrives in the wake of her high-profile divorce from Blake Shelton, but it is refreshingly devoid of spite or anger—more “Shelter From the Storm” than “Idiot Wind.”

albums.title: love and noir.
albums.label: Input
albums.description: This Brooklyn duo traffics in spare, low-lit R&B, its elements bleeding together or blurring just out of focus.

albums.title: Zoovier
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Fetty Wap’s new tape doesn't quite answer the question of whether the New Jersey rapper will sustain his success or remain “Trap Queen Guy” forevermore.

albums.title: “Awaken, My Love!”
albums.label: Glassnote
albums.description: On Donald Glover’s latest project as Childish Gambino, he ditches rap for lovingly produced funk worship, resulting in his most enjoyable project yet.

albums.title: Only Heaven
albums.label: Ahead of Our Time
albums.description: On this new EP, the British electronic duo and Ninja Tune label founders reckon with the disorientation of our media moment. Their approach is unfortunately vague.

albums.title: Darkness and Light
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: On Darkness and Light, John Legend pushes beyond his comfort zone for something a bit more ambitious.  This is a love record about navigating the bleak world and finding happiness in dark times.

albums.title: Unfinished Music No. 1: Two Virgins / Unfinished Music No. 2: Life With the Lions / Yoko Ono Plastic Ono Band
albums.label: Secretly Canadian
albums.description: Yoko Ono’s radical influence on pop history has inspired generations of visionary musicians. Deeply rooted in Fluxus, Ono’s newly-reissued early albums help to detail her broader artistic intentions.

albums.title: Let It Be You
albums.label: Reveal
albums.description: On their collaboration, singer-songwriter Joan Wasser of Joan as Police Woman and Benjamin Lazar Davis of the chamber pop outfit Cuddle Magic bond over their fascination with big, mainstream pop.

albums.title: The Devil and God Are Raging Inside Me
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Brand New's The Devil and God Are Raging Inside Me blew up teen angst to literally biblical proportions, resonating like no emo band before or since to outcasts in Sunday school *and *high school.

albums.title: Singles
albums.label: Strut
albums.description: Strut offers a richly researched and smartly sequenced compilation of all of Sun Ra's singles, offering a compelling and unique look at the cosmic jazz innovator’s genius.

albums.title: Remain Calm
albums.label: Slipdisc
albums.description: On this collaborative LP, Mica Levi (Micachu & the Shapes) pairs with the cellist Oliver Coates (a contributor to Radiohead’s A Moon Shaped Pool) for one of 2016’s more enjoyable experimental albums.

albums.title: Häxan
albums.label: Mexican Summer
albums.description: Häxan is the first instrumental effort by the psych-rock band Dungen, a scoring of the 1926 animation classic The Adventures of Prince Achmed.

albums.title: Broken Knowz
albums.label: Technicolour
albums.description: The Detroit techno and house producer Jay Daniel expands outward, embracing his role as percussionist and folding vibrant live textures into his sound.

albums.title: Keita Sano
albums.label: Rett I Fletta
albums.description: Keita Sano is the Japanese producer's most grounded and focused work yet. These tracks fit into no particular paradigm or scene; they are stuffed with ideas, all of which hope to make you dance.

albums.title: Out of Time
albums.label: Concord Bicycle
albums.description: Along with Nevermind, released a half year later, R.E.M.’s Out of Time was the early-’90s major-label ideal: A blockbuster that multiplied the band’s following without losing existing fans.

albums.title: Amore Per Tutti
albums.label: NNA Tapes
albums.description: The 14-piece ensemble Tredici Bacci pays loving and exacting tribute to the lush spaghetti western scores of Ennio Morricone without getting musty or dull: This is reverent, goofy, and fun music.

albums.title: 24K Magic
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On his latest, “Uptown Funk” vocalist and animatronic sequined suit Bruno Mars compresses all of his various personae into one: The retro song-and-dance man who happens to be really, really horny.

albums.title: Young Death / Nightmarket
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Burial's latest EP has a wispy, vaporous quality, evoking a liminal space between events, a present moment all about suggestion.

albums.title: Abendrot
albums.label: Triple Crown
albums.description: The latest record from emo outfit You Blew It! is their most subdued yet, trading pop-punk yelps for the smoothly layered guitars of Mineral and American Football.

albums.title: Red Friday
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: On his new new seven-song EP, dropped on short notice, YG is back on full throttle, racing ahead and sounding more nimble than ever.

albums.title: What You Get for Being Young
albums.label: Melody As Truth
albums.description: This gently melancholic album from the ambient artist Suzanne Kraft offers solace while rejecting the soporific.

albums.title: Six Pianos / Keyboard Study #1
albums.label: Forced Exposure
albums.description: Berlin's FILM Recordings offers a new recording of two golden-era works by the minimalist masters, reimagined and modernized.

albums.title: PC Music, Vol. 2
albums.label: PC Music
albums.description: Cobbling together styles from Top 40 and the dance underground alike, Vol. 2 raises the question: Can a microgenre that’s all self-consciously hyper-“contemporary” veneer sustain itself long-term?

albums.title: Mystery Cove
albums.label: Gold Robot
albums.description: Mystery Cove, the fourth Monster Rally full-length, is pure, distilled escapism: 42 straight minutes of somewhere else, no SPF required. It is a Hawaiian shirt with an AUX input.

albums.title: Starboy
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: With Beauty Behind the Madness, Abel Tesfaye achieved pop stardom without compromising his vision. On its uninspired follow-up, Starboy, he seems to lose sight of that vision almost entirely.

albums.title: L.A. Heartbreak
albums.label: Time No Place
albums.description: The electro-punk duo Rainbow Arabia make their smoothest, most pop-friendly, and sophisticated statement yet.

albums.title: Wonderland
albums.label: Modern Love
albums.description: Continuing the beat-oriented experiments of their 12” club tunes, the electronic duo Demdike Stare blend their doomy aesthetic with dancehall cadences for their most compelling full-length.

albums.title: Woman
albums.label: Ed Banger
albums.description: With Woman, Justice attempt the sort of analog nostalgia trip Daft Punk pulled off on Random Access Memories. Have the enfants terribles of French house grown up?

albums.title: Defy a Thing to Be
albums.label: Vague Terrain
albums.description: The debut release from queer multimedia artist Bully Fae, on Matmos' Vague Terrain label, mixes rapping, stand-up comedy, spoken-word, and more into a hilarious and fascinating whole.

albums.title: On Behalf of Nature
albums.label: ECM New Series
albums.description: Meredith Monk's influence as a singer and composer extends through Björk, Joanna Newsom and beyond. On Behalf of Nature is a plea for ecological awareness with no lectures, just beauty and empathy.

albums.title: Sixth Stitch
albums.label: Break World
albums.description: New York’s Dylan Scheer, who DJs and produces as Via App, specializes in channeling noise, chaos, and discomfort into tracks that still work on the dancefloor.

albums.title: The D-Boy Diary Books 1 & 2
albums.label: Heavy on the Grind
albums.description: After a relatively quiet 2015, the Bay Area legend returns to his firehose production methods, dropping another slab of new material. But there's an increasing sense that he's repeating himself.

albums.title: Young Narrator in the Breakers
albums.label: Bella Union
albums.description: Pavo Pavo's debut LP sounds like a dispatch from what people in the mid-20th century thought the future would be like: jetpacks, Mars landings and dehydrated Thanksgiving dinners.

albums.title: Before the Dawn
albums.label: Fish People
albums.description: This 155-minute, three-disc live album documents Kate Bush’s spectacular 2014 live shows, her first in 35 years. She reckons with her legacy through what might seem like an obscure setlist.

albums.title: Death Certificate
albums.label: Priority
albums.description: Death Certificate is Ice Cube’s most important (if not his best) album, and one of the most essential works in rap history.

albums.title: Redemption
albums.label: Local Action
albums.description: Redemption concludes Dawn Richard's trilogy. If Goldenheart was aggressive and Blackheart depressive, Redemption is reflective, an unusual headspace for a dance floor album to inhabit.

albums.title: Vergers
albums.label: Important
albums.description: Sarah Davachi's minimalist work belongs to a tradition of deep, shimmering drone music. Play her music in a quiet room on good speakers and you can practically see the air moving around your head.

albums.title: What’s Your Sign?
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: This collaborative album from the punk-influenced composer Rhys Chatham and Brooklyn noise-jam heroes Oneida builds on power and cosmic eruptions.

albums.title: A O R T A
albums.label: New Amsterdam
albums.description: Avant-garde pianist Vicky Chow releases an album full of roving, tense compositions from modern-day composers, blending her traditional piano with blurs of digital effects and percussion.

albums.title: WORRY.
albums.label: SideOneDummy
albums.description: In certain circles, Jeff Rosenstock is one of the most important figures in modern punk, and with WORRY., he has made his magnum opus.

albums.title: Wyatt at the Coyote Palace
albums.label: Omnibus
albums.description: Hersh's latest solo album is a typically personal and idiosyncratic affair, rich with dense but frank allusions to the dissolution of her 25-year marriage.

albums.title: Boots No. 1: The Official Revival Bootleg
albums.label: Acony
albums.description: On this collection of officially sanctioned archival bootlegs, we can hear the roots country icon Gillian Welch in the process of discovering and honing her inimitable voice.

albums.title: Free Bricks 2: Zone 6 Edition
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The here-then-gone-again collaborative Gucci/Future mixtape *Free Bricks 2 *is the sound of two superlative talents working without boundaries.

albums.title: Daniel Bachman
albums.label: Three Lobed
albums.description: Acoustic guitarist Daniel Bachman's second self-titled album is his most thoughtful release to date, filled with mindful reflection, confident patience, and a sense of ecological awareness.

albums.title: Hardwired...to Self-Destruct
albums.label: Blackened Recordings
albums.description: Like Death Magnetic, Metallica’s latest is an attempt to revisit their early days. The only difference is that this time they sound like they’re actually trying, and maybe even having a bit of fun.

albums.title: Shadow Boat EP
albums.label: Tresor
albums.description: On their first new record in 17 years, the music of dub techno pioneers Porter Ricks has hardly changed, and really, that's for the best.

albums.title: “ring spiel” tour ’95
albums.label: Legacy
albums.description: This live album captures one night in the unlikely, alt-rock-superstar-laden tour behind Minutemen legend Mike Watt's first solo album, featuring Eddie Vedder, Dave Grohl, and more.

albums.title: Flasher EP
albums.label: Sister Polygon
albums.description: On their debut EP, the Washington, DC post-punk trio Flasher offer seven impressively-honed songs that speak to selfhood and sublimation.

albums.title: Incunabula / Amber / Tri Repetae
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Revisiting electronic pioneers Autechre’s earliest albums, now reissued, is like returning to a previously uninhabitable planet and being startled to find residents living and thriving there.

albums.title: On Dark Silent Off
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: The tactile and heartfelt fifth album by the instrumental Austrian trio Radian doesn’t simply reward repeated listens, it demands them.

albums.title: No Waves
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: This live set captures Body/Head (improvisational guitarist Bill Nace and Kim Gordon) operating at a furious peak, reeling from no-wave to free jazz to pop hooks in an exhilarating blur.

albums.title: Patterns of Light
albums.label: London London
albums.description: His Name Alive's new album is inspired by the Large Hadron Collider, filtering the cosmic implications of the awe-inspiring device through the stonier side of ‘70s rock.

albums.title: I’m Your Man
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: I’m Your Man reinvented Leonard Cohen at age 53. It is the most fun you can have while being told that life is a terrible joke.

albums.title: The Microcosm: Visionary Music of Continental Europe, 1970-1986
albums.label: Light in the Attic
albums.description: The Microcosm is a sort of European answer to the influential new age comp I Am the Center. Featuring Vangelis, Hans-Joachim Roedelius and others, it draws lines between visionaries of many stripes.

albums.title: Yaroze Dream Suite
albums.label: Local Action
albums.description: On this woozy collaborative EP, the grime producers Mr. Mitch and Yamaneko trade the genre’s brute force for restraint, drawing out subtle threads and small pockets of emotion.

albums.title: Nightride
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Tinashe's latest release is another helping of the moody, ominous R&B that she has quietly made her name on.

albums.title: Highway Songs
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: David Pajo's latest album as Papa M is wistful and poignant, like all his work. But it ultimately feels hopeful rather than weary, upbeat rather than defeated.

albums.title: Luz
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: Devonwho is part of the Klipmode collective that includes Leaving records labelmates MNDSGN and Knxwledge. His take on blunted instrumental hip-hop favors the wobbly synths of the early ’80s.

albums.title: Persona EP
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: On his Warp debut, the Italian producer Lorenzo Senni deploys a Roland JP8000 synthesizer to isolate the builds and breakdowns of trance, to thrilling effect.

albums.title: An Odd Entrances
albums.label: Castle Face
albums.description: Though it’s not a force of nature like the other LPs Thee Oh Sees have produced since returning from their farcically brief 2013 hiatus, Odd Entrances more than keeps their streak alive.

albums.title: Telling It Like It Is
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Marching Church used to be the solo effort of Iceage frontman Elias Bender Rønnenfelt, but now he has incorporated a backing band and scaled up the melodrama.

albums.title: Ecologies II: Ecosystems of Excess
albums.label: Knives
albums.description: J.G. Biberkopf's Ecologies II: Ecosystems of Excess is an often fascinating record of music that sits between the club, gallery, and lecture hall. It stumbles most when it sounds like the last.

albums.title: The Madness of Many
albums.label: Sumerian
albums.description: Animals as Leaders provide a dense and triumphant brand of instrumental metal that can be dazzling or exhausting, depending on your mood.

albums.title: We got it from Here... Thank You 4 Your service
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: A Tribe Called Quest’s sixth (and final) album was a rumor for 18 years. It’s here, and against many odds, it reinvigorates the group’s discography without resting on nostalgia.

albums.title: Slugger
albums.label: Carpark
albums.description: Speedy Ortiz's Sadie Dupuis steps out with a self-produced solo album that's all about positivity, in all caps and probably punctuated with multiple exclamation points.

albums.title: $uccessor (ded004)
albums.label: Hospital
albums.description: On his first full-length as Dedekind Cut, the artist formerly known as Lee Bannon constructs an ambitious form of ambient music, reflecting the violence and anxiety pervading our atmosphere today.

albums.title: &
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: On his third solo LP, the Cologne producer Michael Mayer collaborates with a different artist on each track. The album plays to his strengths, balancing strict grooves with faint hints of mischief.

albums.title: Michael Gordon: Timber Remixed
albums.label: Cantaloupe
albums.description: On Timber Remixed, the likes of Tim Hecker, Fennesz, and Oneohtrix Point Never tackle Bang On a Can co-founder Michael Gordon’s driving and rhythmic work for wood planks.

albums.title: Washington Phillips and His Manzarene Dreams
albums.label: Dust-to-Digital
albums.description: The life and music of gospel singer Washington Phillips has been shrouded in mystery for years. His gentle, measured, unearthly music, played on a handmade instrument,  is still a world unto itself.

albums.title: Restless
albums.label: Cantaloupe
albums.description: The clarinetist and saxophonist Ken Thomson, whose roving works include covers of Björk and Meshuggah, records an album of minimalist chamber music full of feints and surprising paths.

albums.title: Folk Time
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Folk Time is the sound of Jerry Garcia and Robert Hunter absorbing their own set of influences, building their repertoires, and finding their voices.

albums.title: MC4
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: In just over a decade of work, French Montana has gone from hanger-on to something more vital and far more interesting. MC4 is a reminder of why he’s been able to survive a couple sea changes in rap.

albums.title: Long Live the Angels
albums.label: Virgin
albums.description: The British pop star Emeli Sandé writes power ballads that start at “cinematic” and scale upward. Her second album places that massive voice atop tracks of stately but interchangeable gloom.

albums.title: Free the Real (Pt. 2)
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: The young German-Haitian singer-songwriter, who has famously written songs for Rihanna, basks in the gangly freedom of developing her own voice.

albums.title: Holiday for Strings
albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: The 78-year-old folk legend remains in a spirit full of joy, an embodiment of old-time string band chaos and a bastion of enthusiasm for the legacy of music as storytelling.

albums.title: The Complete Sony Recordings
albums.label: Sony Classical
albums.description: This massive box set offers perhaps the definitive and most comprehensive collection of Philip Glass’ work ever assembled.

albums.title: Amalgam
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: An avant-garde cellist and a great turntablist collaborate on a 36-minute, fully improvised set that blurs the line between her strings and his samples.

albums.title: Monument Builders
albums.label: Kranky
albums.description: The eleventh album from prolific ambient artist Scott Morgan maps a more human, and less quantifiable, concept: life’s resistance to dark and destructive forces.

albums.title: Double Nickels on the Dime
albums.label: SST
albums.description: The Minutemen's classic double album is unlike any punk record, or double album, before or since. It is a compact explosion of ideas and a prism for the energies coursing through the ‘80s underground.

albums.title: Ping Pong
albums.label: Mag Mag
albums.description: On their fourth full-length, Jacuzzi Boys’ ongoing transition from garage rock to slick pop remains hampered by their vacuous attitude.

albums.title: Devil Music
albums.label: We Are The Men
albums.description: The Men retreat to their caustic roots with a raw and furious album that, while often predictable, is still a prime example of how well they rage.

albums.title: Bleed for This OST
albums.label: Milan
albums.description: Ten of the eighteen tracks on the soundtrack for the Miles Teller-starring boxing film Bleed for This come courtesy of composer Julia Holter, in her first-ever film work.

albums.title: Hubris
albums.label: Editions Mego
albums.description: Jim O’Rourke, Crys Cole, Keith Fullerton Whitman, Mark Fell, and Ricardo Villalobos all join Ambarchi on a dense and rewarding album that never succumbs to the weight of its collaborators.

albums.title: Ded Sec - Watch Dogs 2 (OST)
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Hudson Mohawke's gleaming soundtrack to the open-world action-adventure game Ded Sec - Watch Dogs 2 makes a surprisingly strong followup to his last proper full-length, last year's Lantern.

albums.title: Systems/Layers
albums.label: Quarterstick
albums.description: Rachel's pioneered a blend of modern classical music and post-rock that you can hear in current practitioners Jóhann Jóhannsson and Max Richter. Their 2003 album Systems/Layers is their masterpiece.

albums.title: Dead to the World
albums.label: EarMusic
albums.description: Page Hamilton takes more chances than he ever has on Dead to the World, Helmet's eighth studio album and fourth since he re-launched the brand with a revolving cast of side musicians.

albums.title: Have a Nice Dream
albums.label: DUM SHINY
albums.description: In the last year, former Das Racist member Kool A.D. has released hundreds of tracks across multiple releases, and the latest zooms in on and explores a luxurious, off-kilter wooziness.

albums.title: Ghosthouse
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Uniform's sound is a marriage made in industrial-punk Hades, draping righteous pique over a grind lashed together from guitar groan and staple-gun electronics.

albums.title: HERE
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: On her new album, Alicia Keys inhabits the personae of multiple characters but still doesn't tell us much about herself.

albums.title: Arcade
albums.label: New Funk Academy
albums.description: Topaz Jones is a young, positive-thinking New York-based rapper with an affinity for soul and a likable and fully formed personality, and Arcade reveals quirks and depths with repeated listens.

albums.title: Spaghetto
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: The London artist's latest is a protean collection of a new kind of reggae lovers rock record that finds power in its diverse, hybrid style.

albums.title: Origin of What
albums.label: In the Red
albums.description: The Detroit punks Tyvek flex their mastery over their multifaceted sound on their new album—these wordy, detail-stuffed songs are fast and staid, intense and gentle, paranoid and curious.

albums.title: Collage
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The massive lite-EDM duo the Chainsmokers portray themselves as hilariously repugnant caricatures, and on C**ollage, they paint a photorealist portrait of their manspread over the charts.

albums.title: Lady, Give Me Your Key: The Unissued 1967 Solo Acoustic Sessions
albums.label: Light in the Attic
albums.description: A collection of stripped-down and unreleased tracks from the infamous folk singer's early days offers little clarity to his mercurial career, but these demos remain striking and emotional.

albums.title: Away With You
albums.label: Firehouse 12
albums.description: The avant-garde guitarist expands her compositions to fit her largest group ever, creating one of the most intricate and entrancing sets of her career.

albums.title: Trap or Die 3
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: On Trap or Die 3, Jeezy stops pretending to give a damn what listeners under 25 might be into, offering a back-to-basics statement despite never straying that far from the basics to begin with.

albums.title: The Visitor
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: The soul singer Kadjha Bonet offers a twisting, rich mix of psychedelia and soul on her plush debut album.

albums.title: Jessica Rabbit
albums.label: Torn Clean
albums.description: Sleigh Bells' fourth record is a hodgepodge of clashing sounds and concepts that’s united only by its indiscriminate maximalism.

albums.title: Soft Hair
albums.label: Weird World
albums.description: This collaboration between Connan Mockasin and Sam Dust, formerly of dance-punk Brits Late of the Pier, strikes a discomfiting balance between queasy and cute.

albums.title: Lodestar
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: For her first record in 38 years, the wonderful British folk singer Shirley Collins dazzles with a collection of macabre and mischievous songs from centuries past.

albums.title: Apocalypse Fetish
albums.label: Joyful Noise
albums.description: Following the solemn elegance of his last album Brace the Wave, Lou Barlow's new ukulele-heavy EP feels incomplete.

albums.title: Eternally Even
albums.label: Capitol
albums.description: Jim James' new solo album contains some of his most psychedelic music, as well as his most directly topical lyrics, offering new ways for him to wield his otherworldly voice.

albums.title: Romantic
albums.label: Tiny Engines
albums.description: Philadelphia’s Mannequin Pussy thrash swiftly from the playful to the chaotic. Their latest LP combines punk, shoegaze, death metal, and more, with the ferocious push-pull energy of a mosh pit.

albums.title: Cozy Tapes Vol. 1: Friends-
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: The latest offering from A$AP Mob is really just an A$AP Rocky showcase, but per the title of the tape, he sounds more comfortable than ever, as do his compatriots. It’s natural and confident.

albums.title: Arrival
albums.label: Polar
albums.description: At their best, as on Arrival, ABBA were as mysterious as Bowie, as rococo as Phil Spector, as unbearably sad as the Smiths.

albums.title: The Deaner Album
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Dean Ween's solo debut is missing the sincerity and surrealism of Ween, but its bizarre chaos feels like you are in on a longstanding inside joke with an old friend.

albums.title: Liberation
albums.label: Closed Sessions
albums.description: oddCouple, a Chicago producer who has worked with Jamila Woods, Joey Purp, Saba, Kweku Collins, and others, gathers his most talented friends for a warm, relaxed affair full of pleasantly hazed beats.

albums.title: Blunted on Reality
albums.label: Music On Vinyl
albums.description: On their underrated commercial-flop debut album, the Fugees searched energetically for the voice they would find on The Score.

albums.title: Strange City
albums.label: Cold Spring
albums.description: The constant and destructive waves of noise make this decisively a Merzbow record, but its cosmic mood and rhythms prove that Sun Ra lives in its DNA.

albums.title: You Know What It’s Like
albums.label: Blackest Ever Black
albums.description: Smoky and ominous, Australian singer/songwriter Carla dal Forno's You Know What It's Like simmers, both musically and thematically, while she inhabits the gloom of her arrangements like a ghost.

albums.title: Keep Flexin
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Rising Atlanta rapper and Migos affiliate Rich the Kid drops a bubbly, if not uninspired new tape with features from Young Thug, Desiigner, Migos, and Jeremih.

albums.title: Black America Again
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: Common’s dissonant, politically-charged new album Black America Again finds him angry and off-balance—which feels like it’s exactly where he should be.

albums.title: Talk to You Soon
albums.label: Terrible
albums.description: The latest from the experimental producer/songwriter dives into the warrens of memory and trauma with a collection of anxiety-ridden and often beautiful vignettes.

albums.title: The Olympians
albums.label: Daptone
albums.description: This self-titled debut on Daptone Records follows a tried-and-true formula for the records: Hire incredible musicians and get out of their way.

albums.title: QTT4
albums.label: Quiet Time
albums.description: Producer Huerco S.'s latest ambient release feels like something heard from the other end of a long, dark tunnel that you no longer remember how to find your way back across.

albums.title: xxx
albums.label: Big Deal
albums.description: In a season where “pussy” has become a household word again for all the wrong reasons, Pussy Riot return to exact their vengeance. At least, that’s the narrative for Nadya Tolokno’s xxx EP.

albums.title: Live at the Whiskey A Go Go: The Complete Recordings
albums.label: Stax
albums.description: This essential six-CD set captures Otis and his blazing ten-piece band at a vital time in soul music, where a young showman was trying to cross over to the white rock'n'rollers on the Sunset Strip.

albums.title: Dissociation
albums.label: Cooking Vinyl
albums.description: The famously technical New Jersey band ends their career with one final album of squealing riffs, dizzying musicianship, and plenty of nostalgia for their heyday.

albums.title: Freedom Jazz Dance: The Bootleg Series, Vol. 5
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: A glimpse inside the studio for numerous outtakes and illuminating dialogue from the legendary “Second Great Quintet” sessions that would spawn Miles Davis' Miles Smiles, Nefertiti, and Water Babies.

albums.title: DC4
albums.label: Maybach
albums.description: On the fourth installment of his Dreamchasers mixtape series, Meek struggles to figure out exactly where he belongs, caught between his old life and his new one, between superstar and street rapper.

albums.title: Disclosure
albums.label: Honest Jon's
albums.description: Leipzig's Gunnar Wendel, better known as Kassem Mosse, abandons his house music background for thorny synthesizer sketches—fistfuls of gurgle and ping, sometimes beatless, and maddeningly absorbing.

albums.title: Strands
albums.label: Kranky
albums.description: The Cleveland electronic musician has refined his minimalist techno to a frictionless peak. The keyboard patches on his latest are so physical that you can imagine holding them in your hand.

albums.title: Goodbye Terrible Youth
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: On his unabashedly personal new LP, indie rocker Gary McClure takes stock of his life, in distortion-heavy songs often filled with regret and loss, ugliness and shame.

albums.title: Metal Box
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: PiL's second album, Metal Box, is a near-perfect record that reinvents and renews rock in a manner that fulfilled post-punk’s promise(s) to a degree rivaled only by Joy Division on Closer.

albums.title: Lady Wood
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Tove Lo's second album offers a platform for her to argue that self-destructive affairs of a particular sort of woman are a subject worthy of four-part concept albums.

albums.title: ONEderful
albums.label: Closed Sessions
albums.description: The Chicago-bred, now Brooklyn-based beatmaker DJ Rude One's ONEderful is a grubby set of blood-in-your-mouth street raps, featuring Roc Marciano, Your Old Droog, Mr Muthafuckin eXquire, and more.

albums.title: Hunted
albums.label: 20 Buck Spin
albums.description: Denver’s Khemmis traffic in longform doom metal, letting their anger spread gradually rather than unleashing it all in one torrent.

albums.title: FLOTUS
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: The stalwart and defiantly odd Nashville band Lambchop's latest reinvention finds them embracing a Vocoder-drenched, largely electronic sound. It is as lush and gorgeous as any of their past work.

albums.title: Tumblers From the Vault (1970–1972)
albums.label: Rvng Intl.
albums.description: All but unknown in the US, the adventurous trio Syrinx was among the first groups to embrace the Moog. RVNG has reissued their two albums along with a stunning live document.

albums.title: All the Right Noises
albums.label: Dial
albums.description: Roman Flügel has explored hard techno, acid trance, willfully lunkheaded electro-house, and lyrical deep house over his prolific career, but this is the furthest he has strayed from the dancefloor.

albums.title: Blood on the Tracks
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Bob Dylan’s moody 1975 epic is often referred to as his “breakup album,” but it might be his most welcoming LP, its music projecting an undeniable warmth.

albums.title: Candida Cosmica
albums.label: Dark Entries
albums.description: The latest unearthed work from San Francisco disco innovator Patrick Cowley is a woozy, fascinating synth experiment with Candida Royalle, the feminist porn director and actress.

albums.title: Rage & the Machine
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: Joe Budden's latest album, produced almost entirely by AraabMUZIK, offers a concentrated dose of his usual fare: complex lyrical raps, bitter contempt for current hip-hop, and a list of grievances.

albums.title: R M H Q: Headquarters
albums.label: Grapefruit
albums.description: In the early ’80s, New Zealand’s Roy Montgomery was part of foundational Flying Nun band the Pin Group. His first solo work since 2001 is a 4xLP set that, at its best, plays like a shadowy dream.

albums.title: Secret Path
albums.label: Arts & Crafts
albums.description: Tragically Hip singer Gord Downie, diagnosed with a terminal brain tumor, offers an affecting album with Broken Social Scene's Kevin Drew about the plight of Canada's indigenous population.

albums.title: Beyond Now
albums.label: Motéma
albums.description: After helping David Bowie realize his harrowing final statement Blackstar, saxophonist Donny McCaslin offers a bracing record with two Bowie tunes and a pair of covers of electronic acts.

albums.title: Big Baby D.R.A.M.
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: After a string of EPs and some offbeat hits, rapper/singer D.R.A.M. arrives with his first full-length, a record filled with funny asides and sharp details and its fair share of memorable hooks.

albums.title: Running Out of Love
albums.label: Labrador
albums.description: The latest from Swedish indie-pop stalwarts the Radio Dept. is the sound of a band rejecting indie-darling complacency for riskier, more mature territory, and the gamble pays off.

albums.title: Dreamt Takes
albums.label: 1080p
albums.description: Queens-based beatmaker Luis summons early Warp-era IDM, when acts like Autechre, Speedy J, and Polygon Window crossbred hardcore and rave with the introspection of Tangerine Dream and Pink Floyd.

albums.title: Mad Love.
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: After a decade of record label turmoil, the pop singer JoJo—of “Leave (Get Out)” fame—returns with a sincere third album, featuring guest spots from Alessia Cara, Wiz Khalifa, and Remy Ma.

albums.title: Lazarus OST
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: In the last year of his life, David Bowie completed his remarkable final album, Blackstar, as well as this curious jukebox musical for which he wrote a few new songs.

albums.title: Lighthouse
albums.label: Verve
albums.description: Working with Michael League, the leader of the Brooklyn-based jazzy jam outfit Snarky Puppy, David Crosby releases his second solo record since returning from a 20-year hiatus.

albums.title: Nordic Mediterranean Organization / Numerous Miscommunications Occur
albums.label: Diagonal
albums.description: On their full-length debut, the Norwegian and Spanish experimental duo N.M.O. deliver a zig-zagging array of unnerving forms, evoking militarization and irreverent playfulness in equal measure.

albums.title: T.C.R. EP
albums.label: Rough Trade
albums.description: On their latest EP, the misanthropic British duo Sleaford Mods allow some air into their sound and frontman James Williamson turns some of his acrid tirades towards himself.

albums.title: American Football
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: Coming after a 17-year hiatus, the second LP by American Football* *might be the most highly anticipated emo album ever made.

albums.title: After Hours
albums.label: Mixpak
albums.description: On her debut LP, the Miami-born, NYC-based DJ and producer Jessica Gentile honors the nightlife that raised her. She draws on dancehall, Miami bass, and trap, with enough space to breathe and glitter.

albums.title: Beyond the Fleeting Gales
albums.label: Run for Cover
albums.description: The indie rock trio Crying folds the bombast of mainstream '80s rock into their sound, and the results feel like a grinning inversion of the hetero-masculinity that’s often baked into such fireworks.

albums.title: Moving Still
albums.label: Pi
albums.description: On his second album as a bandleader, the jazz trumpeter Jonathan Finlayson finds an exciting meeting ground of exploration and approachability. It’s the work of a composer on the rise.

albums.title: Retribution
albums.label: Unknown
albums.description: Throat-singer Tanya Tagaq could be Canada’s unlikeliest crossover act. At a time when Canada is reckoning with the historic mistreatment of its indigenous population, her new LP demands retribution.

albums.title: Joanne
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Now that her peers have caught up to her visual provocations, Lady Gaga seems less like an audacious pioneer than one among many, and Joanne feels tentative, an affront to the Gaga of yesteryear.

albums.title: Popp
albums.label: UOVOOO
albums.description: On his fifth record since returning from hiatus in 2010, Oval's Markus Popp shows a side of, well, pop to his music that has often dwelled below the surface but never so overtly above it.

albums.title: Whatever Forever
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: Oozing Wound capture the energy of classic Slayer, Entombed, and punk-metal like Suicidal Tendencies, but it's hard to escape the feeling they are making fun of these guys as much as celebrating them.

albums.title: Everything Feels Better Now
albums.label: Triple Crown
albums.description: From Indian Lakes’ fourth LP is mood music for the hopeless romantic, overwhelmed by the desire to connect but pining for the confidence to make the first move.

albums.title: Savoy Motel
