albums.label: What's Your Rupture?
albums.description: Savoy Motel recreate the sounds of the ’70s using the ’90s pastiche techniques of Beck, Ween and Royal Trux, compacting glam-rock, southern boogie, and Stax sax stabs into 8-bit videogame proportions.

albums.title: Headache
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Male Bonding's surprise-released third LP is another album about wounds that won’t heal. But at its best it brings a wizened new perspective to those same themes.

albums.title: You Want It Darker
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Leonard Cohen's 14th studio album feels like a pristine, piously crafted last testament, the informed conclusion of a lifetime of inquiry.

albums.title: End of the Century
albums.label: Sire
albums.description: For 1980’s End of the Century, the Ramones abandoned their tough, fast and loud dynamic to work with Phil Spector. It was one of the oddest pairings in punk history.

albums.title: The Violent Sleep of Reason
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: Although the veteran metal quintet sounded newly invigorated on its last two albums, T**he Violent Sleep of Reason is easily the most organic-sounding Meshuggah album in over 20 years.

albums.title: Say Yes! A Tribute to Elliott Smith
albums.label: American Laundromat
albums.description: This tribute album is scattershot, as all such albums are, but the best moments find a new generation reckoning with what Smith's catalog means to them now.

albums.title: Integrity Blues
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: The expansive, emotionally weathered *Integrity Blues is *perhaps Jimmy Eat World's best record since Bleed American, and even serves as its unlikely spiritual sequel.

albums.title: Motor Earth
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: The Chicago psych-rock band Axis:Sova indulge a fever for propulsion on Motor Earth, pairing thick waves of scuzzy guitar with the mechanized pulse of a tinny Roland drum machine.

albums.title: These Systems Are Failing
albums.label: Mute
albums.description: These Systems Are Failing is Moby’s most furious album in twenty years, a return to his hardcore days, but it's still oddly cold and routine.

albums.title: Woptober
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On his second LP since being released from prison, Gucci revisits the darker, weirder style of his classic period but keeps the clear-eyed outlook of his new, healthier lifestyle.

albums.title: EP A
albums.label: Sister Polygon
albums.description: This solo EP from Katie Alice Greer, singer in lauded D.C. punks Priests, mixes industrial textures and synth-pop. Her talent for composing moody collages of unraveling sound is a pleasant revelation.

albums.title: Self Restraint
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Self Restraint, the latest album from rapper Gods Wisdom of the New England-based Dark World collective, arrives feeling strangely dated, as if it’s an artifact from 2011 or 2012.

albums.title: Fires on the Plain
albums.label: Driftless
albums.description: Matt Kivel's patient, close-miked folk music opens up slowly, revealing painful secrets the more time you spend listening to it.

albums.title: Every Now & Then
albums.label: Mom & Pop
albums.description: On their second album, the Australian outfit go bigger and broader, unapologetically mining Primal Scream and the Madchester scene for inspiration.

albums.title: Color
albums.label: Tri Angle
albums.description: On her Tri Angle debut, sound designer and producer-turned-musician Katie Gately twists odd, outré samples into big pop shapes.

albums.title: WALLS
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: *WALLS *mostly finds Kings of Leon back in that mode of offering up fast-food “whoa-oh” singalongs and guitars that chime as distinctly as wallpaper.

albums.title: Thirst 48 Pt. II
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: The Compton rapper’s latest is a sequel to his 2014 debut mixtape. Boogie steps into the California sun, embracing a brighter sound with a flow that sharpens year after year.

albums.title: Standard Nature
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: Whether making black metal as Altar of Plagues or electronic music as WIFE, James Kelley has a taste for subversion, and his new WIFE EP surprises again by sounding downright joyful in spots.

albums.title: Front Row Seat to Earth
albums.label: Mexican Summer
albums.description: The third full-length from singer/songwriter/producer Natalie Mering overflows with the misty sounds of late '60s folk and '70s AM radio, but her presence in these songs is modern and slyly knowing.

albums.title: Sport
albums.label: XL
albums.description: The punk electronic music Powell makes is crude, queasy, sometimes shockingly ugly, and often quite funny, in a madcap, slightly threatening way. It thrills and it mystifies in equal measure.

albums.title: Yermande
albums.label: Ndagga
albums.description: German techno giant Mark Ernestus delves deep into African music, and the result is drum-drunk and gorgeous, both techno-fast and dub-slow.

albums.title: Yes Lawd!
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: Yes Lawd! is another accomplishment in Anderson .Paak’s continued rise, a beautiful beat tape made with the producer Knxwledge that nods to classic Stones Throw duos.

albums.title: Arctic Thunder
albums.label: Peaceville
albums.description: Darkthrone’s seventeenth studio album, Arctic Thunder, is a seamless, genre-hopping lexicon of death growls, doom dirges, and thrash runs as immediate as they are all-encompassing.

albums.title: Remember Us to Life
albums.label: Sire
albums.description: Regina Spektor’s latest album takes the unabashed earnestness that has always marked her music and rewrites it in a somber, minor key.

albums.title: Lubbock (on everything)
albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: The artist Terry Allen made outlaw country from the vantage of the art world. Paradise of Bachelors have lavishly reissued his 1979 double album, a dreamscape that sways between country and folk.

albums.title: Requiem for Hell
albums.label: Temporary Residence
albums.description: Mono's ninth album looks to nothing less than the mother of all epics, Dante's The Divine Comedy, for inspiration.

albums.title: super low
albums.label: Bayonet
albums.description: Atlanta art-punks Warehouse build a tightly controlled chaos, relying on improvised collaboration to forge gems from dischord.

albums.title: Building a Beginning
albums.label: Jajulin
albums.description: On Building A Beginning, Jamie Lidell unplugs his laptop for the most conventional R&B album of his career.

albums.title: America’s National Parks
albums.label: Cuneiform
albums.description: Trumpeter Wadada Leo Smith's latest is an expansive and politically charged suite that pays tribute to official national parks as well as cultural zones not yet recognized by government decree.

albums.title: Good Old Boys
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: Randy Newman’s Good Old Boys is nothing less than a tour of Southern bigotry and pride in the 20th century. It remains as shocking, pristine, and regrettably relevant as the day it was released.

albums.title: Coconut Oil
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: *Coconut Oil, *Lizzo's first release under Atlantic, is her ode to body positivity, self-love and the trials of getting to the point where you believe you deserve it.

albums.title: High Bias
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: At his best, Purling Hiss frontman Mike Polizze simultaneously embraces, tweaks, and subverts all kinds of vintage garage, punk, and grunge moves. This is their most classic-rock record so far.

albums.title: Adieux Au Dancefloor
albums.label: Cititrax
albums.description: Marie Davidson is a spoken-word poet and electronic artist who is also one half of the duo Essaie Pas. Her third solo release, examining club culture, shows near-exponential growth in her abilities.

albums.title: COW / Chill Out, World!
albums.label: Kompakt
albums.description: C**OW has some of the Orb’s most gentle moments to date, eschewing ambient house for ambient music, pure and simple.

albums.title: Home OST
albums.label: Italians Do It Better
albums.description: Made for a Belgian coming-of-age tale, Home is the latest film soundtrack by Johnny Jewel. It features new Chromatics and Symmetry music, plus eight ambient tracks, but is strangely mild-mannered.

albums.title: Philosophy of the World
albums.label: Light in the Attic
albums.description: The Shaggs' Philosophy of the World became an enduring classic for its beguiling amateurism. But in its 2016 reissue, it's easier to hear the darkness and sadness behind the Wiggin sisters' story.

albums.title: Coming Home (Original Ghanaian Highlife & Afrobeat Classics 1967-1981)
albums.label: Strut
albums.description: This two-disc retrospective touches on several phases of Ghanaian vocalist Pat Thomas' career, pulling highlife, swing jazz, Afrobeat, psychedelic rock, reggae, funk, and disco into his joyful orbit.

albums.title: Outer
albums.label: Polydor
albums.description: After perfecting anthemic dancefloor fantasies with fine-tuned tracks like “Yoohoo,” Dusky offer a sentimentalist hodge-podge designed to prove that their mettle extends beyond the dancefloor.

albums.title: Cashmere
albums.label: Customs
albums.description: The transatlantic duo of Heems (ex-Das Racist) and Riz MC (actor Riz Ahmed) link up for an album of politically-charged rap that's both thought-provoking and genuinely fun.

albums.title: Marked for Death
albums.label: Sargent House
albums.description: Rundle has made her name performing mournful, minor key compositions, swelling with gothic drama, and her latest is her heaviest and most uplifting work yet.

albums.title: There Is No Right Time
albums.label: Aus
albums.description: The debut album from Yorkshire house producer Ewan Smith is a collection of daydreamy mood pieces. Stepping up the sound design, these melancholy tracks highlight Smith’s expressive sensibility.

albums.title: Complete Third
albums.label: Omnivore
albums.description: Big Star's never-completed third album is enshrined in a triple-disc box that contains all known recordings from the 1974 sessions and finally makes sense of all the chaos.

albums.title: The Altar
albums.label: Harvest
albums.description: Banks' The Altar has a lot in common with the alt-R&B singer's breakthrough Goddess, including its fatal flaw: its attempts to position her as edgy or dangerous, despite all evidence to the contrary.

albums.title: Cody
albums.label: Epitaph
albums.description: The California foursome follow their pop-punk breakthrough Never Hungover Again with the more grown-up and measured Cody.

albums.title: NOTU_URONLINEU
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Working under his new alias DVA [Hi:Emotions], Leon Smart smears the edges of the human and artificial, the organic and the electronic, as if trying to sketch out the dimensions of a digital self.

albums.title: Ruminations
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: *Ruminations *is a record like none other in Conor Oberst’s catalog, stunning for how utterly alone he sounds.

albums.title: Shit Don’t Stop
albums.label: So Way Out Tha Innerprize
albums.description: In a crowded—and excellent—year for West Coast hip-hop, G Perico stands out as one of the most promising newcomers.

albums.title: Heart Like a Levee
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: On his sixth album as Hiss Golden Messenger, M.C. Taylor's lifelong theme remains intact: What happens when you feel a distance from the thing that’s meant to sustain you?

albums.title: Day Breaks
albums.label: Blue Note
albums.description: The restive jazz star, who went on to work with Jack White, Danger Mouse, and others after her multiplatinum debut, returns with a no-frills record that fades into the background without much fuss.

albums.title: Throwback to the Future
albums.label: Tommy Boy
albums.description: Producer Prince Paul and Digable Planets rapper Ladybug Mecca contribute to this fusion of NYC-style hip-hop and Brazilian music.

albums.title: Revolution Radio
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: Over the course of 26 years, Green Day have gone from pop punks to rock stars. Their latest, however, has little effect on their legacy and lapses into pandering, embarrassing lyrical misfires.

albums.title: While They Were Sleeping
albums.label: Metal Blade
albums.description: The eighth album from the wildly experimental Brooklyn metal group doesn't quite blaze trails on par with the band's classic catalog, but they are still genuinely searching for new expressions.

albums.title: Requiem
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The ritualistically anonymous GOAT return with a double album of psychedelia rendered primarily with acoustic elements. Though still veiled, they reveal more of their heart and personality than ever.

albums.title: Sonoran Depravation
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: Arizona’s Gatecreeper stand out not by aping one particular style of death metal, but by acting as a polyglot of various classic bands. Sonoran Depravation is their unwavering debut LP.

albums.title: Root/Void
albums.label: Woodsist
albums.description: The latest from the prolific psych-folk duo comes courtesy of Woods' Woodsist imprint, and the higher profile coincides with some of their more memorable tunes.

albums.title: Rhythm Nation 1814
albums.label: A&M
albums.description: After her 1986 album Control and its assertion of her identity as an artist, Janet Jackson was thinking big. Rhythm Nation 1814 is a thrilling mix of social messaging and dancefloor pleasure.

albums.title: Private Energy
albums.label: Asthmatic Kitty
albums.description: The latest from Roberto Carlos Lange's electronic pop project is a melodic and beautifully produced meditation on identity and the difficulty of connection.

albums.title: Cold Summer
albums.label: Roc Nation
albums.description: In the wake of some professional tumult, the snap and ratchet producer stages a solid comeback with more varied production and plenty of celebration.

albums.title: Sorceress
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: On their 12th full-length album, the Swedish metal institution have never sounded more comfortable with their full-on prog transition, which works both for and against them.

albums.title: Be Here Now
albums.label: Big Brother
albums.description: Oasis’ third album from 1997 was always more circus than substance. The bloated and indulgent remaster only reinforces it as one of the most agonizing listening experiences in pop music.

albums.title: Big Boat
albums.label: Jemp
albums.description: Phish is not known for their studio work. But for a group of musicians whose sole value has always been the simple pleasure of making music, everyone here sounds noticeably vacant.

albums.title: Three
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: As Sarah Barthel and Josh Carter inch toward the mainstream, their plaintive and gloomy* Three* feels less like an album and more like postcards from the eye of an emotional hurricane.

albums.title: Everywhere at the End of Time
albums.label: History Always Favours the Winners
albums.description: This new LP is the first in a six-album series from ambient artist James Leyland Kirby. It’s an extreme continuation of the concept—memory loss—that guided his 2011 masterpiece, An Empty Bliss...

albums.title: Lamentations
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Moses Sumney has a gorgeous voice that is as intricate as it is intimate. His latest EP comes and goes too fast, but is still a welcome window into the electro-soul folk singer's private world.

albums.title: Serpent Music
albums.label: Pan
albums.description: Like James Ferraro or Dean Blunt, the Turin-based artist uses unsettling percussive loops and field recordings to create a mood as if lost in a strange urban landscape.

albums.title: Head Carrier
albums.label: Play It Again Sam
albums.description: While not as egregiously baffling as Indie Cindy, the latest from the ’90s indie icons is nonetheless a middling effort missing all kinds of dynamics the Pixies used to offer.

albums.title: Farewell, Starlite!
albums.label: KTTF
albums.description: After big-name co-signs for the smooth, self-made producer and vocalist Francis Farewell Starlite, his latest album doesn't quite live up to expectations.

albums.title: Fires Within Fires
albums.label: Neurot
albums.description: The heavy Bay Area band’s eleventh and latest full-length is also their briefest by a sizable margin. It sags often, but Fires With Fires ends with a staggering exhibition of quiet power.

albums.title: A Seat at the Table
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Solange’s new record is stunning, a thematically unified and musically adventurous statement on the pain and joy of black womanhood.

albums.label: Smalltown Supersound
albums.description: With 13 albums under their belt, the Norwegian experimentalists continue to haunt the dark, underexplored basements of electro-improvisational music.

albums.title: The Electric Lucifer
albums.label: Telephone Explosion
albums.description: In the 1960s and ’70s, Bruce Haack led a double life. By day, he made children’s music. By night, demonic electronica. This reissue presents his most accomplished work in all its end-times glory.

albums.title: Light We Made
albums.label: Vagrant
albums.description: Following 2013’s bludgeoning The Things We Think We’re Missing, the Doylestown, P.A. band returns with a cleaner, efficient, and more stylish sound.

albums.title: Monologue
albums.label: Aaron Abernathy Music
albums.description: The session musician and leader of Nat Turner goes big on his first official LP, creating a spiritually rich and soulful autobiographical story.

albums.title: Blood Bitch
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: The Norwegian avant-gardist’s most atmospheric and filmic album draws on several traditions: vampire movies, the cross-hairs of art and pop, and the lineage of artwork made of menstrual blood.

albums.title: Red Horse, White Mule / Opium Musick / Raag Manifestos / Jack Rose / I Do Play Rock and Roll / Dr. Ragtime and His Pals
albums.label: Three Lobed
albums.description: Vinyl reissues of six albums from the late Jack Rose further solidify his place as a brilliant steel string guitar innovator.

albums.title: Rheia
albums.label: Deathwish
albums.description: Rheia not only transforms the Belgian metal band's own abilities, but the breadth of the much heralded—and derided—black metal-shoegaze fusion.

albums.title: Fio da Memória
albums.label: Cumbancha
albums.description: It's been six years since the Brazilian singer's debut. Now she returns with an album that both utilizes and breaks free of samba and bossa nova classicism with deep, downtempo beats.

albums.title: Atrocity Exhibition
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Atrocity Exhibition can be seen as the third work in a trilogy that began with XXX. Here, Danny Brown's songs of pain and release are accompanied by dense sonics from all over the musical map.

albums.title: Schaum
albums.label: Faitiche
albums.description: Experimental electronic producer Jan Jelinek partners with vibraphonist Masayoshi Fujita to create gorgeous clouds of shifting sound.

albums.title: Quebec Place
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The young Maryland rapper presents a deft, stylish, and unique introduction to his career.

albums.title: Real Enemies
albums.label: New Amsterdam
albums.description: Darcy James Argue's big band meets “The Daily Show” in an ambitious, wholly fascinating look at American politics and propaganda.

albums.title: Alien Lanes
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: In the mid-’90s Guided by Voices were a mysterious outfit from Dayton, Ohio, that the music press didn't know what to do with—a rumor as much as a band. Their Matador debut was a turning point.

albums.title: RR7349
albums.artist: S U R V I V E
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: Much more than mood-setters for Stranger Things, the synth masters of S U R V I V E carve out a compelling niche of their own.

albums.title: Blue Mountain
albums.label: Columbia Legacy
albums.description: Working with members of the National, Grateful Dead rhythm guitarist Bob Weir goes Americana and discovers a great old voice.

albums.title: Electronic Music From the Seventies and Eighties
albums.label: Unseen Worlds
albums.description: The cryptic compositions of California-born, Japan-based composer Carl Stone are collected on this hefty compilation. Its eight extended pieces showcase drastically different sides of his work.

albums.title: The ECM Recordings
albums.label: ECM
albums.description: The ECM Recordings collects some of the minimalist composer's finest works, including the definitive recording of his undisputed masterpiece Music for 18 Musicians.

albums.title: Alienist
albums.label: Dais Records
albums.description: With two covers and two originals, the psych rock band of Genesis P-Orridge expands rather than fortifies the definition of classic rock'n'roll.

albums.title: A 1000 Keys / A Certain Degree of Stasis
albums.label: Frozen Reeds
albums.description: On an album of brutalist, MIDI-driven piano fugues and a double CD of languid ambient drones, the German electronic musician shows off two distinct sides of his musical personality.

albums.title: Expert Knob Twiddlers
albums.label: Planet Mu
albums.description: Manage your expectations: This record may combine the electronic music giants Richard D. James and Mike Paradinas, but it's really just a playful, occasionally inspired time capsule of the 1990s.

albums.title: 22, A Million
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: Bon Iver’s first album in five years takes an unexpected turn toward the strange and experimental. But behind the arranged glitches and processed voices are deeply felt songs about uncertainty.

albums.title: Heads Up
albums.label: Rough Trade
albums.description: Warpaint’s new album is said to be informed by recent hip-hop and R&B but it ultimately hews closely to the moody downtempo rock they’re known for.

albums.title: Masculin Féminin
albums.label: Numero Group
albums.description: The Masculin Féminin box set is a scrapbook made from early records that already felt like scrapbooks, but collectively they form a rich and vibrant portrait of the ’90s indie rock icons.

albums.title: Sirens
albums.label: Other People
albums.description: Sirens is a thoughtful study in contrasts, both musical and political. It's only Nicolas Jaar's second LP, but it is the mark of an enduring electronic composer.

albums.title: Fetish Bones
albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: Camae Ayewa channels the politics of noise music and Afrofuturism for a deeply confrontational and affecting album that makes real and visceral the trauma of the past.

albums.title: The Healing Component
albums.label: Cinematic
albums.description: The Chicago rapper’s debut LP is a daring and expressive album that explores the American web of love, faith, violence.

albums.title: Campaign
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: On his new trap- and hyphy-inflected mixtape, Ty Dolla $ign stumps for Hillary—and he's pretty psyched on Jack Johnson, too.

albums.title: Return to Love
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: On their Sub Pop debut, LVL UP's more unhinged, existential bent gives a new weight to their songwriting.

albums.title: If You See Me, Say Yes
albums.label: Partisan
albums.description: On her bright and self-assured solo debut, Wye Oak’s Jenn Wasner offers the most all-encompassing document of her tastes yet, incorporating dreamy indie rock and digital pop.

albums.title: Legends Never Die
albums.label: Entertainment One
albums.description: Chinx's second posthumous album misses the mark, but these scraps and drafts are still a reminder of his promise.

albums.title: Ape in Pink Marble
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: Devendra Banhart’s ninth LP continues on with the wispy, low-stakes coziness of 2013’s Mala, though it’s much darker. Its best moments are a reminder of why Banhart touched a nerve in the first place.

albums.title: Open to Chance
albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: Kaya Cohen's third guitar-and-voice album is a sprawling fascination with the natural world and the nature of people.

albums.title: Human Energy
albums.label: Ninja Tune
albums.description: Travis Stewart has bobbed and wove through many styles du jour, but his latest closes the gap between glitch and pop by using Dawn Richard, MeLo-X, and Jesse Boykins III on his euphoric compositions.

albums.title: A Loud Bash of Teenage Feelings
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: Beach Slang's earnest angst still makes for an excellent group therapy session.

albums.title: Mirage
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Mirage nixed any suggestion that intra-band drama was their sole animating force, and flourished in the emotional void they occupied: heartbroken, strung out, and alone at the top.

albums.title: Care
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Tom Krell teams with collaborators like Jack Antonoff and dancehall producer Dre Skull on his most polished album yet. But it turns out the professional sheen doesn't suit him.

albums.title: I Remember
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Aluna Francis and George Reid's sophomore album globe-trots through bass and sass-heavy dance tunes that occasionally stall out at their peaks.

albums.title: A Corpse Wired for Sound
albums.label: 4AD
albums.description: If Merchandise weren't a rock band before, they certainly are now. They've gotten a little more earnest and shoot for a bigger sound. It's a mixed bag, but it's hard to hate them for it.

albums.title: Mama’s Gun
albums.label: Motown
albums.description: Erykah Badu's second album is dense with ideas and sounds that draw from the past and look toward the future. Released in November 2000, it embodies the millennial tensions of that pivotal year.

albums.title: Dang
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: One half of Tonstartssbandht, Eola is a vocal-only project with loops and blues. Dang is charming, weird, and extremely sincere.

albums.title: Crooked Man
albums.label: DFA
albums.description: The legendary British DJ has been around the block. He returns with his Crooked Man project with pedigree, craftsmanship, and, delightfully, zero aspiration to the “new.”

albums.title: Instrumentalepathy
albums.label: Cuss
albums.description: After a scooter accident almost killed him, William Bensussen returns with a more nuanced album, full of spiritual revelations and electro-psych affirmations.

albums.title: Shape Shift With Me
albums.label: Total Treble
albums.description: Laura Jane Grace leads her Florida punk band into uncharted waters with a densely packed, vicious, and heartbreaking album about sublimation and transformation.

albums.title: Departed Glories
albums.label: Smalltown Supersound
albums.description: The Norwegian ambient musician Geir Jenssen plumbs the mind of a medieval queen on his beautiful, gripping new album.

albums.title: Mykki
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: On her studio debut, Mykki Blanco shines with both her lyricism and radicalism.

albums.title: Sunlit Youth
albums.label: Loma Vista
albums.description: The California indie-pop band goes bigger and broader, leaving behind some of the more intricate songwriting of their past.

albums.title: I Had a Dream That You Were Mine
albums.label: Glassnote
albums.description: The pairing of the Walkmen's Hamilton Leithauser and former Vampire Weekend producer/instrumentalist Rostam Batmanglij turns out to be an inspired one.

albums.title: Chapter and Verse
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: This companion to Bruce Springsteen’s memoir traces his development as a songwriter and a person. Most notable is the inclusion of five previously unreleased songs from before he signed with Columbia.

albums.title: We Are the Halluci Nation
albums.label: Radicalized
albums.description: The trio of Canadian DJs’ unique “powwow step” turns the pulse of First Nations music into a modern electric dance soundtrack that is politically thrilling and immediate.

albums.title: Up Against the Bricks
albums.label: Salinas
albums.description: Sadie Switchblade of G.L.O.S.S. steps out with a solo album that touches on the hardcore of her main band and adds elements of country music and acoustic folk.

albums.title: Mount Ninji and Da Nice Time Kid
albums.label: ZEF
albums.description: Across the South African rap duo's fourth album, their iconoclastic rave-rap fades into shallow humor and belabored production.

albums.title: Hard II Love
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: On his eighth album, Usher sounds better than he's sounded in ages, proving he will not go gentle into that quiet stormy night.

albums.title: Feature Magnetic
albums.label: Mello Music Group
albums.description: The legendary MC has made a career out of evading definition, which he continues to do alongside an array of guests who are all here to simply and inimitably just rap.

albums.title: The Randy Newman Songbook
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: The four-LP box containing everything Newman recorded for his Songbook series is a self-made and ever-shifting canon from songwriting's most charming cynic.

albums.title: Fear and Fury
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: The Arkansas doom metal band's stopgap EP features a Black Sabbath cover, a Type O Negative cover, and one original that reinforces their place among the best of them.

albums.title: Love Means Taking Action
albums.label: Posh Isolation
albums.description: As another moniker for Danish musician Loke Rhabek, Croatian Amor finds him at his most ambient, exploring the ugly beauty of love and human connection.

albums.title: The Complete BBC Sessions
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Newly remastered by Jimmy Page, the three-disc set featuring recordings from ’69-’71 captures a vibrant and liminal phase of the band's career that shows who they once were and who they would become.

albums.title: Furfour
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: The fourth album from the London duo recalls Brian Eno's post-psych, pre-ambient albums from the mid-’70s and explores how modern media interacts with musical transcendence.

albums.title: Imaginational Anthem Vol. 8 : The Private Press
albums.label: Tompkins Square
albums.description: The latest issue from the always idiosyncratic Tompkins Square series features songs from guitarists who released their warm and surreal folk ragas and finger-picked fantasias to private press.

albums.title: Sumerlands
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: On the debut LP from his band Sumerlands, producer Arthur Rizk (Title Fight, Prurient) establishes himself as a keen student of early ’80s American metal and a songwriting behemoth in his own right.

albums.title: Body Wash
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: Los Angeles beatmaker Ringgo Ancheta engages with classic ’80s R&B and boogie funk, pairing his adventurous sound with themes of self-actualization and human connection.

albums.title: Preoccupations
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: The artists formerly known as Viet Cong return with a harrowing, ferociously alive rock record that nods to Swans and Echo and the Bunnymen.

albums.title: ArtScience
albums.label: Blue Note
albums.description: By keeping things mostly in-house, Glasper's Experiment band present their most realized album yet.

albums.title: Another Green World
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Brian Eno has done everything from producing huge pop stars to creating tiny art installations to touring with rock bands to inventing ambient music. Another Green World remains his definitive album.

albums.title: Transpecos OST
albums.label: Milan
albums.description: Moonlighting from their gig in the National, the Dessner brothers deftly transpose their rock acumen to a subtle and detailed film score.

albums.title: The Divine Feminine
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: As a loose concept record about the many subtleties of love and distance, the Pittsburgh rapper's new release is the most surprising, concise, and accomplished album of his career.

albums.title: The Tonite Show
albums.label: Fresh in the Flesh
albums.description: The two Bay Area presences come together for a short but supremely fun trip on the latest in the Tonite Show series.

albums.title: Femenine
albums.label: Frozen Reeds
albums.description: This 1974 performance of Femenine is a marvel of open-form minimalism, a rare recording of the undersung avant-garde composer and pianist that heralds the powerful voice of the black, queer artist.

albums.title: Cactus
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: On this fully-improvised session, the jazz duo of drummer Bobby Kapp and pianist Matthew Shipp lock in and never lose focus.

albums.title: Clinging to a Dream
albums.label: Magic Theatre Music
albums.description: On this new album, Simeon Coxe rewires 1960s underground space poppers Silver Apples (again) and makes far-out sounds and sweet left-field songs.

albums.title: Pretty Years
albums.label: Sinderlyn
albums.description: Following up their remarkable LOSE, the Staten Island rockers try to fight grief with dense, hook-filled songs about the intrinsic value of being alive.

albums.title: Stage Four
albums.label: Epitaph
albums.description: A harrowing and unrelenting record, Stage Four is a glowing testament the post-hardcore band's melodicism, honesty, and unconditional empathy.

albums.title: Light Falls
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: Featuring members of Godspeed You! Black Emperor, J.R. Robinson's chamber-doom project coheres beautifully into a meditation on the banality of evil.

albums.title: Sunergy
albums.label: Rvng Intl.
albums.description: Electronic music pioneer Suzanne Ciani and composer Kaitlyn Aurelia Smith come together for two lengthy slices of ambient bliss as part the RVNG label's *FRKWYS *series.

albums.title: Lady Parts
albums.label: Lex
albums.description: This collab between the fun-loving Boston rapper Michael Christmas and the fractious IDM producer Prefuse 73 has flashes of fun and brilliance, but their styles are often incompatible.

albums.title: The Wink
albums.label: Drag City
albums.description: Tim Presley's solo debut reteams him with producer Cate Le Bon for a stark, stream-of-consciousness odyssey.

albums.title: Skeleton Tree
albums.label: Bad Seed Ltd.
albums.description: Nick Cave has always played with death. Now, he confronts it.

albums.title: KoKoro
albums.label: Control Group
albums.description: Sarah Assbring's global influences bring her to bright new places with inspiring albeit uneven results.

albums.title: The Assistenz
albums.label: Shitkatapult
albums.description: The Chilean-born, UK-raised producer continues his work to breathe life into techno and meticulously break down the division between texture and rhythm.

albums.title: E2-E4
albums.label: MG.ART
albums.description: After Ash Ra Tempel dissolved in the mid-’70s, the krautrock band’s leader Manuel Göttsching explored ambiance and minimalism. Improvised at home in an hour, E2-E4 became an electronic music landmark.

albums.title: Time Fades Away/Zuma
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: Neil Young's troubled, long-fabled "Ditch Trilogy" is finally released in full alongside an unexpected, mercurial coda.

albums.title: AIM
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: M.I.A. returns with a politically charged but confusing album that lacks bite and bounce, presenting only glimmers of what once was.

albums.title: Orphée
albums.label: Deutsche Grammophon
albums.description: Based loosely on Ovid’s interpretation of the Orpheus myth, the Icelandic composer’s latest work reveals the grandeur of his music outside of scoring films.

albums.title: Desconstrução
albums.label: Goma Gringa
albums.description: A new compilation celebrates the grey but lush “samba sujo” of São Paulo, with strands of native samba, post-punk rumble, Afrobeat, and blasts of avant-jazz.

albums.title: Pearls to Swine
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: After almost a decade, the gorgeous voice of singer-songwriter Adam Torres remains the spotlight, but his songs have grown wider and more elemental.

albums.title: Afro-Cuban Electronics
albums.label: Interdimensional Transmissions
albums.description: Producers Armando Martinez and Rey Rubio focus on electro's Latin roots with an album that's all about percussion.

albums.title: Rub Out the Word
albums.label: Infrequent Seams
albums.description: Steve Buscemi reads the cut-up passages of William Burroughs while backed by the drones of Elliott Sharp. It rarely works.

albums.title: Arvo Pärt: The Deer's Cry
albums.label: ECM New Series
albums.description: The Estonian composer's ecclesiastical music is masterfully produced, bolstered by a powerful interpretation from the vocal ensemble Vox Clamantis.

albums.title: Acoustic Recordings 1998-2016
albums.label: Third Man
albums.description: A career compilation that highlights the gentler side of White, some in a stripped-down Detroit setting and others in a homespun Nashville setting.

albums.title: Caetano Veloso
albums.label: Philips
albums.description: In 1968, the Brazilian pop singer began a Tropicália revolution against a newly installed military government. It's a vibrant, cheeky, agitprop album that purred and glided past the martial censors.

albums.title: Twin Peaks OST
albums.label: Death Waltz
albums.description: The timeless score to David Lynch’s television show doesn't need any visuals to achieve the same sense of unsettling beauty.

albums.title: Deserts of Youth
albums.label: Orindal
albums.description: Maine-based songwriter Liza Victoria’s proper debut album is a work of intimate beauty—a self-contained world that feels like a long song cycle rather than a collection of various pieces.

albums.title: Away
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Okkervil River’s Will Sheff approached Away like a solo record, collaborating with jazz, folk, and classical musicians. It contains the thrill of listening to a person take risks.

albums.title: Anything But Words
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: RZA and Interpol's Paul Banks come together for an overwrought pop-rap record either for die-hard fans or for those who think Chris Martin might just the best part of Graduation.

albums.title: We Move
albums.label: Caroline
albums.description: With the help of some producers du jour, the Irish singer-songwriter expertly blends his deep love for acoustic soundscapes and hip-hop on his fully realized third record.

albums.title: The End of Comedy
albums.label: Weird World
albums.description: For his latest psychedelic pop record, Michael Collins enlisted Ariel Pink, Weyes Blood, and members of the Mac DeMarco band, among others. It’s Collins’ most focused effort yet.

albums.title: Goodbye to Language
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: Using only pedal steel, lap steel, and effects, Lanois turns traditional sounds into ambient and effortless music, brilliantly masking the complexity of its source.

albums.title: Schmilco
albums.label: dBpm
albums.description: Wilco's 10th album is a largely acoustic affair laden with sweet melodies, autumnal production, and childhood memories that stop just short of nostalgic.

albums.title: E•MO•TION Side B
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Side B is less a collection of b-sides than it is a continuation of last year's full-length smash, heart-swelling and heart-draining pop that exists in worlds just before or after love.

albums.title: As Light as Light
albums.label: No World
albums.description: Focusing more on songcraft than synth textures, inc. no world's sophomore album is a more grounded, elemental look at 21st-century R&B.

albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: Katie and Allison Crutchfield would go on to bigger things in the bands Waxahatchee and Swearin’, but their early band P.S. Eliot made some fantastic music of its own.

albums.title: Birds in the Trap Sing McKnight
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: His guest-heavy sophomore album sees Travis Scott amplifying the fun and theater of his projects as he finds his true home as a host for others.

albums.title: The Sun’s Tirade
albums.label: Top Dawg
albums.description: The Tennessee rapper and TDE associate really finds his voice on his second album, one filled with the tensions caused by a cycle of self-loathing and self-discovery.

albums.title: Circle 1: Live in Germany Concert / Circle 2: Gathering
albums.label: Concord Music Group
albums.description: Available for the first time digitally, these two albums from the free-jazz supergroup featuring pianist Chick Corea and saxophonist Anthony Braxton offer a singular display of musicianship and chaos.

albums.title: The Serious EP
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Bibio smartly reteams with Olivier St. Louis for a brief, effervescent, if somewhat canned retro R&B homage.

albums.title: False Readings On
albums.label: Temporary Residence
albums.description: On his striking new LP, the pop-ambient composer Matthew Cooper, aka Eluvium, marshals his sound into sweeping maximalist splendor.

albums.title: Splendor & Misery
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The L.A. rap deconstructionist trio, which features Hamilton’s Daveed Diggs, has released their highest-concept work yet: a hip-hop space opera.

albums.title: Here
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: The Scottish quintet’s 10th album, and first in six years, is full of quiet revelations. The hushed production and contented lyrics make for their warmest and subtlest effort to date.

albums.title: Patientness
albums.label: Orchid Tapes
albums.description: The delicate songs of the nomadic singer-songwriter have the ability to turn the wildest emotions into something calm and centered.

albums.title: Ultra
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: The fourth full-length from the hermetic UK electronic wizard is his most confident in ages, a fully-formed showcase for his singular ear and audacious production.

albums.title: A Rainbow in Curved Air
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: A fixture of the minimalist canon, these two singular psych-classical compositions snuck into '60s counterculture at just the right time.

albums.title: Existentialism
albums.label: Bloodshot
albums.description: Recorded last summer in Brooklyn, this kinetic live album collects new politically-charged songs from the British art-punk O.G.s—a call to arms for all those pushing against the tides of modern life.

albums.title: Cosmetic
albums.label: Goner
albums.description: The Nots' second album finds the Memphis band moving beyond minute-long blasts of hooky punk and experimenting with new textures and art-damaged noise.

albums.title: Science Agrees
albums.label: Cooking Vinyl
albums.description: The Smiths' Andy Rourke and Cranberries' Dolores O'Riordan team up with producer and singer Olé Korestsky for an album that doesn't lean too much on everyone's bona fides.

albums.title: and the Anonymous Nobody...
albums.label: A.O.I., LLC
albums.description: The hip-hop legends return for their first album in 12 years and turn a comeback story into more of a claim to their legacy.

albums.title: blisters
albums.label: Tri Angle
albums.description: The hybrid pop collaboration between Josiah Wise and Haxan Cloak is a sly and personal exploration of the queer experience, boiling with personal energy and fantastically operatic in scale.

albums.title: My Woman
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: Angel Olsen's latest is her best record yet, a bracing mix of sounds and styles congealing around songs of pain, sadness, and hope.

albums.title: Kiss Me All Night EP
albums.label: City Slang
albums.description: Just six months after their seismic Big Black Coat, the Canadian electronic duo shifts into a lower gear but stays on the vanguard.

albums.label: Temporary Residence
albums.description: This reissue of William Basinski's 2009 album finds the composer doing what he does best, creating haunting loops and drones that have a way of burrowing into your life.

albums.title: Funk Factory
albums.label: Be With
albums.description: Known for housing a famous Beastie Boys sample, the reissue of this 1975 funk and fusion classic brings peerless Polish and American players together for a groovy, eccentric journey.

albums.title: One Nite Alone, The Aftershow: It Ain't Over!
albums.label: NPG
albums.description: Originally released as part of a three-disc set, Prince fires on all cylinders at these live recordings from the early ’00s, a testament to his late-night blues and funk reveries.

albums.title: Killer Road
albums.label: Bella Union
albums.description: Soundwalk Collective is an electronic group featuring vocals by Patti Smith and percussion by her daughter, Jesse. Here, they use field-recordings from Ibiza to rework the poetry of Nico.

albums.title: JEFFERY
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: The rap iconoclast returns with his best album since Barter 6, daring and chameleonic, filled with hooks about identity, love, and that undefinable future swag.

albums.title: Trouble
albums.label: Ba Da Bing!
albums.description: Though they’ve been releasing music since the late ’80s, the New Zealand noise trio remain as vital, corrosive, and challenging as ever.

albums.title: The Party's Over EP
albums.label: Caroline
albums.description: The new Rage Against the Machine/Public Enemy/Cypress Hill supergroup is a harmless if not crass experiment that amounts to a bad cover band playing songs they actually wrote.

albums.title: Opalescent
albums.label: Just Music
albums.description: This reissue of the electronic composer’s first album, made in his early 20s, rings thin and hollow compared to the dark genius of his later work.

albums.title: Becoming the Beach Boys: The Complete Hite & Dorinda Morgan Sessions
albums.label: Omnivore
albums.description: A collection of spartan demos, false-starts, and practice runs of early Beach Boys songs recorded in 1961-62 amounts to a curious, often campy origin story for hardcore fans only.

albums.title: Water EP
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: The eight-track Water EP collects preliminary sketches from Aaron Maine’s best album, the spring release Pool. These rudimentary demos are filled with their own attractions and surprises.

albums.title: Prima Donna
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: Pushing his versatility, ear for production, and lyricism in new directions, Vince Staples' hot streak continues.

albums.title: Whole & Cloven
albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: Bowles has the power to transform the sound of a banjo—and traditional folk music—into something transcendental, often bringing the spirit of Americana to new heights.

albums.title: Amnesty (I)
albums.label: Fiction
albums.description: The first Crystal Castles album without vocalist Alice Glass is also the first safe album from an act that once would have recoiled at such a thought.

albums.title: GucTiggy EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Gucci Mane and Zaytoven give a quick five-song salute that recaptures a few sparks of their former fire.

albums.title: For this We Fought the Battle of Ages
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: On their fourth full-length, the Salt Lake City doom band SubRosa take inspiration from a 100-year-old dystopian novel about a modern surveillance state. The resulting album is their best yet.

albums.title: Mangy Love
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: On his eighth album, the singer-songwriter connects his gentle, acerbic soul to his most politically charged, well-stated, and funniest songs.

albums.title: Motion Graphics
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Joe Williams' first solo project is a breath of fresh air for vaporwave.

albums.title: Things Fall Apart
albums.label: MCA
albums.description: Things Fall Apart was a turning point for the Roots, the record where they figured out what kind of band they could be. Both its themes and its eclectic mix of sounds resonate in the current moment.

albums.title: Larva Lumps and Baby Bumps
albums.label: Artoffact
albums.description: Perennial Long Island noise-rockers return with their first album in 14 years, as detailed and cacophonous as they've always been.

albums.title: Take It, It’s Yours
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: On this collection of classic punk covers, La Sera’s Katy Goodman and the Hush Sound’s Greta Morgan defang purposefully messy music with honeyed duets and pleasant arrangements.

albums.title: The Bells
albums.label: Studio Barnhus
albums.description: The Swedish producer in charge of bringing capital-F Fun back to the dance floor succeeds in a multitude flying colors across his ebullient and wildly dynamic debut album.

albums.title: Nexus
albums.label: UNO
albums.description: On his sophomore EP, DJ/producer Caleb Halter positions his music between ambient atmospheres and clubby bombast—this time pulling in opposing directions rather than seeking balance.

albums.title: Instinctive Drowning
albums.label: Mello Music Group
albums.description: On his second solo LP, the Detroit MC Chris Orrick, aka Red Pill, raps about alcoholism and depression. Instinctive Drowning is largely devoted to the persistence of a tormented mind.

albums.title: 4th of July
albums.label: Thirty Tigers
albums.description: On his second solo album, the My Morning Jacket guitarist finds comfort in the slow lane of life, eschewing guitar fireworks for easy-chair folk.

albums.title: Ibifornia
albums.label: Love Supreme
albums.description: The French duo resurface with their first album in 10 years, slamming together the Balearic reverie of Ibiza and the pop-chart tank-top vibe of California, not always to great effect.

albums.title: Blade of Love
albums.label: New Amsterdam
albums.description: The avant-garde tenor saxophone quartet returns with three adventurously dense movements, yet they maintain a focused sense of restraint and melody throughout.

albums.title: Partners
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: What starts as an homage to John Cage, soon shifts into an increasingly honest and heartfelt album of solo piano by the young composer.

albums.title: Blonde / Endless
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Four years after the landmark Channel Orange, two new releases from Frank Ocean find him writing richly emotional songs for a quieter, more meditative space.

albums.title: Atomic Bomb Compilation Vol. 4
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: A juke-filled, global set of songs compiled in Japan reflects the fear and uncertainty of the atomic age, recontextualizing the joy of footwork into ominous, often unsettling compositions.

albums.title: CDW EP
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The Toronto singer's debut EP arrives fully formed, a short mix of quiet storm R&B and dark pop for doomed lovers.

albums.title: I Told You
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: On his debut album, the Toronto artist provides his origin story, and proves just how hard it is to escape from the long shadow of Drake.

albums.title: Home Wrecking Years
albums.label: Arts & Crafts
albums.description: On his third solo album, Broken Social Scene’s Brendan Canning offers tentative experiments that ape other bands’ styles. It feels like a guy just filling downtime.

albums.title: "Fantasy Live 1999"
albums.label: World Famous
albums.description: An extended dance music composition from the Japan-based analog-synth trio audaciously tries to recreate a long-lost live session with contemporary global grooves.

albums.title: Star Core
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: On the Bay Area electronic musician’s second solo album, the minutest vibrations are as expressive as the most sweeping gesture. Its mood exquisitely balances melancholy and hope.

albums.title: I.B. Tree
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: With the help of producer I.B. Classic, the Chicago trap-soul rapper delivers the most defining and unifying record of his career.

albums.title: Skiptracing
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: Mild High Club is the solo act of Alex Brettin, a tourmate and disciple of Mac DeMarco’s sunny sound. On his sophomore album, Brettin finds a voice more distinctly his own.

albums.title: Miss Sharon Jones! OST
albums.label: Daptone
albums.description: The soundtrack to the Sharon Jones documentary isn’t quite a career-spanning compilation, but provides the unflinching honesty and ceaseless vitality that abounds in her life and music.

albums.title: Phase Zero
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: On his Sub Pop debut, deranged psych-pop bedroom auteur Morgan Delt cleans up his sound considerably.

albums.title: The Childhood of a Leader OST
albums.label: 4AD
albums.description: The avant-garde icon Scott Walker scored this film about a fictional 9-year-old dictator, and it's one of the best things Walker has done since the still-unsettling The Drift.

albums.title: Sélébéyone
albums.label: Pi
albums.description: The international jazz-rap project Sélébéyone is a rare case of the two genres mixing at their most far-out, abstract corners.

albums.title: Blue Rider Songs
albums.label: Scissor Tail
albums.description: On his debut solo album, the Hiss Golden Messenger member finally lets out his voice—a cool, soulful thing filled with deep reverence for the road, if some cynicism about the myths it’s spun.

albums.title: Songs in the Key of Life
albums.label: Motown
albums.description: *Songs in the Key of Life *was the culmination of a historic period of creativity for Stevie Wonder. Its ambition and scope were unprecedented, and he never approached its caliber or impact again.

albums.title: Honor Killed the Samurai
albums.label: Iron Works
albums.description: With his latest, the Brownsville rapper cements himself as a preeminent stylist, his voice hushed but vicious, his production a grim rabbit hole of found sounds, minor keys, and few drums.

albums.title: Rattle
albums.label: Upset the Rhythm
albums.description: The all-drum band Rattle's self-titled record has an admirable sense of freedom and unwillingness to mimic the tropes of conventional songwriting.

albums.title: Almost Holy OST
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Atticus Ross (Trent Reznor's film-scoring partner) and Bobby Krlic, aka The Haxan Cloak, soundtrack this documentary about a priest who rescues drug-addicted youths from the streets of the Ukraine.

albums.title: In Summer
albums.label: Geographic North
albums.description: The experimental ambient musician Jefre Cantu-Ledesma's In Summer is some of the most emotionally evocative noise music of the year.

albums.title: Open Your Eyes
albums.label: Teklife
albums.description: Open Your Eyes, the first set of new tracks released on Teklife's eponymous label, features collaborations with Oneohtrix Point Never and a host of footwork veterans.

albums.title: Spinhead Sessions
albums.label: Goofin'
albums.description: Titled after the studio where the band rehearsed for a movie-soundtracking job, these purely instrumental pieces from 1986 offer another look at the Sonic Youth who had just recorded EVOL.

albums.title: Crappin’ You Negative
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: The mid-'90s Memphis band Grifters wrote songs that sounded like smart conversations you wished you could contribute to, inside jokes you wanted to be let it on. This was their most bracing statement.

albums.title: Radiating Light: Orchid Tapes & Friends
albums.label: Orchid Tapes
albums.description: Radiating Light is the second compilation from Orchid Tapes, a sequel to 2014's *Boring Ecstasy. *Like the first, it gives you hope that people still make magic in their apartments behind closed doors.

albums.title: Paramount
albums.label: Triple B
albums.description: Fury’s debut LP is a proud revival of the Orange County youth crew hardcore tradition. It is a devastating work of emotional and philosophical inquisitiveness that, yes, you can totally punch shit to.

albums.title: Callus
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Gonjasufi's Callus is an album that's disorienting at its catchiest, harrowing at its ugliest, and more than willing to run both of those modes at the same time.

albums.title: Fishing Blues
albums.label: Rhymesayers
albums.description: The Minneapolis rapper-producer duo Atmosphere over-share on their sloppy and tedious new album, though it still contains a few gripping moments.

albums.title: Boronia
albums.label: Kanine
albums.description: On Boronia, the Australian duo Hockey Dad are a 2016 version of the Wyld Stallyns, if Bill and Ted had been hypnotized by surf rock instead of metal.

albums.title: Official
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On this new mixtape, Oakland rapper and former Das Racist member Kool A.D. collaborates with the producer Trackademicks to focus on a looming Bay Area influence: hyphy.

albums.title: 5TARB01
albums.label: Endless Xclusive
albums.description: Lexxi worked on Elysia Crampton's excellent July release Demon City. Where Demon City stretched to encompass both past and future, the producer's debut EP* *takes place in a single wide-eyed moment.

albums.title: Stranger Things OST, Vol. One
albums.label: Lakeshore
albums.description: The soundtrack to the runaway-hit Netflix sci-fi series evokes some of the ‘80s touchstones of the show, but in a more restrained way.

albums.title: Jumping the Shark
albums.label: Secretly Canadian
albums.description: The Australian musician Alex Cameron paints quick, affecting character sketches of losers and creeps, bolstered by elementary synth programming and Cameron’s confident, warm baritone.

albums.title: The Get Down OST
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: The soundtrack for the Netflix drama The Get Down, which tells the story of the birth of hip-hop in '70s NYC, mixes disco classics with contributions from Nas, Miguel, Kamasi Washington, and others.

albums.title: For Mark, Your Son
albums.label: Mello Music Group
albums.description: On his Mello Music debut For Mark, Your Son, the Chicago-born rapper, singer, and producer Lando Chill comes to grips with the death of his father.

albums.title: Kiid
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On Kiid, her first full LP, Mal Devisa’s voice is raw, collected, and honest, scaling heights that you may have forgotten were there.

albums.title: PARTYNEXTDOOR 3 (P3)
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Drake affiliate and OVO signee PARTYNEXTDOOR follows up his biggest hit, penning Rihanna's summer jam “Work,” with his most assured and confident work yet.

albums.title: Convenience
albums.label: Mexican Summer
albums.description: The no-wave inspired Brooklyn punks Pill pair controlled chaos with darkly funny, incisive political commentary.

albums.title: More Better Days
albums.label: Better Days
albums.description: The Japanese DJ/producer Chee Shimizu curates a two-volume selection of obscure Japanese pop that runs the gamut from jazz fusion to New Age and prog rock.

albums.title: One Day All of This Won't Matter Any More
albums.label: Moshi Moshi
albums.description: The British duo Slow Club traveled to Virginia’s Spacebomb Studios to record their latest LP. The songs are dressed in easy listening costumes, but they seethe with disconnect and sorrow.

albums.title: SremmLife 2
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: SremmLife 2, the follow-up to the turbocharged rap duo's joyous debut SremmLife, is stranger, artsier, and flat-out ballsier than its predecessor.

albums.title: Roosevelt
albums.label: City Slang
albums.description: Roosevelt's debut is a cocktail of disco, French touch, Ibiza house, yacht rock, and electropop that evokes some crowded Tiki-torch dancefloor lost on the Mediterranean coast.

albums.title: Dry
albums.label: Too Pure
albums.description: On her debut, Polly Jean Harvey matched Patti Smith’s incandescence with Bessie Smith’s lasciviousness, outplayed everyone on the British indie circuit, and became an instant star.

albums.title: Kaleidoscope World
albums.label: Flying Nun
albums.description: In early ’80s Dunedin, the Chills were at the forefront of an extraordinary little guitar-pop scene. This reissue of their debut—a major document of their early era—extends the album to 24 tracks.

albums.title: Chronicles 1
albums.label: a-ton
albums.description: In the ‘90s, the heady, ethereal techno made by 7th Plain had no peers. The best of this out-of-print and previously unreleased material still sounds otherworldly, all these years later.

albums.title: Golden Sings That Have Been Sung
albums.label: Dead Oceans
albums.description: The first song on guitar wunderkind Ryley Walker’s fourth album might be the best thing he’s ever done. Then there are the other seven songs.

albums.title: Daniel Son ; Necklace Don
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On his third project of 2016, 2 Chainz continues to show the way to rap successfully past the age of 40: He has some of the most enduring, daring, and funny verses in the game.

albums.title: A Weird Exits
albums.label: Castle Face
albums.description: On their latest, Thee Oh Sees show an eagerness to drift away from their foundational ’60s psych-pop and garage-punk roots into more cosmic realms.

albums.label: DFA
albums.description: On their second LP for DFA, Factory Floor’s post-punk past has dissolved into hardware dance pieces of monomaniacal repetition and stiff precision. It’s tirelessly energetic, but often in a brute way.

albums.title: Summer Camp
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: R&B singer/producer theMIND’s debut project Summer Camp is a low-stakes surprise, the late-night stoner’s LP we didn’t know we needed.

albums.title: Live from Trona
albums.label: Carpark
albums.description: Toro Y Moi's Live From Trona is an odd concert album: It was performed in front of no one, amidst the beautiful landscape of Trona—three hours away from Los Angeles.

albums.title: Encore
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: DJ Snake is best known for his endless sugar high “Turn Down For What.” His solo album has a few successfully ridiculous tracks but mostly makes you question the need for its existence.

albums.title: Verschiebung
albums.label: Die Orakel
albums.description: The producer Roman Flügel has spread his work across genres and a number of aliases, and on Verschiebung he explores misty, muted techno.

albums.title: Innocence Reaches
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: After a run of increasingly fussy, exhausting records, Kevin Barnes has started making direct and inviting music again. Innocence Reaches dips its toe into contemporary EDM.

albums.title: Way Down in the Jungle Room
albums.label: Legacy
albums.description: Tracked at Graceland in 1976, the recordings on this double-disc compilation show that Elvis never stopped believing in the power of music, that he never stopped searching for the right song to sing.

albums.title: The Land OST
albums.label: Mass Appeal
albums.description: Nas executive-produced the film and soundtrack The Land, the sort of coming-of-age tale that hip-hop once produced in abundance. The soundtrack features Nas, Erykah Badu, Kanye, Pusha T, and more.

albums.title: Flood Network
albums.label: Joy Void
albums.description: Part of the appeal of Melbourne bedroom-pop artist Katie Dey’s latest is the voyeuristic thrill of hearing knotty music made to satisfy nobody but its author, sometimes at the audience’s exclusion.

albums.title: What Now?
albums.label: Astro Nautico
albums.description: The experimental soul musician's adventurous debut album draws as much from free jazz and IDM as it does funk and R&B, from the Dirty Projectors as much as D'Angelo.

albums.title: Interior Architecture
albums.label: Intercoastal Artists
albums.description: This expansive double LP from Los Angeles producer M. Geddes Gengras collects four modular synth compositions with a lush, liquid sound. They are rewarding in their instability.

albums.title: Sweatbox Dynasty
albums.label: Ghostly International
albums.description: Thomas Fec (aka Tobacco) has trafficked over the years in the weird, the uncanny, the not-quite-right. His new album tries for a slightly less confrontational, still-unconventional take on synthpop.

albums.title: Start Your Own Fucking Show Space
albums.label: Famous Class
albums.description: *Start Your Own Fucking Show Space *is a loving and lovable tribute to the Brooklyn DIY space Death by Audio

albums.title: Well Worn
albums.label: Ghostly International
albums.description: The Australian duo Kllo is consistent in its commitment to moodily lit, immaculately appointed spaces—to stylish understatement at all costs.

albums.title: Generationwhy
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Zhu first gained attention with massive 2014 last-call club hit “Faded,” but his debut album is bloated with bland, often downright bad dance music.

albums.title: Suicide Squad: The Album
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Featuring Skrillex, Rick Ross, Grimes, Kehlani, Lil Wayne, and many (many) others, the Suicide Squad OST feels as grim and stapled-together as the movie.

albums.title: Telefone
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On Telefone, Noname pours the joy and devastation we glimpsed in her various guest spots with artists like Chance the Rapper, Mick Jenkins, and Saba into a rich, somber, and incredibly intimate album.

albums.title: Boy King
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Wild Beasts' Boy King replaces the ornate detail of its predecessors with machine-tooled funk and pitch-shifted gasps. It's by no means a disaster, but it is a disappointment.

albums.title: Phantoms of Dreamland
albums.label: Music From Memory
albums.description: Each cut on the obscure British-born, Swiss-based musician Michal Turtle's Phantoms of Dreamland presents a strange-yet-charming self-contained little sound world.

albums.title: Cluster Ensemble: Plays Philip Glass
albums.label: Orange Mountain
albums.description: The Cluster Ensemble tackles some of Philip Glass's iconic early works, playing them more crisply and clearly than perhaps any other recording in history.

albums.title: Dangerous
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: At the time of Dangerous, Michael Jackson's universal popularity was on par with pizza and the polio vaccine. It was the last time that Michael Jackson was Michael Jackson.

albums.title: Cam & China
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Cam & China, twins from Inglewood and veterans of L.A.’s jerkin’ scene, are uniquely attuned to one another,  resulting in some of the year’s fiercest, most viscerally exciting rap music.

albums.title: How It Feels to Be Something On
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: Sunny Day Real Estate admired Fugazi's ethics, but dreamed of being Led Zeppelin and U2, bands that aspired for total transcendence—something they finally achieved on How It Feels to Be Something O**n.

albums.title: Revisions of the Past
albums.label: Bindrune
albums.description: Revisions of the Past reissues two albums by Panopticon, the solo vehicle of Minnesota-via-Kentucky black metal musician Austin Lunn, here remastered by Colin Marston of Krallice, Gorguts, and others.

albums.title: Lovers
albums.label: Blue Note
albums.description: Romantic “mood music” isn’t what most listeners expect from Nels Cline, but on his Blue Note debut, the Wilco guitarist delivers a chamber-orchestra set that visits some American songbook standards.

albums.title: 1-800 DINOSAUR Presents Trim
albums.label: 1-800 DINOSAUR
albums.description: Grime outsider Trim teams up with James Blake and other members of the British electronic music scene for an intriguing, somewhat-cluttered collaborative mixtape.

albums.title: Circle of Light
albums.label: Trunk
albums.description: Delia Derbyshire was an unsung early pioneer in electronic music, and her score for the 1972 film Circle of Light is the longest single piece of recorded music of hers to see release yet.

albums.title: Major Key
albums.label: Epic
albums.description: Major Key is DJ Khaled’s ninth studio album in 10 years, and it’s undoubtedly his best. Depending where you stand on the Khaled spectrum, that may mean nothing or everything.

albums.title: Night Melody
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: Electronic musician Ryan West's latest release as Rival Consoles has a level of warmth and humanity missing from his earlier records. This is his most expressive and emotional music yet.

albums.title: Impossible Dream
albums.label: Gndwire
albums.description: Haley Bonar’s Impossible Dream is a brisk half-hour of barbed power-pop tunes that sting so sweetly that it’s only after the fact you consider you might need a tetanus shot.

albums.title: The Perfect Luv Tape
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Lil Uzi Vert's latest mixtape comes at a moment of fever-pitch buzz for the young rapper, reaffirming his talent for synthesizing trends into a catchy melodic soup.

albums.title: Hypercaffium Spazzinate
albums.label: Epitaph
albums.description: *Hypercaffium Spazzinate *is the first LP in over 12 years from the California pop-punk icons, and it relies on the same humor, honesty, and personal experience that has always powered their music.

albums.title: No Beer, No Dad
albums.label: Lauren
albums.description: Portland band Blowout's exuberant debut conveys the sense of being so overwhelmed by frustration, excitement, or any feeling really, that it must be acted on, coordination be damned.

albums.title: Give a Glimpse of What Yer Not
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: The latest from the re-reconstituted Dinosaur Jr. proves the equilibrium they discovered on their 2007 comeback Beyond remains intact.

albums.title: Spend the Night With...
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Cheena is composed of members from noise and hardcore outfits like Pharmakon and Anasazi, but on their debut, they are a rock band, pure and simple, channeling the New York Dolls.

albums.title: Jaguar Mirror
albums.label: ESP Institute
albums.description: While only four tracks and under 20 minutes of music, the Swedish duo Thunder Tillman’s debut EP spans continents.

albums.title: Hangin’ At the Beach
albums.label: L.A. Club Resource
albums.description: Producer Delroy Edwards combines the faded ‘80s vibe of Ariel Pink and John Maus with a sharp eye toward what moves bodies on dance floors today.

albums.title: For All We Know
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: On For All We Know, Nao autopsies various relationships—with friends, lovers, outgrown versions of herself—and, having decided what went wrong, calmly takes down the perpetrators.

albums.title: The King of Whys
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: Mike Kinsella expresses ugly sentiments with inverse beauty in Owen's acoustic-heavy return.

albums.title: Shy Layers
albums.label: Growing Bin
albums.description: Shy Layers’ debut is one of the year's great, unexpected pleasures: a deeply engaging, effortlessly listenable collection of Balearic pop with overtones of yacht rock, Kraftwerk, and Graceland.

albums.title: 4OKI
albums.label: Dim Mak
albums.description: Steve Aoki’s latest EP, 4OKI, is a cheap, placebo imitation of a party.

albums.title: Take Down
albums.label: Exit
albums.description: With the debut of his new project Metronome, Mikel Rouse reaches the rarified level of production ambition he first achieved in the ’80s, as he weaved together classical, electronic, and indie rock.

albums.title: S+@dium Rock: Five Nights at the Opera
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: This raucous, epic live album compiles several nights' worth of shows at the Brooklyn venue Shea Stadium, where Titus Andronicus celebrated the release of 2015's The Most Lamentable Tragedy.

albums.title: 25 Years of Musical Deviance
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: This box packages most of Meshuggah’s recorded work—7 studio albums and 3 EPs—and offers an overview of how this extreme metal band pushed the entire genre head-first into the future.

albums.title: The Disco’s of Imhotep
albums.label: Technicolour
albums.description: The Disco’s of Imhotep is dance-music outsider Jamal Moss's most approachable collection to date while not diluting his music’s signature oddity.

albums.title: Music Inspired by Philippe Garrel’s Le Révélateur
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: Harpist Mary Lattimore, who has worked with Thurston Moore and Sharon Van Etten, teams with mult-instrumentalist and War on Drugs producer Jeff Zeigler for a hypnotizing, semi-improvised score.

albums.title: Blood Sugar Sex Magik
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: On their 1991 breakthrough album, the Red Hot Chili Peppers were the partially-clothed id, barreling toward the funk and stumbling across inclusiveness along the way.

albums.title: The Philips Years
albums.label: Philips
albums.description: The Philips Years is a humble title for a collection that contains some of the most important, moving documents of American history. Nina Simone’s Philips records remain her most essential.

albums.title: Stranger to Violence
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: The Queens, New York-based outfit Psalm Zero explore the fertile territory between metal and new wave on their sophomore album.

albums.title: Drool Sucker
albums.label: Topshelf
albums.description: The unpredictable Drool Sucker kicks off a series of EPs from the transcontinental band No Joy in which they attempt to shake off the “shoegaze revival” tag once and for all.

albums.title: Sky Girl
albums.label: Efficient Space
albums.description: Two French DJs evoke heartbreak and desolation in a compilation of little-heard gems.

albums.title: Let Me Hang You
albums.label: Ernest Jenning
albums.description: Let Me Hang You is the result of long-shelved sessions from the 1990s, during which Burroughs recited some favorite riffs from Naked Lunch. The album conjures only a portion of the book’s wild power.

albums.title: Boleros Valses y Mas
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: The Los Angeles producer's first Stones Throw release takes the bolero, the valse, and other traditional Latin forms and plays them on a solitary Oberheim synthesizer.

albums.title: A Mulher do Fim do Mundo (The Woman at the End of the World)
albums.label: Mais Um Discos
albums.description: 79-year-old samba icon and Brazilian national hero Elza Soares offers a searing, surging fusion that combines Afro-Brazilian styles with wiry, dissonant strands of punk and noise-rock.

albums.title: D.T.S.N.T.
albums.label: Ultra
albums.description: The quietly virtuosic Parisian producer STWO worked on Drake’s “Weston Road Flows” from VIEWS, and his debut EP is chock-full of impressive guest vocalists, testifying to his ear for talent.

albums.title: Lil Durk 2X
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: After a forgettable Def Jam debut, 2x realizes Durk’s full potential as drill’s last major-label hope.

albums.title: Late Nights: Europe
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Reportedly recorded in 2 weeks, Late Nights: Europe is a polished, 14-track libertine manifesto, wrapping up a trilogy of odes to the grown and sexy. Featuring Ty Dolla $ign, Wiz Khalifa, and more.

albums.title: The Bird & the Rifle
albums.label: CN Records
albums.description: On her Dave Cobb-produced latest, country singer/songwriter Lori McKenna shows her remarkable facility for conveying the inner lives of women trapped in soured relationships.

albums.title: Noise Patterns
albums.label: Physical Editions
albums.description: Composer, designer and programmer Tristan Perich uses very small objects—microchips—to pose very big questions about art, music, and the state of the “album.”

albums.title: Dead Revolution
albums.label: Metal Blade
albums.description: John Cobbett is one of modern metal’s premier guitarists. In Hammers of Misfortune, he reinvigorates ’70s progressive rock and the hard rock of Deep Purple, Rainbow, and Uli Jon Roth-era Scorpions.

albums.title: Guidance
albums.label: Sargent House
albums.description: There's an organic and unforced feel to the latest album by Chicago-based post-rock trio Russian Circles, as if songs were allowed to grow wild rather than carefully cultivated.

albums.title: Summer Songs 2
albums.label: Quality Control
albums.description: On his latest mixtape, the divisive Atlanta rapper sounds best when chasing fresher, weirder, spacier styles instead of trying to live up to hip-hop’s storied traditions.

albums.title: Unfinished
albums.label: Technicolour
albums.description: On his sixth release, lo-fi techno producer Florian Kupfer creates music as airy and pleasantly rudimentary as a papier-mâché sculpture.

albums.title: Everybody Looking
albums.label: Atlantic
albums.description: Emerging from prison clean and sober in May, Gucci Mane releases an album looking to capitalize on his massive influence. Featuring Kanye West, Young Thug, and Drake.

albums.title: Command Your Weather
albums.label: Joyful Noise
albums.description: The duo Big Business’ latest is an anxious and adventurous little record, too eccentric and playful to be accepted as metal but too loaded and loud to be taken as most anything else.

albums.title: Young Jefe 2
albums.label: 300 Entertainment
albums.description: On the sequel to his breakout 2014 mixtape, the Washington, D.C. rapper Shy Glizzy is simply a joy to listen to, one of the most distinctive and technically adventurous rappers working today.

albums.title: This Is Gap Dream
albums.label: Burger
albums.description: Gap Dream's morose new record documents a music nerd's midlife meltdown, over junk-littered garage rock, rudimentary synth-pop, and no-budget prog flourishes.

albums.title: Titans in the Flesh
albums.label: Coalmine
albums.description: With their second collaborative project, this rapper/producer duo offer a well-studied paean to hip-hop’s past. You could call it a boom baptism.

albums.title: Sound Signature Presents: These Songs That Should've Been Out on Wax By Now
albums.label: Sound Signature
albums.description: Theo Parrish might have gotten screwed over at the vinyl-pressing plant, but as a result, we got two volumes of this very-bluntly-named collection of moving, diffuse, spare, soul-deep jams.

albums.title: Songs and Jams Vol. 1
albums.label: American Bushmen
albums.description: Few post-punk outfits deliver their most accomplished album 36 years after putting out a debut single. Yet the story of Philadelphia’s Notekillers has rarely been a typical one.

albums.title: Love & Hate
albums.label: Polydor
albums.description: Singer Michael Kiwanuka’s new album* *is a sprawling soul opus full of longing and self-assessment.  It's a bittersweet offering, growing more melancholy as it plays.

albums.title: Coolaid
albums.label: Entertainment One
albums.description: On Snoop Dogg’s 14th studio album Coolaid, he returns to hip-hop as both a resident and a tourist.

albums.title: Buhloone Mindstate
albums.label: Tommy Boy
