albums.description: De La Soul's knotty and brilliant third album is a fever dream of shared memories, historical touchstones, geographical landmarks, first-person pronouns and six feet-deep self­-actualizations.

albums.title: Cistern
albums.label: The Leaf Label
albums.description: Composer and songwriter Jherek Bischoff's third record is an oceanic song cycle that encourages listeners to drop down into their own mind, a safe space in the dark where they are comfortably alone.

albums.title: Call by Night
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: Fresh & Onlys guitarist Wymond Miles cultivates an arch air of high drama in his solo LPs. The songs on Call By Night touch on the exhilaration that sometimes accompanies sadness and uncertainty.

albums.title: Ambulance
albums.label: Partisan
albums.description: On their gloomy new record, the psych-rockers the Amazing grab hold of a small range of emotions—depression, regret, angst, longing—and hang on for dear life.

albums.title: Savage Mode
albums.label: Slaughter Gang
albums.description: On Savage Mode, the dry-voiced and deadpan trap rapper 21 Savage recounts a life that has known nothing but violence. It's his strongest release, thanks to sleek production by Metro Boomin.

albums.title: Kuiper
albums.label: Luaka Bop
albums.description: On his new EP, producer Floating Points (nee Sam Shepherd) offers two extended tracks that occasionally sound like Neu! with steroids and 40 years of additional recording technology on their side.

albums.title: Drankin’ & Drivin’
albums.label: Deep Entertainment
albums.description: Houston rap icon Z-Ro's gorgeous, languid baritone frequently lapses into singing. His latest album paints with just a few colors, but he continually finds new ways to blend them.

albums.title: Four Meditations / Sound Geometries
albums.label: Sub Rosa
albums.description: The legendary 84-year old composer, accordionist, and electronic pioneer reaffirms her mastery at conjuring three-dimensional worlds from simple words on a page.

albums.title: Gqom Oh! x Crudo Volta Mixtape
albums.label: Gqom Oh!
albums.description: This collaborative mixtape between Gqom Oh! and the Rome-based Crudo Volta collective showcases some of the best music that gqom—a raw, brash dance music coming from Durban—has ever produced.

albums.title: No Hard Feelings
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Chicago rapper Dreezy is a drill-adjacent upstart from the South Side, and her major-label debut is a fully-formed offering that seamlessly balances rugged raps with pristine pop songs.

albums.title: Mono No Aware
albums.label: Alcopop!
albums.description: The British punk band Johnny Foreigner’s songs often seem made up of components of older emo and pop-punk songs, but remembered wrong, reversed and compressed into anxious nodes.

albums.title: Horror Zone
albums.label: Nu-Roots
albums.description: Though 40 years have passed between albums, roots reggae legend Max Romeo's latest picks up right where the classic Lee “Scratch” Perry-produced War Ina Babylon left off.

albums.title: HEAVN
albums.label: Closed Sessions
albums.description: With the assistance of fellow Chicagoans Chance the Rapper, Saba, and Kweku Collins, R&B artist Jamila Woods makes vital, resonant protest music that sounds like a children’s playground.

albums.title: Community Service 2!
albums.label: Unknown
albums.description: Chance the Rapper compatriot Towkio sometimes raps great, vivid tales about his life in Chicago. Sometime’s he’s funny and weird. And sometimes he falls victim to cruddy trap beats and generic lyrics.

albums.title: Indifferent Rivers Romance End
albums.label: The Flenser
albums.description: The California duo Wreck and Reference strip away the basics of metal, redefining the genre even as they sit outside it. On their new album, their songcraft catches up to their uncompromising gloom.

albums.title: Centres
albums.description: Ian William Craig's Centres is a swirling and alchemical blend of drone, keyboards, and manipulated vocals. The more time you spend with it, the further you will want to get lost in it.

albums.title: PRINCESS
albums.label: True Panther
albums.description: The Atlanta singer/producer Abra makes vintage, '80s-sounding R&B with the production values and aesthetic of bedroom pop.

albums.title: Operator
albums.label: Last Gang
albums.description: More than any other MSTRKRFT release, *Operator *sounds like the work of a band — one with punk DNA coursing through its army of analog synths.

albums.title: Pylon Live
albums.label: Chunklet
albums.description: The Athens, Georgia group Pylon were one of the great unsung heroes of '80s post-punk, and Live captures them in December 1983 at the peak of their local popularity.

albums.label: Fragile
albums.description: The Berlin- and London-based photographer Wolfgang Tillmans has long had ties to music and club culture, and now he has released a musing and quizzical techno release of his own.

albums.title: IV
albums.label: Innovative Leisure
albums.description: On their fourth record, the succinctly titled *IV, *BADBADNOTGOOD rein in their jam-band impulses, delivering a velvet-crushed portrait of an effervescent lounge act in the 21st century.

albums.title: 32 Levels
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The influential hip-hop producer's debut album, 32 Levels, has two distinct sides: a uniformly strong rap side and a pop side that’s not nearly as engaging or distinctive.

albums.title: Elysia Crampton Presents: Demon City
albums.label: Break World
albums.description: Demon City, Virginia producer Elysia Crampton's follow-up to her sumptuous debut American Drift, is a wonder of concision and represents another massive leap forward in her growth.

albums.title: Camp Cope
albums.label: Poison City
albums.description: This Melbourne trio's effusive, empathic, and emphatic indie-rock debut examines shame the way 69 Love Songs x-rays love.

albums.title: Devotional Songs
albums.label: Honest Jon's
albums.description: Shackleton, who has made himself a genre of one with his dark, dramatic dub-inspired work, takes a turn toward the operatic.

albums.title: Caramel
albums.label: Planet Mu
albums.description: Konx-om-Pax is the project of electronic musician Tom Scholefield. His second LP Caramel fondly invokes nostalgia for the rave era, playing like the faded tracers and seared after-images that remain.

albums.title: Tusk
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Fleetwood Mac's beautiful and terrifically strange 1979 LP Tusk poses the question: What happens when love dissipates, and you have to find a new thing to believe in? What if that thing is work?

albums.title: Eleven into Fifteen: a 130701 Compilation
albums.description: Eleven Into Fifteen: a 130701 Compilation is a new anthology pulling unreleased work from 130701’s roster, celebrating not just the label but the hazily-defined genre of “post-classical.”

albums.title: 3 Way
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Migos found the perfect moment to drop their short but potent EP 3-Way.

albums.title: Hit Reset
albums.label: Hardly Art
albums.description: The Julie Ruin’s second album, Hit Reset, is bandleader and punk icon Kathleen Hanna's most commanding release since her manifesto-writing days.

albums.title: Sketches from an Island 2
albums.label: International Feel
albums.description: The British-born producer Mark Barrott played a big role in establishing the Balearic sound. Sketches from an Island 2 is the rare sequel that improves on the original.

albums.title: New Introductory Lectures on the System of Transcendental Qabala
albums.label: YLYLCYN
albums.description: Liturgy frontman Hunter Hunt-Hendrix's latest work is electronic side project Kel Valhaal, which mixes his interests in Southern rap with ambient drones and glitch.

albums.title: Nothing’s Real
albums.label: Polydor
albums.description: On her latest record, Shura is at the vanguard of a scene of young queer pop stars who are updating the ’80s model of self-sufficient, fully liberated mainstream pop.

albums.title: DJ-Kicks
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: Glaswegian DJ Jackmaster is best known for his ability to traverse genres, decades and moods in a few sweaty hours, and the prestigious DJ-Kicks series is an ideal format for his talents.

albums.title: The Columbia Years 1968-69
albums.label: Light in the Attic
albums.description: These recently unearthed sessions find Betty Davis working with members of Jimi Hendrix's band, Herbie Hancock, Wayne Shorter, and others, honing the sound she'd bring to her incendiary solo albums.

albums.title: Stateless
albums.label: Temporary Residence
albums.description: Tangents artfully mix acoustic instruments and electronics in pieces that combine improvisation with careful processing. At their best, they bring to mind Can, Tortoise, Four Tet, and the Necks.

albums.title: Double Bind
albums.label: Spunk
albums.description: On their latest album, New Zealand's Trust Punks leave behind jangly pop for a plunge into acidic post-punk, while their lyrics cast a jaundiced eye at a crumbling society.

albums.title: Made To Measure
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: The London-based electronic duo's latest record was written well before Brexit, but its austere, dystopian murk reflects the deflated, anxious, uncertain national mood of their home.

albums.title: Blank Face LP
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Blank Face LP is a collection of catchy, urgent gangsta rap songs that show the South Central native at his charismatic best, gallows humor and tough talk failing to obscure a humane core.

albums.title: Entrañas
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: The electronic artist Arca's latest unclassifiable release is darker than his stunning 2015 LP Mutant; it’s heavier and more unrelenting.

albums.title: Plum
albums.label: Brunette Editions
albums.description: John Roberts' pristine and absorbing third LP finds the avant-garde techno producer speaking the language of dance music without actually making much music to dance to.

albums.title: Windings
albums.label: Feedelity
albums.description: Unfussy, bursting with confidence, and freshly energized, the 3 songs on Hans-Peter Lindstrøm's new EP return to the space-disco euphoria of his most-loved work.

albums.title: Blisters in the Pit of My Heart
albums.label: Dirtnap
albums.description: Martha’s sophomore LP offers fodder for critical thought that can be digested while pogoing.

albums.title: Gone is Gone
albums.label: Rise
albums.description: Gone is Gone is a power trio made of key members from Mastodon, Queens of the Stone Age, and the recently reactivated At the Drive-In.

albums.title: blackSUMMERS’night
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The cool, shimmering* blackSUMMERS’night *is probably Maxwell’s most cohesive effort since Embrya, fit to soundtrack sessions of sex so exquisite and transcendental, tantric comes off as boring.

albums.title: Church EP
albums.label: True Panther
albums.description: Kelsey Lu recorded her debut EP live in a Brooklyn church with a loop pedal and Chairlift’s Patrick Wimberly co-producing. The music lingers and haunts, rich with sadness and unease.

albums.title: Black Bubblegum
albums.label: DFA
albums.description: The Black Dice member's latest solo outing is ramshackle, blithe, and relatively accessible, with cleaner vocals than usual and a sense of demented whimsy.

albums.title: Take Her Up To Monto
albums.label: Play It Again Sam
albums.description: The underrated Irish post-disco singer returns with her second album in two years after a lengthy dry spell. The songs flit amongst genres, united only by her fearless, restless spirit.

albums.title: Waking at Dawn
albums.label: OVO Sound
albums.description: With his debut album, this young Canadian R&B singer signed to Drake’s OVO Sound imprint has trouble escaping the shadow of his brooding musical forebears.

albums.title: Resolutionary (Songs 1979-1982)
albums.label: Staubgold
albums.description: Resolutionary (Songs 1979-1982) reintroduces us to the indomitable Vivien Goldman—music journalist, reggae scholar, NYU’s “Professor of Punk”—whose recordings helped build post-punk at its magic hour.

albums.title: Dream World
albums.label: AraabMuzik Label Group
albums.description: AraabMuzik’s long-awaited sophomore LP Dream World is packed with more sonic diversity than his beloved debut, Electronic Dream. This works both for and against him.

albums.title: GØGGS
albums.label: In the Red
albums.description: Ty Segall's latest collaboration—with Ex-Cult's Chris Shaw and Fuzz's Charles Moothart—isn't a revolution. They’re just three friends, hellbent on sustaining guitar music’s urgency and simplicity

albums.title: The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill is a declaration of independence. With it, Ms. Hill put the entire genre of hip-hop on blast and elevated heartbreak to spiritual proportions.

albums.title: Into the Light
albums.label: Chaos Kitchen
albums.description: Guitarist Marisa Anderson's latest album soundtracks a theoretical sci-fi Western of her own invention, where it’s up to the listener to fill in the cinematic details.

albums.title: Summer 08
albums.label: Because Music
albums.description: Metronomy's latest record strips away any pretense that they are a band, focusing on its sole creator, Joe Mount. The album solidifies his own idiosyncratic brand of standoffish funk.

albums.title: Fallen
albums.label: Apron
albums.description: Steven Julien specializes in a jubilantly no-frills strain of house and techno, and his debut album is bare-bones—just gnarled acid sequences, bare-knuckle drum programming, and drifting synths.

albums.title: Live at Third Man Records
albums.label: Third Man
albums.description: Live at Third Man Records* *is the first live album by comedy duo Scharpling & Wurster. It's a concise set that seems focused on celebrating their act, rather than expanding on it.

albums.title: Ellis
albums.label: Erased Tapes
albums.description: Nils Frahm collaborates with fellow composer Woodkid on a ruminative score for a documentary about Ellis Island, narrated by Robert DeNiro.

albums.title: Magma
albums.label: Roadrunner
albums.description: The acclaimed avant-metal outfit Gojira’s sixth full-length LP is their most accessible release yet, melodically immediate and charged with emotion.

albums.title: Wildflower
albums.label: Modular
albums.description: The Avalanches return with their first new album in 16 years.

albums.title: Nite-Funk
albums.label: Glydezone
albums.description: Nite Jewel and Dâm-Funk have been teasing a collaboration for years, and their long-awaited EP, they capture lightning in a bottle. More, please.

albums.title: Streets of Compton
albums.label: Entertainment One
albums.description: The soundtrack to the The Game's three-part documentary series Streets of Compton feels like a missed opportunity for the rapper to embrace his comfort zone.

albums.title: Cheetah
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: The newest Aphex Twin since Richard D. James returned from his extended hiatus shows a simpler side of his music, with slower tempos and spine-tinglingly rich tunes and timbres.

albums.title: Hot Hot Heat
albums.label: Culvert Music
albums.description: After 17 years, five albums, and numerous line up changes, Hot Hot Heat are calling it quits with their final, self-titled LP, which looks back on things with surface cheeriness and tangible fatigue.

albums.title: Paradise Gallows
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: Paradise Gallows finds the Richmond, Virginia five-piece alternatively aiming to be both the world’s heaviest act and also the prettiest.

albums.title: Biologia Animale E Vegetale
albums.label: Cinedelic
albums.description: The composer Egisto Macchi was part of the same collective that included Ennio Morricone. He scored numerous films and documentaries in Europe: This collection gives shape to his legacy.

albums.title: Weaves
albums.label: Buzz
albums.description: The Toronto indie rock quartet Weaves' self-titled debut is an impressive album about incapacitating infatuation.

albums.title: California
albums.label: Viking Wizard Eyes
albums.description: Blink-182's seventh album wants to be a pop-punk eminence album, evidence humbly submitted that this aging pack of skater brats is still young, selectively dumb, and full of commiserating angst.

albums.title: Primary Colours
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: After scoring a #1 hit with 2014's "Rude,"  the Canadian Rastatryhardians return with an album that posits them as "Magic! The Career Artists."

albums.title: Delirium Tremens
albums.label: Mute
albums.description: Former Bad Seeds sideman Mick Harvey revisits the songbook of Serge Gainbourg for the third time, moving past the salacious icon’s signature songs into his oddities.

albums.title: Alice Bag
albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: Alice Bag was the lead singer and co-founder of the Bags, one of the first punk rock bands to emerge from L.A., and Alice Bag is her first solo record in a 40-year career.

albums.title: Anagrams
albums.label: Melodic
albums.description: Stephen Steinbrink has been bouncing around the West Coast indie underground for over a decade now.  The singer/songwriter's new album is his best, with winsome shades of Elliott Smith's XO.

albums.title: The Bride
albums.label: Parlophone
albums.description: Natasha Khan's latest album as Bat For Lashes is a richly theatrical concept album detailing the story of a woman left at the altar after the husband dies in a car crash on the way to the wedding.

albums.title: Different Class
albums.label: Island
albums.description: On 1995's Different Class, Pulp and Jarvis Cocker were arty outsiders worming their way into the lives of ordinary folk, and they became pop in its most democratically widespread sense.

albums.title: Nice As Fuck
albums.label: Love’s Way
albums.description: The post-punk project Nice As Fuck is the most low-stakes album Jenny Lewis has ever been a part of, but it hits its mark.

albums.title: Dream Music
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: Dream Music is a reissue of two self-released records from the early ’80s by an obscure New Mexican New Age artist named Jeff Berry. His work, weird and entrancing, sounds remarkably fresh in 2016.

albums.title: New English
albums.label: G.O.O.D. Music
albums.description: 19-year-old Brooklyn rapper Desiigner emerged from nowhere to collaborate with Kanye on The Life of Pablo. On New English, he sounds like the last five years of hip-hop watered down.

albums.title: Uniola
albums.label: Tiny Engines
albums.description: Look Mexico's Uniola is a caffeinated kind of indie rock that works to the rhythm of daily life, while their lyrics treat soul-searching as natural, inescapable part of living.

albums.title: Human Story 3
albums.label: Break World
albums.description: James Ferraro’s latest album feels a bit like a didactic student art project; it finds the vaporwave pioneer doubling down on the themes of 2011’s Far Side Virtual with a much heavier hand.

albums.title: Autodrama
albums.label: Manifesto
albums.description: The L.A. band Puro Instinct evaporates some of the shoegaze fog around their debut for some tentative bigger pop maneuvers.

albums.title: Entities Inertias Faint Beings
albums.label: Room40
albums.description: Composer/performer/improviser David Toop’s latest release traces the seam between sound and music, paying attention to the hidden sounds that surround us and turning silence inside out.

albums.title: Project E.T. Esco Terrestrial
albums.label: Free Bandz
albums.description: Esco Terrestrial is technically DJ Esco’s project, but the weight of it is carried by Future, who appears on all but two songs. Despite strong moments, Future sounds a little exhausted.

albums.title: Freetown Sound
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Dev Hynes' third album as Blood Orange is a searing and soothing personal document, striking the same resonant chords as Kendrick Lamar’s *To Pimp a Butterfly or *D’Angelo’s Black Messiah.

albums.title: I, Gemini
albums.label: Transgressive
albums.description: The teenaged duo Let's Eat Grandma explore the nightmarish whimsy of nursery rhymes and folktales with a distinctly English flavor on their chilling and impressive debut.

albums.title: Sound in Time
albums.label: Dischord
albums.description: With warped lyrics and a thing for repetition, Lungfish embodied the D.C. area’s post-hardcore innovations. No one else has gotten as weird since.

albums.title: Indigo
albums.label: River Tiber
albums.description: On his debut LP, the Toronto producer and singer/songwriter Tommy Paxton-Beesley, aka River Tiber, sums up the chilly, forlorn pop sound that has defined his city.

albums.title: The Magic
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: The avant-pop stalwarts return with one of their loosest and most rock-heavy records yet, slightly bending their own rules while remaining stubbornly singular.

albums.title: Going By
albums.label: Double Double Whammy
albums.description: Felix Walworth's second album of indie-pop under the name Told Slant addresses questions of trauma, confusion, and loss with frankness and intimacy.

albums.title: It’s Hard for Me To Say I’m Sorry
albums.label: Editions Mego
albums.description: Christian Fennesz and Jim O'Rourke tease out their differences across two long instrumental tracks that are alternately luminous and blustery.

albums.title: Fire
albums.label: Don Giovanni
albums.description: Amy Klein’s solo debut, after stints as the grinning rhythm guitarist in Titus Andronicus and several other projects, feels like the demo that your college roommate’s band just made.

albums.title: b
albums.label: Trip
albums.description: Bjarki is a closely watched new techno producer from Iceland with a deft touch for big, dumb ragers. On the first of 3 new releases this year, he treats old-school techno with classic-rock reverence.

albums.title: Codex Obscura Nomina
albums.label: Debemur Morti
albums.description: This split LP from Blut Aus Nord and Ævangelist explores black metal’s capacity to accommodate an array of sounds and moods, not just grimness.

albums.title: Otero War
albums.label: Cinematic
albums.description: Like the two Caveman albums before it, Otero War could be an accessory to a generic and fictionalized network-tv retelling of “indie rock in the 2010s.”

albums.title: The Christic Shows, November 16 & 17, 1990
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: The new entry in Springsteen’s Live Archives series is the most unusual offering so far: two acoustic shows from 1990 that find him alone onstage for the first time since his commercial breakthrough.

albums.title: True Sadness
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: It’s fitting that the Avett Brothers’ most disappointing record yet bears the title of True Sadness. Is this some kind of play for the Top 40, or just instrumental bloat and trite sentiment?

albums.title: Jay II
albums.label: Mint
albums.description: Musician/producer Jay Arner excels at sneaking despondence and alienation into airtight, earwormy pop gems. On Jay II he explores his love of New Wave and other '80s pop.

albums.title: Suicide / Alan Vega Martin Rev
albums.label: Superior Viaduct
albums.description: The godfathers of no wave use bits of punk, post-punk, and disco, connecting them all through attitude. In their first two albums, you can even hear the roots of new wave, industrial, and techno.

albums.title: Yoncalla
albums.label: Cascine
albums.description: Yumi Zouma’s first album closes a longtime distance between its members and delivers bright, complex disco-rock.

albums.title: Muzik
albums.label: PHLEX
albums.description: Several years removed from their turn-of-the-decade peak, Delorean's frothy dance-pop has soured somewhat.

albums.title: Tonight's the Night
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: Neil Young's Tonight's the Night is a harrowing record about loss and death. Yet it often sounds like a raucous party thrown by a bunch of lovable knuckleheads having the time of their life.

albums.title: The Mountain Will Fall
albums.label: Mass Appeal
albums.description: DJ Shadow trades in his turntables and MPC for a copy of Ableton and embarks upon a freewheeling, low-stakes journey through the contemporary sounds that inspire his practice.

albums.title: Warm Leatherette
albums.label: Island
albums.description: Warm Leatherette, Grace Jones’ career-shifting 1980 release, gives a glimpse of the artist just as her true genius was coming into sharp focus.

albums.title: American Tunes
albums.label: Nonesuch
albums.description: American Tunes is a posthumous album from the legendary musician, songwriter, and New Orleans legend Allen Toussaint, whose smartly funky touch enlivens a selection of standards.

albums.title: John Cage Meets Sun Ra: The Complete Concert
albums.label: Modern Harmonic
albums.description: This live album documents the meeting of two avant-garde legends, but it is not exactly a "super duo." The curious chemistry these two share is subtler and possibly more rewarding than that.

albums.title: Trans Day of Revenge
albums.label: Nervous Nelly
albums.description: The second EP from the queer hardcore punk band G.L.O.S.S. conveys a violent and severe world, one in which the only reasonable and intelligent responses are anger and aggression.

albums.title: The Dreaming Room
albums.label: Sony
albums.description: Laura Mvula is a classically trained vocalist with an orchestral pop style all her own. Her second album is filled with her rich and moving voice and is laden with sonic surprises.

albums.title: Post Plague
albums.label: Telephone Explosion
albums.description: Toronto trio Odonis Odonis forgo their rowdy surf/garage mix for a pulsating, John Carpenter-esque goth palette, while their lyrics explore the dire consequences of unchecked technological progress.

albums.title: Libras
albums.label: Joyful Noise
albums.description: Matthew Friedberger's latest is an instrumental effort with Sebadoh (and sometimes Fiery Furnaces) drummer Bob D’Amico. The best moments have Friedberger's antic playfulness and melodic gift.

albums.title: Moog for Love
albums.label: Island
albums.description: After last year's underwhelming Caracal, the Disclosure brothers' surprise-dropped EP shows that thrill isn’t quite gone, but it’s definitely not the same.

albums.title: Tween
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Tween is a collection of outtakes from the perennially overlooked Baltimore indie rock band's previous two LPs, yet it manages to capture the full scope of their vision.

albums.title: Secretly Susan
albums.label: Twosyllable
albums.description: Melbourne artist Sui Zhen's world is brilliant and uncanny, and her music explores a familiar theme—the thinness of digital-media life—with a fresh eye.

albums.title: Blood // Sugar // Secs // Traffic
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The Pittsburgh quartet the Gotobeds trade in the dour, verbose post-punk of bands like Parquet Courts and Protomartyr, with lyrics that suggest they're aware they walk a well-traveled road.

albums.title: Puberty 2
albums.label: Dead Oceans
albums.description: On her fourth album, Mitski makes a resounding personal statement and stakes out her territory as one of the most compelling voices in the sphere of indie rock.

albums.title: Magic 19
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Bishop Nehru debuted as DOOM's protege and signed and split with Nas' label all before age 19. Now, he stakes out his own territory on a mostly self-produced effort that blasts off for other galaxies.

albums.title: Delayer
albums.label: Magic Bullet
albums.description: RLYR features Pelican guitarist Trevor Shelley de Brauw, Locrian percussionist Steve Hess, and Russian Circles bassist Colin DeKuiper. Their debut is forty minutes of uncommonly optimistic post-rock.

albums.title: Brigid Mae Power
albums.label: Tompkins Square
albums.description: Irish folk singer Brigid Mae Power's latest occupies a liminal space made up of droning guitars, metallic piano reverberations, and lyrics that trace some barely escaped threat.

albums.title: Still Brazy
albums.label: Def Jam
albums.description: Compton rapper YG's follow up to 2014's My Krazy Life parts with DJ Mustard's snaps and dips into rich, classic g-funk, while YG grapples with the contradictions of being a celebrity gangster.

albums.title: The Big Cover-Up
albums.label: Olsen
albums.description: The Norwegian producer's latest EP remixes a handful of strange tunes, from Vangelis to Boney M.  to Yellow Magic Orchestra, that have entered the disco canon.

albums.title: ELDORADO
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: On his debut album, Ro James delivers a pleasant but only sporadically exciting R&B affair.

albums.title: The Glowing Man
albums.label: Young God
albums.description: Swans close their current chapter on a subdued but powerful note.

albums.title: PAGAN
albums.label: Mixpak
albums.description: South London musician Benjy Keating is signed to the acclaimed independent dancehall label Mixpak, where he makes a strange and subdued DIY bedroom-pop version of dancehall.

albums.title: Media in the Service of Terror
albums.label: Hospital Productions
albums.description: In his industrial techno guise Vatican Shadow, Dominick Fernow (aka Prurient) explores some of his most simultaneously bleak and clubby music yet.

albums.title: The Getaway
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: The Red Hot Chili Peppers' eleventh album is their first since 1989’s Mothers’ Milk without Rick Rubin behind the boards, opting instead for Danger Mouse and Nigel Godrich.

albums.title: Friday Night
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: On his sometimes-hilarious, seat-of-the-pants live concert album, Arcade Fire's Will Butler shows the good and bad sides of winging it and hoping your audience follows.

albums.title: Weval
albums.label: Kompakt
albums.description: With their self-titled debut, Weval have made the rare electronic record that is so strong and obviously appealing that it can't help but end up in the hands of casual listeners.

albums.title: All Things Must Pass
albums.label: Apple
albums.description: Given his own studio, his own canvas, and his own space, George Harrison did what no other solo Beatle did on All Things Must Pass: He changed the terms of what an album could be.

albums.title: A Youthful Dream
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: Aarhus punks Yung take the austere vibe of their big-brother bands like Iceage and shoot it through with some old-fashioned American-fuck-up energy, a la Paul Westerberg and Jay Reatard.

albums.title: Lil B.I.G. Pac
albums.label: Dollaz N Dealz
albums.description: On his best mixtape yet, the Southern rapper offers introspective street rap, free-flowing punchlines, and youthful swagger, moving beyond the Gucci and Boosie comparisons to find a voice of his own.

albums.title: You Will Never Be One of Us
albums.label: Nuclear Blast
albums.description: Nails make music for when you look at life and see little of value, for when you're feeling bitter and alone. On their latest, they make a little room for others to stare at the void with them.

albums.title: case/lang/veirs
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: The debut from k.d. lang, Neko Case, and Laura Veirs isn’t a springboard or a resting place for any of these vets. It's an exquisite tribute to connection and reflection on the things that bind us.

albums.title: Live at the Witch Trials/Dragnet
albums.label: Superior Viaduct
albums.description: New reissues of the Fall’s first two albums find the band hungry, angry, and taking switchblades to a grim future.

albums.title: Alpha
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: Audion is the minimal-techno guise of Matthew Dear, and often a vent for his most antic impulses. Alpha jettisons the wilder stuff for a sleek, toned-down, crisper affair.

albums.title: On My One
albums.label: Island
albums.description: The pop-star-baiting, credibility-seeking, Noel-Gallagher-approved (and then shunned), surly major label rocker Jake Bugg turns in one of the most baffling collections of music in recent memory.

albums.title: EARTH
albums.label: Reprise
albums.description: Neil Young’s not-exactly-live album EARTH, a set of songs from across his career about food awareness, feels like the first time in a while that Young has been in on his own joke.

albums.title: Last Year Was Complicated
albums.label: Island
albums.description: On Last Year Was Complicated, Nick Jonas follows in the tried-and-true “I'm having sex now, guys” footsteps of boybanders past.

albums.title: Professional Sunflow
albums.label: Superior Viaduct
albums.description: Just as they did with dub icons The Congos, Sun Araw collaborate with New Age icon Laraaji on the hazy, welcoming* Professional Sunflow. *

albums.title: It's Too Late to Stop Now... Volumes II, III, IV & DVD
albums.label: Sony
albums.description: On the newly reissued 1974 live album It's Too Late To Stop Now, Van Morrison discovers his peak as a performer. The band builds an environment; Morrison wanders through all of its available space.

albums.title: Liquid Cool
albums.label: Gloriette
albums.description: After a pop-oriented push on 2012’s One Second of Love, Nite Jewel's Ramona Gonzalez reclaims the murky, DIY vision of her Altered Zones-era releases.

albums.title: Early Recordings
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Katie Crutchfield's first EP as Waxahatchee, originally released on cassette, unfolds like a pleasant secret on the brink of being passed around.

albums.title: Midnight
albums.label: Smalltown Supersound
albums.description: Dan Lissvik's latest solo album echoes his past glory with the Swedish dance-rockers Studio, but teases when it could fulfill.

albums.title: Mandatory Check
albums.label: EMPIRE
albums.description: This Sacramento rapper has had a busy couple of years, and though his latest often sounds rushed, he remains one of the foremost narrative stylists in hip-hop.

albums.title: Turn to Gold
albums.label: Infinity Cat
albums.description: On Diarrhea Planet's third album, arena-rock ambition clashes with D.I.Y. scuzz–and a vocalist coup may be in order.

albums.title: Thick as Thieves
albums.label: Glassnote
albums.description: On their third full-length, the Temper Trap capture some of the crowd-pleasing sound of their debut, unleashing likable enough pop-rock with a bright electronic sheen.

albums.title: Jackie Lynn
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: Haley Fohr's newest songwriting persona doesn't mince words–but she also leaves her full potential unknown.

albums.title: Argonautica
albums.label: Firehouse 12
albums.description: The experimental trumpeter Nate Wooley is known for disassembling his instrument and making music from its various parts. Here, he pays homage to one of his mentors with epic, rock-infused tumult.

albums.title: Why Are You OK
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Working with producer Jason Lytle, formerly of the band Grandaddy, Ben Bridwell has crafted his best album in nearly a decade, but problems still remain.

albums.title: What One Becomes
albums.label: Thrill Jockey
albums.description: Sumac, Aaron Turner's post-Isis trio, succeed at making minimalist doom metal because they recall what fans of Isis loved without resembling Turner's past work in the slightest.

albums.title: For Those Of You Who Have Never (And Also Those Who Have)
albums.label: Proibito
albums.description: Kansas City producer Huerco S.'s second album is ambient music through and through—though it’s informed by a memory of club music, which hangs over it like a ringing in the ears.

albums.title: Movie!
albums.label: Gronland
albums.description: Holger Czukay left Can in 1978 and began a solo career shortly afterward. His debut solo album, now reissued, reveals an impish, cut-and-paste jester behind Can’s impassive façade.

albums.title: The Digging Remedy
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Warp Records mainstays Plaid have staked out a well-defined territory over two decades: They make highly listenable melodic IDM, warm and playful. Their latest album doesn't rip up the blueprint.

albums.title: Twentyears
albums.label: Parlophone
albums.description: On Air's first best-of collection, the early hits are all accounted for—but the band's quirks and ambitions get lost in the haze.

albums.title: Hounds of Love
albums.label: EMI
albums.description: With her self-produced fifth album, Kate Bush became a total auteur, embracing the possibilities of digital sampling synthesizers and creating a perfect marriage of technique and exploration.

albums.title: Fall Forever
albums.label: Kanine
albums.description: On their bleak new album, the Brighton band abandons all hints of jangle-pop and dives into extraterrestrial synths, ominously bowed bass, and guitars distorted beyond recognition.

albums.title: Wild Things
albums.label: Polyvinyl
albums.description: After 2012's spiky, lonely, underrated Anxiety, Ladyhawke returns to '80s-inflected synth-pop on Wild Things.

albums.title: Fantasma
albums.label: Lefse
albums.description: Cornelius's Fantasma was a high point of the mid-'90s Shibuya-kei scene, an eclectic crate-diggers' subgenre that celebrated old sounds. Its vinyl reissue shows it still sounds fresh in 2016.

albums.title: Piano
albums.label: Moshi Moshi
albums.description: The Hot Chip frontman's third solo record is his most straightforward and surprisingly personal effort, a collection of songs for just piano and voice.

albums.title: Strange Little Birds
albums.label: STUNVOLUME
albums.description: With their post-return jitters under control, Garbage have solidified that return with Strange Little Birds, their darkest, most intimate LP and the band’s strongest effort in 15 years.

albums.title: Emotions and Math
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Singer/songwriter Margaret Glaspy's Emotions and Math is a collection of compact grunge-rock and breezy torch songs that variously recall Elliott Smith and Joni Mitchell.

albums.title: Victorious
albums.label: M-Plant
albums.description: Detroit techno legend Robert Hood, under his Floorplan alias, invites his teenage daughter Lyric to coproduce Victorious, which is more open, more anthemic, and brighter than much of his past work.

albums.title: Foiled Again
albums.label: Carpark
albums.description: Speedy Ortiz's latest EP features two unreleased tracks from Foil Deer as well as two remixes of “Puffer,” one featuring a verse from rapper Lizzo and one by Open Mike Eagle.

albums.title: The Other Side of the River
albums.label: Future Days
albums.description: Terry Reid turned down offers to front Led Zeppelin and recorded some flawless folk-rock albums but never escaped obscurity. This comprehensive reissue rounds out his untold story.

albums.title: There’s Alot Going On
albums.label: Roc Nation
albums.description: On his new EP, Vic Mensa opens up like never before, airing his mistakes and fears.

albums.title: Stranger to Stranger
albums.label: Concord
albums.description: Stranger to Stranger is arguably the best album of Paul Simon's uneven post-Graceland solo career. His reliably melodic songwriting is buoyed by his most adventurous arrangements in years.

albums.title: Breakin’ Point
albums.label: Ingrid
albums.description: Breakin’ Point, PB&J's sixth album, enlists big-name producers like Paul Epworth, Greg Kurstin, and Emile Haynie. The result is the big pop album they've always seemed on the verge of making.

albums.title: Black Terry Cat
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: On her second album, Xenia Rubinos negotiates a world that has prescribed ideas about how she should be—particularly as a person of color—and incisively questions her place outside of those roles.

albums.title: Blonde on Blonde Revisited
albums.label: Mojo
albums.description: For the album's fiftieth birthday, an impressive roster of artists, from Steve Gunn to Marissa Nadler to Jim O'Rourke, pay tribute to Dylan's Blonde on Blonde.

albums.title: Ha, Ha, He.
albums.label: Captured Tracks
albums.description: With its two-tone album cover, terse songwriting, and Albini-style, hands-off recording, *Ha, Ha, He. is Mourn's *period piece, conjuring the grave austerity of mid-'90s post-punk.

albums.title: Love You to Death
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: After going synth-pop on 2013's Heartthrob, Tegan and Sara team up once again with super-producer Greg Kurstin for the follow up. At their best, they boil love songs down to their aching essence.

albums.title: Ash & Ice
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: Ash & Ice is The Kills’ first album in five years and they encompass everything they’ve done before, as well as bringing in boombox beats with Brazilian and Afro-pop influences.

albums.title: Future Present Past EP
albums.label: Cult
albums.description: On their newest EP, The Strokes continue to perform “The Strokes” for a new generation of younger and casual listeners.

albums.title: It Came From N.Y.C.
albums.label: Numero Group
albums.description: They may have found fame through Beavis and Butt-Head, but in their early days, White Zombie operated in the same NYC underground as Swans and Sonic Youth. This Numero Group box set tells the story.

albums.title: Levitate
albums.label: R&S
albums.description: At its best, this short, punchy album feels like a distillation of everything that has made British producer Lone's work great so far.

albums.title: Masterpiece
albums.label: Saddle Creek
albums.description: On the rangy folk-rock band Big Thief's Saddle Creek debut Masterpiece, the songs sound cherry-picked over a lifetime of writing, the stories carefully compiled.

albums.title: Big Bossin Vol. 1
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: On Big Bossin Vol. 1, Detroit underground hero and Texas-based producer Cardo Got Wings work together to make a smooth, technicolor tribute to classic LA gangster rap.

albums.title: My Best Human Face
albums.label: Jagjaguwar
albums.description: After two records of quiet, lonely, piano-only music, Spencer Krug returns to the guitars, bleeping synths, and pounding rhythms of his best-loved work.

albums.title: Basses Loaded
albums.label: Ipecac
albums.description: Perhaps for the first time ever, the Melvins sound unfocused and—worse—like their music is beginning to lack energy.

albums.title: Light Upon the Lake
albums.label: Secretly Canadian
albums.description: On their winsome debut, the duo Whitney make a warm, simple and profoundly enjoyable rock'n'roll record, evoking the earnestness and innocence of Girls.

albums.title: Still They Pray
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: The new album from Cough could have arrived anytime during, say, the last three decades and placed the Richmond doom metal quartet alongside the ranks of Candlemass or Cathedral, Sleep or Saint Vitus.

albums.title: The Fan-Tas-Tic Box Set
albums.label: Ne'Astra Music Group
albums.description: With the *Fan-Tas-Tic: A Jay-Dee Production *box set, we're given the most concise and thorough presentation ever of the formative years of Slum Village, the group that counted J Dilla in its ranks.

albums.title: Eyes on the Lines
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: Folk-rocker Steve Gunn's latest album is a rich and amiable meditation about travel and transition, about exploring, wandering, and letting yourself get lost.

albums.title: The Wailing Wailers
albums.label: Yep Roc
albums.description: Not only does The Wailing Wailers highlight the first major recordings of Bob Marley, but the happy, bouncy, optimistic sound is also the sound of post-independence Jamaica.

albums.label: Epic
albums.description: On their new album, Fifth Harmony are at their best when grappling with the age-old girl-group concern of how to reconcile independence with love.

albums.title: Collapse
albums.label: Leaving
albums.description: *Collapse *is a strange and beautiful record that refuses categorization, traipsing through the fields of house, free jazz and musique concrète on the way to something inscrutably Other.

albums.title: DJ-Kicks
albums.label: !K7
albums.description: West Coast groove aficionado Dâm-Funk offers an engrossing selection of tracks that are as dreamy as they are funky in his installment of the DJ-Kicks mix series.

albums.title: iiiDrops
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Joey Purp is a member of Chance the Rapper’s Savemoney Crew, and iiiDrops is his most well-rounded and definitive effort: He comes off as boastful and thoughtful, socially aware and defiantly filthy.

albums.title: Skin
albums.label: Transgressive
albums.description: The young Australian DJ/Producer's profile has grown immensely in the past few years. On his new album, he recruits an all-star cast including Beck, Little Dragon, Vince Staples, and more.

albums.title: Awkward Pop Songs
albums.label: Creep
albums.description: At their best, the Philly punk band JANK highlights the connection between emo’s fourth wave and the unconventional, genre-spanning pop of the Dismemberment Plan or the Unicorns.

albums.title: Modern Country
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Guitarist William Tyler returns backed by an all-star band that notably includes Wilco’s Glenn Kotche and Megafaun’s Phil Cook, summoning a wide range of moods and telling stories without vocals.

albums.title: Suck on This
albums.label: ZEF
albums.description: Suck on This is a teaser for an upcoming full-length from the South African rap trio, but more often than not these days, Die Antwoord comes off as tired and trying way too hard.

albums.title: Folding Time
albums.label: Hotflush
albums.description: Nearly five years after their debut marked the peak convergence of late-2000s bass music and its myriad influences—dubstep, R&B, footwork, house, ambient, hardcore—Sepalcure return with a second album.

albums.title: Congrats
albums.label: Innovative Leisure
albums.description: The instrumental act's latest album finds them revisiting their circa-05 roots, offering tracks that are as pummeling as they are danceable.

albums.title: Angry Angles
albums.label: Goner
albums.description: Angry Angles captured legendary Memphis garage-rock wildman Jay Reatard in between projects and on the brink of his solo career.

albums.title: Mark Kozelek Sings Favorites
albums.label: Caldo Verde
albums.description: On Mark Kozelek Sings Favorites, the Sun Kil Moon singer offers piano-and-voice interpretations of songs ranging from Modest Mouse's “Float On” to “Send in the Clowns.”

albums.title: Rock the Fuck on Forever
albums.label: Pop Wig
albums.description: Baltimore melodic hardcore band Angel Du$t describe themselves as a mix of the Bad Brains and the Lemonheads, and their latest mixes mash notes with double-time tempos.

albums.title: Mosey
albums.label: New West
albums.description: Ontario musician Daniel Romano's fifth solo full-length finds him relying on classic country flourishes to build simple songs that look to the great beyond.

albums.title: Minor Victories
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: Minor Victories includes members of Mogwai, Editors, and Slowdive, and their self-titled debut is a mix of sighing shoegaze, cinematic wanderlust, and gloomy riffage.

albums.title: Murder for Hire 2
albums.label: Bread Winners’ Association
albums.description: Only four months after his exceptional major label debut Islah, Baton Rouge rapper Kevin Gates returns with a mixtape that plays like a compilation of B-sides or outtakes from the Islah sessions.

albums.title: Kidsticks
albums.label: Anti-
albums.description: Written and produced in Los Angeles with Andrew Hung of Fuck Buttons, Beth Orton's latest is anxious, playful, and sounds little like anything the singer/songwriter has done before.

albums.title: Mondo Alterado
albums.label: Hippie Dance
albums.description: The Mexican techno producer Rebolledo specializes in work that feels hollowed out and slightly creepy, with a sly streak of absurdist humor.

albums.title: X-Communicate
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: In her latest transformation, Kristin Welchez leaves behind Dee Dee and the Dum Dum Girls for new alter ego Kristin Kontrol, foregoing DDG's garage-band cool for sleek synth pop.

albums.title: Tempo
albums.label: One Little Indian
albums.description: Composer Olga Bell's Tempo resembles dance music as glimpsed through a funhouse mirror: strangely distorted, sometimes goofy, and deeply pleasing on a simple, almost childlike level.

albums.title: The Dream is Over
albums.label: SideOneDummy
albums.description: PUP's second album is a glorious half-hour of redlining guitars and pile-on group chants that turn self-loathing and self-deprecation into a sort of superpower.

albums.title: K.M.T.
albums.label: Soul Jazz
albums.description: Whether as the Sun God, I.B.M., IAMTHATIAM, or most often as Hieroglyphic Being, Jamal Moss' discography is filled u-turns; Africans With Mainframes swings into Chicago acid house at its most caustic.

albums.title: Everything's Beautiful / Miles Ahead OST
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Messing with Miles Davis music is a dangerous proposition. It was necessary for Don Cheadle's  biopic Miles Ahead, and with help from Robert Glasper, it's sometimes a successful endeavor.

albums.title: elseq 1-5
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: Autechre have surprise-released nearly four hours of music, spanning five volumes. It is the IDM equivalent of a Netflix series binge, and it posits the duo as a sort of post-human jam band.

albums.title: Faraway Reach
albums.label: Innovative Leisure
albums.description: On their latest, tropical-house duo Classixx enlist guest vocalists from How to Dress Well to Passion Pit's Michael Angelakos to T-Pain.

albums.title: It Happened in Flatbush
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: It Happened in Flatbush is a flat album in every way, filled with mealy-mouthed hooks and uninspired tropes—a spiritless effort from a NYC rap group that initially seemed novel in a post-TDE scene.

albums.title: Goodness
albums.label: Tiny Engines
albums.description: On their latter-day emo classic Home, Like NoPlace Is There, the Hotelier took excruciating stock of the darkness. On their newest, the band is pushing with white-hot intensity toward the light.

albums.title: The Last Word on First Blues
albums.label: Omnivore
albums.description: Producer Pat Thomas's loving Last Word on *First Blues *reissue reveals Allen Ginsberg as a missing link in the East Village's musical pathways, a secret alt-folk hero hidden in relatively plain view.

albums.title: Ere Gobez
albums.label: FPE
albums.description: The Ethiopian 11-piece band's sophomore effort is a big, brave roar of an album, reaching and surpassing the heights of their excellent 2012 self-titled debut.

albums.title: Earrings Off!
albums.label: Tri Angle
albums.description: The British experimental rock group Adult Jazz tackle themes of gender and the body's changing place in society on their sophomore outing.

albums.title: Wake Up You!: The Rise & Fall of Nigerian Rock 1972-1977
albums.label: Now Again
albums.description: Wake Up You! specifically covers the short-lived but influential period of Nigerian rock in the country’s post-Civil War era (after 1970).

albums.title: EP 4
albums.label: Wolf Parade Productions
albums.description: On their first EP of new material in six years, Wolf Parade aren't asserting themselves to the world so much as reintroducing themselves to each other.

albums.title: Taste/Should I Remain Here at Sea?
albums.label: Manqué
albums.description: On their two new albums, Islands explore two sides of their personality: the largely electronic Taste is bitter and sharp-witted, while Should I Remain Here at Sea? is more freewheeling.

albums.title: Four Organs / Phase Patterns
albums.label: Superior Viaduct
albums.description: Four Organs and Phase Patterns come from a time when minimalist composer Steve Reich was in an obsessively scientific mode. They establish a new language, while arguing for their very right to exist.

albums.title: Good Luck and Do Your Best
albums.label: City Slang
albums.description: Gold Panda's warm and exuberant new album sounds quite unlike any of the electronic music being made in 2016, and is refreshingly unfashionable in that way.

albums.title: Dangerous Woman
albums.label: Republic
albums.description: Ariana Grande’s third album finds the 22-year-old pop star embracing a Sasha Fierce-like alter ego, with the help of Future, Nicki Minaj, Lil Wayne, Macy Gray, and others.

albums.title: Put the Kid on the Sleepy Horse
albums.label: Topshelf
albums.description: Cult favorites Mock Orange return with an eighth album that reconciles their later alt-country leanings with their Midwestern emo roots.

albums.title: Infrared
albums.label: Fade to Mind
albums.description: On her split EP with the producer Kingdom, Dawn Richard offers a diorama for love’s life cycle, encompassing everything from death defying adoration and righteous anger to, best of all, forgiveness.

albums.title: Changesonebowie
albums.label: Parlophone
albums.description: The original David Bowie hits compilation tells the story of Bowie's metamorphosis from quizzical folkie to a conquering colossus, and is partially responsible for cementing his stardom.

albums.title: Juarez
albums.label: Paradise of Bachelors
albums.description: An outlier on the outlaw country scene of the 1970s, Terry Allen's Juarez is a bawdy song cycle that alludes to the fall of the Aztec Empire, Jesus, and motel sex. It retains its kick 40 years on.

albums.title: Kamikaze
albums.label: Votiv
albums.description: The latest record from the So So Glos is driven by the tension between the band’s perennially youthful sound and their ever-more-jaded worldview.

albums.title: Wave
albums.label: Dial
albums.description: The German musician Christian Naujoks makes pensive, idiosyncratic pieces somewhere between electronic and chamber music, and his new album is his most exquisitely melancholy work yet.

albums.title: The Triad
albums.label: Rough Trade
albums.description: The Triad, Pantha du Prince’s first solo record in six years, is the producer's most maximalist and emotional release to date.

albums.title: Pythagorean Dream
albums.label: Foom
albums.description: The pioneering composer and guitarist's latest album *Pythagorean Dream *is a simultaneously giddy and calm mix of the high-minded and the lizard-brained.

albums.title: Fallen Angels
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Following on last year's Frank Sinatra tribute Shadows in the Night, Dylan's latest finds him once again putting his own idiosyncratic spin on a set of standards.

albums.title: Ullages
albums.label: Partisan
albums.description: Their debut LP vented disillusionment with hard-charging punk and shouted choruses, but on their followup, the Leeds band channel their misery through a soft-focus dream-pop shimmer.

albums.title: Andando el Tiempo
albums.label: ECM
albums.description: At 80 years old, Carla Bley remains a vital force as a pianist, composer, and improviser, mixing knowingly wry moments with a sense of mystery.

albums.title: Strangers
albums.label: Sacred Bones
albums.description: On her latest gothic folk missive, singer/songwriter Marissa Nadler opens up her sound slightly, retaining her grey-skies aesthetic while bringing in a more spacious and rock-oriented sound.

albums.title: These People
albums.label: Cooking Vinyl
albums.description: The former Verve frontman returns after a hiatus with another Richard Ashcroft solo album, with all the ostentatious orchestration, bumper-sticker mantras, and cursory electro-dabbling those entail.

albums.title: Beyond the Bloodhounds
albums.label: Canvasback / Atlantic
albums.description: Through muscular, chugging guitars and plodding percussion, Nashville's Adia Victoria explores ugly emotional realities with "take it or leave it" boldness.

albums.title: Teens of Denial
albums.label: Matador
albums.description: On Car Seat Headrest's first proper new album for Matador, frontman Will Toledo reaffirms that he is ahead of the pack as an imaginative singer-songwriter, capable of crafting dynamic indie rock.

albums.title: A New Wave of Violence
albums.label: Vice
albums.description: Head Wound City, a supergroup drawing from members of the Blood Brothers, the Locust and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, convene for an album of abrasive, low-stakes hardcore.

albums.title: August 26th
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Post Malone is a rap charlatan for the digital age, and his debut mixtape August 26th is like falling down an acoustic rap cover k-hole.

albums.title: In Glendale
albums.label: Rado
albums.description: Tim Heidecker (of Tim & Eric) has released a slick rock record that is also a comedy album, and it is full of all the nervous laughs and queasy vibes of his surrealist comedy.

albums.title: Skip a Sinking Stone
albums.label: Mom & Pop
albums.description: Mutual Benefit's Skip a Sinking Stone, a gorgeous collection of orchestral folk, focuses on the carefully plotted tours of a newly successful band and frontman Jordan Lee's adopted home of New York.

albums.title: Day of the Dead
albums.label: 4AD
albums.description: This epic compilation produced by the National’s Bryce and Aaron Dessner serves as both a fine showcase of the Dead's iconic songs and a who's who of current indie rock.

albums.title: Union and Return
albums.label: Mexican Summer
albums.description: A composer or a jokester? On his fourth album, Luke Wyatt's Torn Hawk project begins to emerge as the medium for a musician interested in pushing the limits of both.

albums.title: Cut and Paste
albums.label: Wichita
albums.description: On his hooky, appealing debut album, the young Londoner Oscar Scheller makes blown-out indie jams with magnetic melodies and an obvious British lineage.

albums.title: Tired of Tomorrow
albums.label: Relapse
albums.description: The Philadelphia band Nothing make gentle-sounding, springtime shoegaze with an alt-pop tinge that would seem all at odds with their gritty punk and hardcore pasts—until you listen to the lyrics.

albums.title: Pile
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Everything on the surface of A Giant Dog's Merge debut screams beware. From the violent lyrics to the grotesque cover art to the very name of the band, the message is clear.

albums.title: Oh No
albums.label: Hyperdub
albums.description: Jessy Lanza's latest is a gorgeous and deadly pop music manifesto, full of pent-up nervous energy set to release.

albums.title: What Follows
albums.label: DFA
albums.description: DFA vets Shit Robot return, and make their case as the label's long-underrated house band. Featuring guest spots from Alex Taylor, Nancy Whang, and the Juan Maclean.

albums.title: Coloring Book
albums.label: Unknown
albums.description: Chance the Rapper's Coloring Book is one of the strongest rap albums released this year, an uplifting mix of spiritual and grounded that even an atheist can catch the Spirit to.

albums.title: Happy Songs for Happy Zombies
albums.label: Club AC30
albums.description: Frequently pointed to as an underrated shoegaze gem, the debut EP by Pinkshinyultrablast provides an enjoyable (if brief) introduction to the band’s rapturous take on rock.

albums.title: Full of It
albums.label: Kill Rock Stars
albums.description: Recent Kill Rock Stars signees Summer Cannibals expertly balance flame-belching Mad Max riffage with lyrics frankly exploring questions of codependence and need.

albums.title: Fool
albums.label: Brainfeeder
albums.description: Fool is a playfully left-field electronic-jazz hybrid from Dutch artist Mitchel Van Dinther. It bursts at the seams with ideas, and at its best recalls the free spirit of late '90s electronic music.

albums.title: I Hear You
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The Georgia post-punk band Arbor Labor Union are veterans of various punk and hardcore bands, and on their new album they expand on the rootsy drone of their first.

albums.title: Holy Ghost
albums.label: Run for Cover
albums.description: Modern Baseball's Holy Ghost asks for difficult things out of its audience—space, patience and acceptance—but demonstrates them as a band with an undeniable sonic ambition and social conscience.

albums.title: The Complete Prestige 10-Inch LP Collection
albums.label: Prestige
albums.description: The Complete Prestige 10-Inch LP Collection finds Miles Davis on a search for self, a search for a sound, a search for an aesthetic, a search for like minds.

albums.title: Venus on Edge
albums.label: Daps
albums.description: On their fourth album, Hooded Fang slip away from their garage rock and indie-pop pasts and embrace a weirder, more wired sci-fi horror vision.

albums.title: Nattesferd
albums.label: Roadrunner
albums.description: The Norwegian metal band Kvelertak find the unlikely meeting spot between black metal blast beats and the anthemic power of Van Halen and Judas Priest.

albums.title: Bloom Forever
albums.label: Stolen Recordings
albums.description: In 2014, Peaches Geldof was found dead at 25, the result of a heroin overdose. After a few lost months, her husband Thomas Cohen finished a '70s singer/songwriter record about his wife and children.

albums.title: Heartbreaker (Deluxe Reissue)
albums.label: Pax-Am
albums.description: The deluxe reissue of Ryan Adams' most beloved solo album highlights that what we loved most about this album isn't misery; it is nostalgia, and fondness for an earlier version of ourselves.

albums.title: Konnichiwa
albums.label: Boy Better Know
albums.description: On Skepta's long-awaited new album, the grime pioneer is full of sneering contempt for popular culture’s industry of image, the press, the police, and the government at large.

albums.title: The Heart Speaks in Whispers
albums.label: Virgin
albums.description: Corinne Bailey Rae's lush new album features Esperanza Spalding, Moses Sumney, R&B group KING, and others. The mood feels wide open, centered on spacious grooves.

albums.title: Under the Sun
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: UK producer Mark Pritchard's Under the Sun is deeply atmospheric and richly impressionistic. Key vocal features from Thom Yorke, Linda Perhacs, Bibio, and others give the album its sense of movement.

albums.label: XL
albums.description: The excellent debut of Soundcloud superstar Kaytranada features many collaborators (Syd! Anderson .Paak!) and many drums. He excels at chopping samples, but his colorful sound is never derivative.

albums.title: Down in Heaven
albums.label: Grand Jury
albums.description: The Chicago rock band turns in a casual, charmingly low-key set of kitchen-table blues, slow-dance serenades, and unplugged power pop.

albums.label: Big Crown
albums.description: Covering 50 Cent, Cat Stevens, Faith Evans, and more on steelpan drums should not sound this gimmick-less. It helps that the Bacao Rhythm & Steel Band is, first and foremost, a strong funk ensemble.

albums.title: Bottomless Pit
albums.label: Harvest
albums.description: On their new album Bottomless Pit, Death Grips stitch together one of their most cohesive grotesques, renewing their focus on songcraft.

albums.title: Get Gone
albums.label: Fat Possum
albums.description: In their mix of soulful grease and punky grit, Seratones feel like a natural, rollicking complement to The Alabama Shakes.

albums.title: Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Electronic music pioneer Jean-Michel Jarre's latest album features guest spots from The Pet Shop Boys, Primal Scream, Cyndi Lauper, and...Edward Snowden.

albums.title: Get In
albums.label: Editions Mego
albums.description: Austrian producer and Mego labelhead Peter Rehberg is a pioneer of laptop music that's at turns abrasive and sublime. His first release as Pita since 2004 is defined by shifts in volume and intensity.

albums.title: A Moon Shaped Pool
albums.label: XL
albums.description: With their ninth studio album, Radiohead move beyond the existential angst that made them music’s preeminent doomsayers, pursuing a more personal—and eternal—form of enlightenment.

albums.title: The Things That We Are Made Of
albums.label: Lambent Light
albums.description: Mary Chapin Carpenter's lean and haunting songs often sound best when they're given room to breathe. The production here by David Cobb (Jason Isbell, Sturgill Simpson) is just the ticket.

albums.title: Spiritual Songs for Lovers to Sing
albums.label: Mute
albums.description: Former WU LYF frontman Ellery Roberts returns with LUH, his new project with visual artist Ebony Hoorn. Produced by the Haxan Cloak, their debut is a vast, swaggering colossus.

albums.title: Take Me to the Alley
albums.label: Blue Note
albums.description: Grammy winning jazz singer Gregory Porter shone on the Disclosure single, "Holding On." But he's got a big career of his own outside of the British brothers. His new album is sweet and serene.

albums.title: Cult Following
albums.label: Merge
albums.description: Laurel Sprengelmeyer's Cult Following is a flowing record with guests including Sufjan Stevens, Sharon Van Etten, the National’s Dessner brothers, and TV on the Radio’s Kyp Malone.

albums.title: The Colour in Anything
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: Clocking in at 76 minutes, The Colour in Anything is James Blake’s wonderfully messy dive into maximalism.

albums.title: Kindness for Weakness
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: The usually-vitriolic indie rapper finds a sense of peace on his sixth studio album, which largely trades in frenetic rhymes for introspective narratives.

albums.title: For Good
albums.label: Totally Gross National Product
albums.description: The first Fog record in almost a decade finds Andrew Broder distilling years of genre-hopping down to a core aesthetic. This is Fog in its purest form: minimal, haunting and darkly impressionistic.

albums.title: In Movement
albums.label: ECM
albums.description: Drummer and jazz legend Jack DeJohnette pairs up with saxophonist Ravi Coltrane and bassist (and electronics whiz) Matthew Garrison, to spellbinding and haunting results.

albums.title: As If Apart
albums.label: Captured Tracks
albums.description: Chris Cohen's warm, homespun albums are welcome throwbacks to introspective '70s singer/songwriter LPs. His latest is touched by the sting of loss.

albums.title: Piatto D'Oro
albums.label: Fool's Gold
albums.description: Queens rapper Meyhem Lauren is a devoted student of NYC '90s rap, and on his latest, he pitches himself as a veteran crime boss too deep in the game to change his ways.

albums.title: Island Universe Story: Selected Works
albums.label: Asthmatic Kitty
albums.description: Island University Story: Selected Works is a condensed version of a three-cassette series that acts as a shadow narrative of Helado Negro's catalog, offering a gratifying variety of sounds and styles.

albums.title: Will
albums.label: Dead Oceans
albums.description: Julianna Barwick's Will is a looser, less polished album than Nepenthe, and that rough-around-the-edges intimacy turns out to be a great part of its charm.

albums.title: Cluster: 1971-1981
albums.label: Bureau B
albums.description: Exploratory yet grounded, futuristic yet melodic, alien and charming, Cluster were among the best krautrock bands ever. This no-frills box set traces their heavenly horizon-to-horizon arc.

albums.title: Beloved
albums.label: Good Cheer
albums.description: Like drawing a perfect circle, making a good power-pop record is an elusive task. Portland's Mo Troper come closer than many have in awhile, with snot-nosed charm.

albums.title: songs from wonder.land
albums.label: Parlophone
albums.description: songs from wonder.land is a theatrical adaptation of Alice in Wonderland set in an MMORPG, and the score is written by Damon Albarn.

albums.title: Luck or Magic
albums.label: Double Feature
albums.description: Britta Phillips' first solo album, post-Luna and post-Dean & Britta, relies heavily on covers, including one of Stevie Nicks' "Landslide."

albums.title: Terminal Redux
albums.label: Earache
albums.description: Terminal Redux, from the Philadelphia outfit Vektor, is one of the most thrilling, forward-thinking metal albums of the year.

albums.title: Another Splash of Colour - New Psychedelia in Britain 1980-1985
albums.label: Cherry Red
albums.description: Originally released as a 13-track LP in 1981, this compilation documents the fruits of New Psychedelia, which set the scene for glammy Britpop, nerdy twee pop, playful college rock, and more.

albums.title: Trágame Tierra
albums.label: Masters of Bates
albums.description: On his second Big Black Delta LP, Jonathan Bates delivers a maximalist take on electro-pop. On these far-reaching songs, it feels like he’s coloring with every crayon in the box, just because he can.

albums.title: Paradise
albums.label: Domino
albums.description: White Lung's newest is more outspoken, more anthemic than 2014's Deep Fantasy, and frontwoman Mish Barber-Way offers provocative challenges to the idea of what it means to be a Good Feminist.

albums.title: White Hot Moon
albums.label: Run for Cover
albums.description: Drawing from emo, pop-punk and '90s alt-rock, Pity Sex trawl the messy depths of failing romances. White Hot Moon follows the course the band set on 2013’s Feast of Love, with a few deviations.

albums.title: Junjo Presents: Wins the World Cup
albums.label: Greensleeves
albums.description: This reissue of a 1982 dub reggae favorite tells a good story, exemplifies a particular moment in Jamaican music history, and offers a new way to hear how dub reggae works.

albums.title: Guided Meditation
albums.label: Lame-O
albums.description: Philly band Hurry's new LP is pure power pop in the vein of the Posies and Matthew Sweet, revealing a band that is serious about its frivolity.

albums.title: HOPELESSNESS
albums.label: Rough Trade
albums.description: On the crushing and glorious HOPELESSNESS, Anohni collaborates with Hudson Mohawke and OPN to create something new: the electronic dance anthem as visceral protest song.

albums.title: Nonagon Infinity
albums.label: ATO
albums.description: Besides being a killer garage rock album*, Nonagon Infinity *is constructed as an infinite loop, meaning its final notes connect perfectly with the album’s opening.

albums.title: Blue Wave
albums.label: Last Gang
albums.description: Blue Wave is the sound of Dan Boeckner and his latest band discovering the secret ingredient missing from so much of the music meant to reawaken the new wave sound of the 1980s: paranoia.

albums.title: The Impossible Kid
albums.label: Rhymesayers
albums.description: Aesop Rock's second album on Rhymesayers and his first in several years is the most specific he has ever been about what he’s thinking or feeling.

albums.title: Egyptian Lover 1983-1988
albums.label: Stones Throw
albums.description: Stones Throw's new anthology documents how pioneering hip-hop artist Egyptian Lover paved the way for acts like N.W.A. and stretched hip-hop into more experimental territory.

albums.title: Crime Cutz
albums.label: DFA
albums.description: Holy Ghost!'s first new music in years is a bright, tight, tense mini-epic, solidifying the band as one of the pillars of the mid-'00s disco resurgence.

albums.title: Honey
albums.label: Rinse
albums.description: The best songs on Katy B's new album show her caught up in the flow of something so overwhelming she can’t see the beginning or the end of it, time expanding and collapsing with her in its center.

albums.title: Close To the Noise Floor - Formative UK Electronica 1975 - 1984
albums.label: Cherry Red
albums.description: This 4xCD box draws on electro-punk, industrial, synthpop, dark ambient, and more, including key early tracks from the Human League, Throbbing Gristle, and Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark.

albums.title: Testarossa
albums.label: Joyful Noise
albums.description: Testarossa, the second-full length collaboration between Serengeti and WHY?’s Yoni Wolf, shows the rapper born David Cohn finding beauty and life in life's smallest details, as usual.

albums.title: Origami
albums.label: 4AD
albums.description: This five-record retrospective box reminds us that while Lush might not have lunged for the jugular like My Bloody Valentine or Jesus and Mary Chain, they were a first-rate shoegaze band.

albums.title: The Feminine: Act I
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Frequent Kendrick Lamar collaborator Anna Wise's The Feminine: Act I boldly presents the plight of the everyday woman. If it's corny at times, it's clever at others. Those triumphs make it worthwhile.

albums.title: Modernists
albums.label: Cantaloupe
albums.description: As modern music moves beyond modernism, the classical community is still scared of the innovations of 75 years ago. Alarm Will Sound tackles those scary sounds and finds new life.

albums.title: DJ Koze Presents Pampa Vol. 1
albums.label: Pampa
albums.description: DJ Koze is a big figure in electronic music, but he also appears to be its benevolent godfather. This compilation of tunes from his label Pampa runs the gamut of sounds, but always stays jubilant.

albums.title: VIEWS
albums.label: Cash Money
albums.description: Drake's fourth proper album feels claustrophobic and too long and weirdly monotone, but the occasional tweaks in sound lead to a few great moments.

albums.title: Diamonds and Pearls
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: By 1991, Prince's unsurpassed run of brilliance had ended, but he still had a lot of great music in him. Diamonds and Pearls had a clutch of future classics along with some odd experiments.

albums.title: Sign o’ the Times
albums.label: Paisley Park
albums.description: Choosing a single high point from Prince’s glorious run in the ’80s is impossible, but Sign o’ the Times surely stands as his most complex and varied statement.

albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: 1999 is the greatest album ever made about partying as a way of staring down oblivion. At the height of the Cold War, suddenly the world felt a little warmer.

albums.title: Parade
albums.label: Paisley Park
albums.description: With "Kiss" as its lead single, Parade reeled in listeners. The rest of the album featured fresh turns of minimalist funk. Prince isn't known for his subtlety, but Parade proves perhaps he should be.

albums.title: Controversy
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Controversy emerged in 1981 at a pivotal time not just for Prince, but for America. It's often regarded as a bridge between Dirty Mind and 1999, but it's fascinating record in its own right.

albums.title: Dirty Mind
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Prince’s first fully actualized album is an unrelenting dance party, its kinky ambiguities blurring lines between genres and genders and pretty much everything else.

albums.title: Purple Rain
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: Purple Rain was a landmark that solidified Prince’s standing as the preeminent pop genius of his generation; more than three decades on, it still retains all of its power.

albums.title: Around the World in a Day
albums.label: Warner Bros.
albums.description: After he conquered the world with Purple Rain, Prince made a hard left turn into bright and sweet psychedelia. But the album had more going on beneath the surface.

albums.title: All Jokes Aside
albums.label: self-released
albums.description: Dej Loaf is the rap equivalent of a well-executed eye roll—simple, excellent viciousness. All Jokes Aside is a record full of nonchalant barbs. Men and/or those messing with her money: watch out.

albums.title: Nocturnal Koreans
albums.label: Pinkflag
albums.description: This eight-song mini-LP from the veteran post-punks includes tracks that didn’t fit on their self-titled 2015 album and is marked by an unsettling, dead-of-night calm.

albums.title: Asphalt for Eden
albums.label: Profound Lore
albums.description: The subversive indie hip-hop outfit Dälek return from a hiatus with a revamped lineup and a newfound confidence and profundity.

albums.title: Interventions
albums.label: Northern Spy
albums.description: On their third full-length, Baltimore drone-rockers Horse Lords prove the rewards of "difficult" music.

albums.title: Triangle
albums.label: SusannaSonata
albums.description: After a wide variety of projects and releases, Norwegian singer-songwriter Susanna Wallumrød returns with a grim and often stirring extended meditation on religion and mortality.

albums.title: The Ship
albums.label: Warp
albums.description: The Ship, Eno's sixth album for Warp, is one of his best solo albums in a while, walking the line between pure ambiance and vocal-driven pop.

albums.title: Balter / Saunier
albums.label: New Amsterdam
albums.description: Avant-rockers Deerhoof team with the elite contemporary classical outfit Ensemble Dal Niente for a weird and wonderful musical exchange.

albums.title: The Stone Junction
albums.label: Interscope
albums.description: After a raft of free mixtapes and years after “Teach Me How To Jerk” blew up on MySpace, Audio Push return with their first for-sale release.

albums.title: Lemonade
albums.label: Columbia
albums.description: Beyoncé is on a roll. Her latest, another "visual album" with corresponding videos in the mold of her 2013 self-titled set, renders infidelity and reconciliation with a cinematic vividness.

albums.title: Double Ecstasy EP
albums.label: Anticon
albums.description: On his new EP, San Jose rapper Antwon raps about sex and drugs and general excess.

albums.title: Always Strive and Prosper
albums.label: RCA
albums.description: Despite the strong production and features including Missy Elliott, Ty Dolla $ign, and Rick Ross, Ferg's latest is mainly about his wise observations on family, fame, and what comes next.

albums.title: New Misery
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: The lead singer of the now-defunct Smith Westerns steps out with a solo debut that furthers the emotional trajectory of his former band while offering a softer approach.

albums.title: Delusions of Grand Fur
albums.label: Easy Sound
albums.description: On their new LP, California indie-poppers Rogue Wave hint at breaking open their songwriting model but keep things modest in the end.

albums.title: At Last!
albums.label: Jackpot Records
albums.description: More than a half-century after its release, At Last! remains one of the greatest records about loneliness ever made: a languid, jazz-inflected paean to (reluctantly) working it out on your own.

albums.title: Dolls of Highland
albums.label: Sub Pop
albums.description: Dolls of Highland melds the voodoo-infused mythology of the South with rambunctious glam rock, and Kyle Craft summons you into its world like a carnival barker wooing customers into a funhouse.

albums.title: Too Many Voices
albums.label: Modern Love
albums.description: On his new album, Manchester producer Andy Stott is still dabbling in dark, abrasive textures while also moving towards something airier.

albums.title: Bergtatt/Kveldssanger/Nattens Madrigal
albums.label: Century Media
albums.description: The first three albums by the Norwegian black metal band Ulver presaged the disintegration of heavy music's stylistic boundaries, laying the groundwork for everyone from Windhand to Deafheaven.

albums.title: Rosecrans
